GbBTXP9SAWIGHreYO3PGeA.text: My family and I came here for AYCE sushi. While the sushi and sashimi we ate were fresh and delicious, the service was mediocre. Our drinks weren't filled until the end of our dining experience; at one point, it took us quite a while to get the attention of our server so we could order more. However, I would give this place another chance as the food made up for the service. The Screaming Orgasm sashimi was mouth-watering, and the rolls I ordered were flavorful and filling.

214pZibJzs5Z9M1GBQwRsA.text: Best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas ! Open to 4am is a big plus for me. Service is always great

H0FwHReKRyVnqOYDKcNVkw.text: Always great service here and it's open til 4 am now which is great! Also very clean and fast service. Fresher fish than most of the sushi places I have been to out here in Las Vegas. Reminds me of the sushi places back home.

RK3Cx_I3L8fQIRxpNYsW2A.text: Man..... Sushi Wa... You have sushi that makes me go "Whaaaaaaa??!" So good. I could not be happier that I came here today.

D2MUtALHblBEmfdhchfMYg.text: This place used to be good but now its going down in quality.  They redo the menu so a lot of items that used to be able to get with AYCE arent available but instead in a la carte.  Every time I go in there now there's new staffs working specially sushi chefs.  The sushi rolls used to be so good but now it tastes so bland. Im feeling like I was eating at Sushi Mon. I will give it one more chance. If it still terrible I will have to change place. It sucks because I've been coming here for years.

vqoDsKTWYV0kA9PUc84D3A.text: This place is great. The food is pretty good quality the service is fast and you can't beat the price. I suggest doing the all you can eat it's the better deal and on top of that you can get all you can drink for 13 bucks more!

6euHxhS6uz-WpCDv-3cusw.text: Been wanting to try this place out for a while since I've always passed by it when driving to work. All the staff  is really nice and the wait time for the food to come out was quick. Food was good and would be coming back in the future.

WM6kGO3NKb4NqVviPXoq1w.text: Came to see why my kids are always here! !! Enjoyed family night together trying new things and great food! We will be back again!! The ramen is the best! Also the dragon roll is great! Decor and server were great!

Tcajq3kBDQbmR72C0s6pCQ.text: Sushi Wa was wonderful. I had to go back the next day just to ensure that it was as great as the day prior.

WefQurQgI_0nyhqemlL4Ww.text: Aloha,    I'm from Hawaii and I eat sushi all over Vegas.  This place by far is the worst place ever and I'll NEVER go back!!!  We ordered all u can eat.   Our server was Hayley, after we ordered our first items, we tried to get her attention to order more items. We didn't place our 2nd order for almost 30 minutes.    If we're ordering all u can eat, you would think she would be at the table more often.  They have no team work.  We asked 2 other servers there to order something, even a drink and they all told us that only our server could get it.  If I was the owner, they would all be fired.   It's called team work.   Help each other out.  After we were done, we had to ask for the bill cause no one seen to check if we were done.  Tables around us got their bill. before us and they didn't seat till after us. Smh.  Never again.   I will let people know that this place sucked!!   We had a piece of hair in our mussel and no manager came by to apologize.  We don't want nothing for free but as a owner/manager they need to go to school and take up business.

pZb8y9uukSdz7TfAUqeVXw.text: They are very polite, professional, and fast service!  Love the all you can eat even on weekends!  The kids price is half the adult and works out perfect!

f6yUbSdPPdX6YBr5jhW7kg.text: Good is mediocre at best. I ordered via uber eats. Service and delivery was fine. They made 2 rolls quickly. Wouldn't choose to come back because it was just okay.

2h56ZTkdYe6w1MDQKcHKyg.text: Very good. Delicious and not stingy w fish or anything. Cold beers and frozen mochi. We enjoyed the attentive waitress who asked us as the plates were 70% gone about our next orders and not stingy w the plates and numbers of rolls. We will be back for more next time in vegas.

4y98MYWb13VYI6Ok-Qvnsw.text: Every time I come here is fresh and unique. In Vegas is the best place for your money. Clean environment, great staff and just great sushi. Highly recommend for anyone to try. JJ is one of my favorites sushi Chef but others are good too. I like the fact that they have cold Sake on draft, they call it bamboo. I wish all sushi places had sake on draft. They should learn from sushiwa.

YxQ8U2cdZ6mK50tr4NqGuw.text: Not my normal AYCE place but this place is good! Nice variety of appetizers. I recommend the fire cracker, who's your daddy, heart attack, and the muscles. We had the Rose roll: baby lobster, scallop, mushroom, red onion, on a Cali roll! As for then nigiri...pepper seared baby tuna!! Love love love it! The portions are not small and the nigiri pieces are BIG!!!

zGFRQ3eAmU2sM1g-1ZxyHw.text: Came here for my bday and the sushi was great! We come here for the AYCE the "sushi" (shasmimi) is always fresh. The white peach blossom drink is super tasty with a fizz, (12$). Favorite rolls in include the Japanese lasagna, the philledelphia roll, and the mango salmon roll! Definitely worth it!

CN5CDhDMVPimKELyGwrw9A.text: Came for a late dinner with my girlfriend around 10pm. We came because we knew it was all you can eat and we were starving! We starting ordering nigiri and we were at about 6 different types but they only come 2 per order so it would have only been 12 pieces shared between the both of us and the server told us to stop ordering because it would be way too much to eat. So we just kind of looked at her and said okay. We got the order and finished it quick because it was little and we were hungry. So my girlfriend ordered an udon and the waitress said that it came with a lot of noodles so we shouldnt order anything else.  Last time I checked it was ALL YOU CAN EAT. We can eat a lot and we were starving. And worse the little bit of food we were allowed to order didnt even taste good. It was mediocre at best. There are many other AYCE sushi places around and I'll definitely be going to those instead now and I recommend you do as well.

hxWgZTRkpVKYDzRuimNcjw.text: This place is the best sushi joint in town. They have great nigiri and other sushi as well. The most important is there is great customer service!

iZEdv3zG9_qY920C61OGEQ.text: Great ambiance and food and great price! There was a wide selection for all you can eat. We enjoyed different rolls and had so much fun of the names of the rolls. Also the Hamachi and Salmon color was spot on! The Staff was very nice. We enjoyed our time there.

yact8m7ImKbhFlJhkRak1A.text: Perfect place. My server was very nice and kind. I love this place!!! If you want the best sushi come here! They are open till 4AM!

YUnx6WhbWREWLt_MEC1L7g.text: I love this place!!!!!!! The sushi was fresh and tasty and my waiter was really nice. I think this is my new favorite!!! Great AYCE deal at lunch and dinner and their menu has plenty of options. YUMMY!!!!!

0KQPRwvsXcl1Vhx_x_Dsjw.text: Diverse selection of sushi, rolls, and cooked food. The AYCE is also reasonably priced and decor is nicer than most other sushi places.

VCNF85YgSJb03lbgBEFUDA.text: When I rate sushi places I factor in food quality, customer service, atmosphere, and overall value. I have been here twice, both times I had excellent service, great food, and overall it was at the right price. Their baked rolls are excellent. Just a heads up, they use a good amount of mayo and other sauces in the baked rolls but they're delicious. Obviously I have been to better places, but these guys do a great job. I recommend them, its a great place to try out.

L5iKh4cBhQqRZQe14spydw.text: SUSHI Waa--heres my order?   Sushi wa-s the server ever gonna take an order?  Sushi wa-it.   Sushi wa-tttt theee FUCK?!  Im sitting in "bamboo jail" as I write with all the Yelpers here for a UYE. We started at 6pm, it is now 8:50pm as I start this review and we are sitting waiting on them transacting everyone out.  Food is still decent, however service is rude and inefficient from our main server. One half of the table was getting service and the other half where I was sitting was kinda ignored a lot more, waited more to put orders, etc. He'd take their order, leave, come back with something for them and then we would have to try to flag him. We'd wave him, he'd say he'll be back and doesn't come back to us or he would walk passed us like we didn't wave at all. A few people had lost orders and instead of saying something kind like "sorry, let me go check on that and get it out"....it's more of remarks like we never put the order, you got it (no someone else got it) ,etc. One of our Yelpers asked three times to get her first order when the other side already on their 2nd round of orders.   I was gonna do 3 stars but now with tge transactions, I'm miffed. First, they wont split the bill and kinda told us we had to just deal with it because they're busy.  We computed what we all owe and wrote in the back which cards to charge what. Now something with POS being the only one for orders and transactions so they don't want to back up orders by transacting all us out so they'll transact when orders aren't coming in. We had a Korean speaking Yelper go talk to him and he was rude about it so she went to talk to the manager who said he will do it in a bit. We had to wait for him and explain everything. It took like 20 minutes of discussing things and explaining how we wrote down what before they went to the back to start. We have no choice but to wait. I'm sorry, but one thing I learned about restaurant hospitality that turnover is important because waiting for a check lowers the impression farther than waiting a bit for good food. People are done and want to just go. We finally got our receipts back and......  they charge my credit card for two drinks and two AYCE.   We wrote everything down clearly on the back on to receipt. We put the last 4 digits of each card to identify them and what amount to charge to each card. HOW is that NOT clear enough? They charged me for someone else.   Okay, so basically then they should give me some cash back then bring back the cash people some change. Well, first time they not only gave me less than what I was owed, but also no change for people with cash. They finally gave it and we left at 9:40pm.  50 minutes to transact is pretty crazy long.   I know it's easy to say that well, it's a pretty a-typical effed up situation. That maybe with the busy place and a waitstaff that doesn't micromanage it well it went down south fast. However, I do have previous visits where I do specifically state how odd the service was odd, not friend and inefficient so that holds True that the waiter service isn't that good here. Also, it got super busy on my last visit towards the end of my dinner and I also waited 20 minutes to get a mochi and 15 minutes more to get my check back to sign so I was held hostage prior to this. So no, it can happen to you in some degree.   Please retrain the staff....and HIRE some good servers. The busboy was polite and did more than just remove plates by checking orders and refilling drinks. PLEASE make him a server and maybe make your rude server a busboy until he learns how to talk to people.   I don't deny the AYCE is good, but if you go then don't go at peak hours, don't sit at a table- ONLY with the nice sushi bar guys and do cash if you have a party splitting the check.   Look at how thorough I was in taking pictures and reviewing individual items because I wanted people to come with my last review. However after this incident I am not recommending it or coming back. I was frustrated all throughout the meal and exasperated at how I was charged and then shortchanged cashback. I haven't felt this way about a dining experience in a long time so 1 star isn't out of line.  There are many AYCE areas in the area including my favorite, Island Sushi whose staff is pure aloha hospitality.  Update- Owner sent a apologetic note....I give him kudos for that and would've given a star for his professionalism. Then a week later I get a anonymous note from someone in henderson talking about me giving bad reviews and how dare I "destroy families". Given that I only have 15 1 star reviews out of nearly 500 and havent given a bad review in ages, it made me wonder. Then I found out other people got the same message that dined with me here so it doesn't take two to figure out our crabby server didn't like what we said. SO unprofessional and cowardly! Your server really made sure we don't come back.

XW6oEiLv_BmYrUa90qQThg.text: It pains me to write this review, but not as much as the guilt I feel for subjecting my friends to the disaster that occurred on Friday night. What I thought would be a fun sushi night turned out to be a nightmare. I left before witnessing said nightmare, but from hearing what really happened, my review would be much lower if I had been there. If I had known what I know now about the service, particularly one waiter, I would have picked one of the many other sushi joints in the area.   Anyways, the sushi was pretty good. Highlights of the AYCE were the very crunchy calamari w/ two choices of dipping sauce, the Hamachi Kama, and the Seared Tuna Nigiri. Portions are big, especially the rolls. Some of the seafood could have been fresher, like the Uni; but, overall, the sushi was satisfactory. The food alone deserves 3 stars.   What doesn't deserve 3 stars is the service. At first, the service was good, our server was nice. At this point, my review was sitting pretty at 3 stars. But as the night progressed, I could tell our server was getting frustrated due to the orders and the amount of people at the restaurant. Large parties are always difficult, I understand that; however, if everyone in the table is ordering AYCE, it shouldn't be difficult to split the bill. Having to leave early, I needed to pay early. After asking our server multiple times if I could pay early, he finally agreed (after saying no initially) and took my card. However when I got the bill, I immediately knew something wasn't right. I was overcharged by $3 or so, but I was in a hurry, so I just paid and left it at that. Service deserves 2 stars.   Maybe the server was having an off night, but I made reservations in advance for our large party, so they should've been more prepared. I'm kind of relieved I missed the fiasco that occurred after I left because if I had stayed, I definitely would have lived up to the Sushi Wa name and cried (*Wa wa*).  For small parties, Sushi Wa is a-ok, but large parties beware!  *EDIT* One of the owners contacted me and apologized for what happened, hence the bump to three stars.

HncaV_nkZU75_PmOsOLAkg.text: When I moved to Las Vegas, Sushi Wa was the first place I had sushi. That was years ago, before they changed over to an AYCE format. My husband is not a sushi eater and Sushi Wa was always a place we could go together for dinner because they serve teriyaki chicken bento boxes all day.   Fast forward a few years... My mother was in town with her boyfriend visiting and wanted to go out for dinner. My husband suggested Sushi Wa. I was a little concerned, I had read about the less-then-amazing experience some Yelpers had at a recent UYE. Since our group was fairly small, we decided to risk it...   The hostess allowed us to select where we wanted to sit and brought out both the AYCE and regular menus. We decided pretty quickly that AYCE wasn't going to be worth the money (it is $26.95 per person, and they limit sashimi to one order per person) since we weren't super hungry.   The three of us split a Philadelphia roll, a spicy tuna salad, and the sashimi combo (4 pieces each of tuna, salmon and yellowtail). My husband had the bento box and we all split an order of edamame as well as two bottles of nigori sake. The sashimi was sliced nice and thick, and I love that Sushi Wa makes their Philly roll with asparagus, gives it a nice yummy crunch.   Total damage with tip was $100. This isn't too bad for dinner and drinks for 4 people, but we really did not have that much food. The decor is very nice and service was decent, we had multiple people check on us throughout the night and never waited long for anything other then the bento box which was understandable.  Will I be back? Maybe someday. There are a LOT of other sushi options in the area though...

CcXfyJq-ZBVe4EQmnH5HVw.text: Sad that I HAVE to give one star.  We came in tonight as it was my fiances birthday. He looked all over yelp to find a good sushi restaurant that he has never been to as we go to them all the time. We saw good reviews and decided to dine here but I will say it will be the first and the last. I am not a fish eater at ALL! I always order my regular katsu chicken. When my fiance ordered ayce and I didn't it seemed to be a red flag to the waitress. Needless to say we know the rules are for ayce and she made them clear several times. Almost to the point that she was accusing us of sharing. We were there for about 2 hours and after our initial dish was served she came rarely to see if he wanted anymore of his ayce sushi. Which is unacceptable. I mean to be served 3 times in 2 hours with no refills even on our water let alone sushi is nonsense. The food was not amazing and the service terrible. Sorry to the others who chose to dine here based on the yelp stars.

Z9L-K8PDSiZ5e6ennsJ2UA.text: Sushi is good but service is so slow, rude and disorganized it makes it impossible to recommend this place.  Too many other sushi places that treat their customers far better.

-0hpmxgl10wp39-Sew6X0g.text: My regular sushi joint. All you can eat includes everything on the menu, and everything is good. They have gluten free soy sauce, if you need it (ask for "wheat free").

k75UwvFARlpM9kCNSxjIcA.text: My favorite sushi place by far. Even the fancy sushi places on the strip don't compare. High quality sushi and you get your money's worth especially with AYCE. Recommend the Rose Roll. Also the peppered seared baby tuna and white tuna sushi is amazing. Can't find a white tuna that compares in any sushi restaurant I've been to.

-WJTaTEVvRmetCq4PCx3qg.text: Have to visit this establishment every time I visit Las Vegas. Always sit at the bar and talk to the chef as they prepare our orders. I like the AYCE so a variety of foods can be sampled. The food is great. I can't wait until I visit again next year!

M45VLPUuPURVfEnnUeD9ZQ.text: Man, this place was so much fun to eat at.  As we all know, I tend to dine solo.  If I'm hungry, I'm gonna go eat.  I can make friends where ever I'm at.  Cue scene: Saturday night 10pm.  I'm starved... After my disastrous breakfast, I realized I hadn't eaten since then. So I check out my trust Yelp for something close yet tasty.  Enter SushiWa and their AYCE.  I think what hurts this place is you have to know what you're looking for or else you will pass it.  I don't like the fact that I can't enter this center off of Eastern if I'm heading south from St. Rose.  If you turn on Coronado Center, it's the first driveway.    I stroll in, and the place is practically empty.  Bad for them, but that means I get my own sushi chef. Yay! As other people have mentioned, the fish is fresh... Very fresh.  Also, they are known for their rolls.  The rolls are very Americanized, which is something that I have a love/hate with.  Some of the rolls had a bit too much sauce for me (I like to taste my fish).  Don't get me wrong, they have sashimi and a limited traditional sushi menu, but it's pretty American.  I can understand the why behind it.  The cool thing is that when I just started asking for things not on the menu they could make it, which sparked an interesting "where are you from" conversation.  THE CHEF EVEN STARTED TO LEARN MY PALATE AND CATERED THE SUSHI TOWARDS ME!  That's service.  That's five stars!  Now, there is a bit of a language barrier with some of the chefs as English is definitely not their first language.  One of them even apologized to me at one point, I told them don't worry about it because it's not like I can speak his language anyway.  Also, I found the Korean influence on the menu interesting.  I'm certainly gonna go back and try the bulgogi.  I also loved that I could keep getting oranges for dessert-- orange that looked like a pumpkin, orange that looked like a cat.  Oh and they have Orion and another beer that is slipping my mind right now.  Whatever it was, it was $9, and boy was it tasty!  The best part was the staff themselves.  Did the waiter forget to refill my tea once?  Yes, but when he saw me pick up my glass and rushed to me apologizing profusely for his mistake.  It actually made me feel badly that he felt so badly about it.  The chefs were so much fun to hang out with.  I was laughing so hard at one point that I started crying.  Joon, Ken, and "buy one get one free" totally made my night.  I didn't feel like I was out to eat by myself, but like I was at a friend's house that could really cook.

Vh9e6JNLH32xFiCfeP5t2w.text: This place is fantastic!!!!!! Some of the best freshest fish I've had. The monkey brain is great. It sounds weird but trust me it's the best. Very classy and clean inside. The service is great. Hands down my favorite sushi place!

57-e_s5nFcwikuepAYd9hg.text: Such a awesome sushi place!! Sushi is fresh with great portions! Decent prices and a very clean and modern atmosphere ! The staff is nice and very efficient! Will for sure  be going back :)

h2gfv11LJypZhnf-xMGFQg.text: My husband and I stopped here randomly and fell in love with it. The combinations of flavors were unlike any other sushi bar I've been to. The fish was fresh and the amount of rice that came with the all you can eat orders were little. The restaurant itself was beautiful. Very clean, modern and inviting.  We will be back and can't wait! Despite being across town.

GBsiC9OR-l1qCtF_3O9zhg.text: The following is my opinion of this establishment.  I WOULD NOT COME BACK.  I wish I could give this place 0 stars.... besides having very bland and in my opinion not fresh fish (I have been there twice - hoping the first time was just a fluke, but it wasn't), last time I was there I SAW 3 COCKROACHES behind the sushi counter!  IN PLAIN SIGHT!  Also, I saw a different kind of bug in their bathroom.  Someone PLEASE PUT THEM ON DIRTY DINING.  Then to make that even worse, I saw a sushi chef drop a piece of salmon and then wash it off.  SERIOUSLY?????!!!!??????  If I hadn't paid for AYCE, then I would have just walked right out right there.  I asked to talk to the manager and this Korean guy named "Joon" asked me what the problem was, and when I told him, he said that was not possible.  I said I SAW IT WITH MY OWN EYES.  He said I had "my own interpretation."  So, when the bill came, I paid it and didn't tip (obviously).  Then as I was walking out, the waitress asked why I didn't tip her.  I said that it was because the place was horrible and there were bugs, then I walked out.  Then that guy Joon followed me to my car asking why I didn't tip!!!  He harrassed me and my friend IN THE PARKING LOT, only 20 minutes after saying that I was wrong when I saw bugs at his restaurant... so then he was saying that I had to tip... and I said that the menu said gratuity was added on for parties of 6 or more, and I was only a party of 2, and frankly ARE YOU KIDDING ME????  Needless to say, I won't be going back.

0KFMiggW45ODL1DItdKvpA.text: Oishii desu yo! Man, I wish I had tried this place long ago. Why have I avoided Sushi Wa in the past? Mostly because their menu used to be pretty pricey and it looked too upscale to take my two rambunctious rug rats to. Unfortunately, that relegated me to eating at too many sushi bars that wouldn't know a fresh fish even if it was thrashing on a cutting board. But along came my chance when some clients thought it'd be a good idea to try this joint. Upon arriving, there were comments about how nice the place looked. In fact, the place looked like it didn't quite belong in a strip mall tucked next to U-Swirl (no offense to U). Sitting down, everyone chose to do AYCE, which meant I had to suppress the desire to order everything on the menu (and to order 10 scoops of ice cream). Yes. I am a pig. When it was time to order, I probably should not have been the one to do so. Here's the rundown of what I can remember: Oyster Shooters - suckas was HUGE! Best to shoot the sake and quail egg, then pick out the oyster. Raw Oysters (3 per order) - too big for me, but good flavor. Soft Shell Crab - I love it that you don't have to have it with rice. Nigiri sushi was impressive for the way the fish drapes over the rice and the quality of the hamachi in particular was notable. Mexican Roll - This was so not my cup of tea. It's like they took the leftover spicy tuna and mixed it with a bunch of crap. Deserts were AYCE, which, if left unattended, I would have shut this place down. Lucky for them I was with clients and didn't get crazy. I actually ordered one of each of the 6 or 7 flavors of mochi ice cream, but I changed my order to two scoops of green tea ice cream and the banana tempura. For better or worse I didn't order sake...this was supposed to be business meeting, after all. But I did check out their alcohol list to see what I was missing and they actually have some really good sake on there. Try the Wakatake or Kurosawa black - good stuff you don't find in most local sushi restos. Why have I avoided Sushi Wa in the past? I don't know! They have it all, ambiance, fresh fish, good sake and all the desert your tummy can handle. Check this joint out at bomb.com.

aNmxlOqPA5BdVzJYu6cbvA.text: Horrible.  Took family there for late lunch because my daughter back from college remembers it being good.  My sushi was worst I have ever had in Henderson (which has a LOT of sushi offerings).  The salmon and yellowtail actually smelled bad --- we should have left, but were all hungry.  The worst was the spicy octopus --- one of the two only had two VERY SMALL cuts of the fish --- for $5.50.  We will never go back there ---- they are MUCH better places to go in Henderson!!!

mhakmKM8ffWaJZTW6q9TLQ.text: Had dinner at this restaurant today and we were very impressed. We got the AYCE and I was actually surprised how delicious the food was. We also really enjoyed the service. The staff was very attentive and pleasant. I also loved the decor, very stylish. We had an enjoyable experience and will most definitely come back!

VSjE-9V-6p8m9Vmih4YijA.text: One word: Excellent!! :oP Try all these for all-u-can eat:  Appetizer: Seaweed salad, Monkey Brains, Miso Soup, Galbi Korean Ribs, & Soft Shell Crab. Sushi: Uniagi Nigiri, Salmon Nigiri, Yellowtail Nigiri, & Garlic Tuna! Rolls: Dragon Roll, Spider Roll, Sex on the Beach, Salmon Skin Roll, & Mango Salmon Roll. Dessert: Tempura Banana Vanilla Ice Cream.

3mxRqUrg4BEHRq1ZLkJeow.text: Can't go wrong with anything you order!  Fresh, lots of choices and delicious!  Will definitely come back every time I visit. My favorite is the Halibut sushi with obo leaf and lemon.  And they pepper seared tuna is so flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

xQS-9iku9hX55OB6ynQohQ.text: Horrible slow service. Manager called server at home to verify AYCE, when we had over eight AYCE and two ala cartes. Server went home during our dinner. We only received half of our order.

bGgT-i4LR62fqAV9AMVh5w.text: This sushi spot has one of the best atmospheres I have ever seen for a sushi place. They offer comfortable half moon booths which also make for a great first date spot.   The service and staff were incredibly attentive, beverages were constantly refilled and food did not take long to arrive.   The one part I felt lacked was the food itself. The miso soup lacked in taste, I am not sure what kind of broth was utilized but I expected more from it. The sushi rolls, while affordable, were not incredibly distinguishable, it was not enough to make me come back for more.  It was ok sushi, but nothing to write home about. Perhaps it's due to the fact they offer "all you can eat" at a very affordable price ($27 at the time of my visit) which means they may have to skimp on quality.   While the atmosphere and staff really shine in the place, I feel there are better locations for sushi in the area.

tU2VLFM62Uv1lP5C-KM47A.text: It's a decent AYCE sushi restaurant in Henderson, NV and worth the visit if you are in the area.  With the standard selection of sushi, I couldn't find a bad choice.  The fish is fresh, the rice is done right, the cuts of fish is precise and service is quick and friendly.  One note, you can pay extra if you want sashimi, but you only have one serving.  I would recommend to make your choice worthwhile, i.e. hamachi.  Also, this would also get you deep fried prawns including the heads.

41dRL5oTrAda3PvOHX1taw.text: Great tasting sushi! Will def be back! Aaron (server) was super legit! And very helpful with picking sushi for us!

6nk64g_Mwj-IekplRHB8kw.text: First time for everything a friend of mine took me there didn't really knew it was close by in my area. I love how the atmosphere is in there especially with the all you can eat definitely coming back real soon. Thank you.

IKUskWa_RoMVXtMQaceq8w.text: This place was great! The bluefin sashimi was phenomenal! Our server Aaron took very good care of us! We had a party of 16 and he as well as the rest of the staff made sure our party was well taken care of! I'll definitely be returning!

BsRCyh8HLJebLlnF7WiP6g.text: It's hard to find great sushi and great service in Vegas but Sushiwa is #1. It has both great sushi and wonderful service/staff. I recommend this place for anyone in the Las Vegas area. The All you can eat price is affordable. Great variety!

eOqhFdp9kukbM_p3iowsQA.text: Just got here, 0110am, slightly drunk, treated me with respect and kindness, for sashimi and sushi at 1am, it was great quality and they were ready the second I stepped in the building. If you are in the local area I would 100% recommend coming here.

d78zeR8-l2JUG4MDMAtrMw.text: Joseph was our sushi chef at the bar and it was/is absolutely amazing! Food was fresh and service from Joseph was great as well! Will be returning and soon!

BQ-AFMdQZJd0OPXwLvMdpQ.text: Good sushi. Reasonable prices good environment. Nice and clean. Great service.. waitress was very friendly and attentive.

NFvC1yXhwKcVzcE0Erw8pQ.text: This is my Favorite Sushi place in Las Vegas. Nicole is the Best. Great service Great food. Great Sushi. Always our go to place when we come to Las Vegas. You won't be disappointed.

SG6zws6OT8GQTo7W-9qJdQ.text: I came here with a friend who comes for lunch, I had the ayce everything was fresh and delicious! They have a great selection you will not be unsatisfied. Great atmosphere. Service was friendly and welcoming and very fast the team works great together. I would recommend this restaurant.

OquSjF8FjQh_SZB-IFj48w.text: No. WE ARE NOT GOING TO EAT HERE. First, we called the restaurant today 04/08 at around 12:15 and we spoke to a girl to ask questions for takeout and she doesn't even know what kind of food they have and she said SHE WAS BUSY. So we went to the restaurant and there's only one server (who answers the phone as well) and approached her if we could order for takeout. 30 minutes later, my husband was waving at her to order as there are only 3 tables so we thought itll be okay to already order as it was more than 30 minutes wait time. The server said, "Sorry I'm busy". So my husband told her "if you couldnt take my order, let me know so I could already walk out." We then left very disappointed.  So we understand that she was by herself taking all orders, taking the food and dishing out. But at least acknowledge the PEOPLE who comes to your restaurant. Despite the good reviews that you guys have, WE ARE NOT GOING TO TRY IT AND WILL NEVER RECOMMEND to anyone due to the fact that the service was horrible.  To whoever that server was (on 04/08, 1am), we really hope the management could read this and fire you. The restaurant doesn't deserve you.

i7z6hAz0p28F67vdWsWbXQ.text: Amazing decor! A place I could take friends or family, I never really liked sushi but I'm very comfortable here, the food is delicious!

2NPvRTmgeRxNfLc7Ek-HsA.text: A-a-Ron is freaking amazing! So we started during and then he told we could get a free drink if we review we totally did that and guess what ... we had even more fun

rsBdoaV2f1eAkcatdQPUng.text: Awesome place off the strip, about 20 mins from the strip. Great all you can eat option and great quality! Love the clean fresh atmosphere that also kid friendly! Would definitely come back here... it's worth the drive!

JOEyUlC6uZiB2Pe_3bLQVw.text: I came here about a year ago, and remembered having a pleasant experience. But, even though I faintly remembered much about it - the salmon sushi left a lasting impression. I came back today, and was pleasantly surprised. When I asked our server why the salmon was so unique and fresh, she said the owner imports fresh every day! Extremely rare for Vegas, as we aren't near the ocean, most sushi restaurants are frozen and costly.   Whereas the AYCE closely resembles Sushi Mon, with fresher fish and closely detailed presentation and flavor. Definitely worth the price, with Kabuki sized salmon sushi that tastes even fresher.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

SYtOg5j4nrfJOj0WvmxbqA.text: Amazing sushi! Hidden gem in Henderson. Clean, great service, and amazing all you can eats

4l-pGV2-vEGRAPGMLzMNrA.text: We do not usually do AYCE sushi places, we usually sit at the bar and do a lot of sashimi. We started with salmon sushi which was really good. Then we ordered the albacore/onion/pickled jalepeno sashimi...it was okay, couldn't really taste the fish. Then we ordered "pimp my roll"...again it was okay. I felt like the salmon sushi was the best and freshest thing we ordered. The rest tastes like they were trying to cover the fish up with a bunch of sauce because it wasn't fresh. We paid more for a la cart and it wasn't worth it. Our favorite places in town are Momo Sushi (on Stephanie) and I love sushi (on eastern).

N3eR3hoTARLEB6BF-8wkSw.text: My dad loves this place and always makes sure to bring me here when I come to town to visit. And I can see why: The variety and quality of the sushi available is top of the line, and the staff/cooks are friendly and informative. Whether you go AYCE or a la carte, it's worth paying too much to spend an evening sampling every kind of roll you can think of and stuffing yourself sick on the wide variety of sushi here. It's expensive but worth it.

cvUQ3fmYQQQ215L59FUSiw.text: Outstanding service the moment you walk in the door. Ambiance is really nice. Not your typical sushi "diner" vibe. Perfect date night, but not uptight at all. Again the service (Jenny) was great. Perfect timing. We weren't rushed. Atmosphere is subtle and has great subdued lighting. We had the AYCA for $23 lunch special. The dinner AYCE is $27. There are many, many traditional (and cooked) and Hawaiian choices if that's your thing too.  The food: The fish was fresh and well constructed. One or two of the rolls were a tiny bit loose on the wrap, but I really have to nit pick to find a complaint. Well presented. More roll choices than your standard sushi place were included. They have this amazing little ball of wonderful call the Pocky Roll, which you dive into with your chop sticks like a blooming onion at Outback. It's albacore, crab meat, a bit of red onion, jalapeno and then covered with a perfectly ripe avocado. It is a little ball of deliciousness! My only improvement would be if they changed the music to Japanese zen background music instead of 80's pop. It's a tiny bit distracting from the whole vibe. Loved it. Will go again for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. The sushi bar at Sushi Wa!
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Inside Sushi Wa
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Wa! A hidden little gem, well worth the adventure!

LJo4wqdQN8HeQIGrj1VqtQ.text: Best food ever. Everything is so yummy. Other than the male manager ready to have a stroke, making sure no one sharing the all you can eat, service is great!

cCYDeXraCQCaueMqmTE_0g.text: A great Sushi place, amazing AYCE sushi menu....gonna take a return visit to try all the menu but was not disappointed on any dish.  Fav was pepper seared Tuna but I love sashimi(available on the AYCE)...so many rolls on the menu it would take 8-10 visits to try it all.  Tapas menu and more!  Becoming my fav sushi place in Henderson bar none

Otbdg_GypZIeDj9uRrQLog.text: Great sushi, great beer, great atmosphere:) the service was prompt and the fish was fresh! Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

GhOAw_d-uZw4zLdYT-9eHA.text: I've been to a couple of sushi restaurants with AYCE and Sushi Wa hands down is the best one. Their staff is great, their food is great, the room ambience is great, and plus its open till 4 freakin' AM like what theee?!?! Anyways, my personal favorite order is favorite roll is the Mango Roll (I'm pretty sure it's only from this place too since from the other places I've been they don't have it) and I totally recommend that with some green tea tempura ice cream!

5dvPiAVz_sesZUx9aGGbwg.text: My go to sushi spot, especially for AYCE! The Hawaiian Roll is UNREAL! It is literally my favorite roll of all time and any sushi restaurant I have ever been to! June and his team make great food and are friendly faces who take good care of everyone. We also love their deep fried banana and ice cream desert to finish off our meals!

LFidxITS5vqzCB_yZjVO1A.text: I've been going to sushiwa for years, it is hands down some of the best sushi in town. I know this sounds sooo generic, but the fish is fresh to death. And their AYCE comes with SASHIMI. Pro tip order the screaming orgasm sashimi and use the broth as a dipping sauce!

IawKJe0kakM9r_GnhDi_ig.text: Fantastic! I'm not even a huge sushi fan and the sushi here is excellent. The all you can eat includes many non sea food items so even light weights like me can have a great time.

nkTy3WJEUrBFuChBnIVBFA.text: Wow for AYCE places this place is amazing!! Definitely will be back again and again! The sushi tastes great and the service is 100%. My new fave sushi spot!!

ZfLFWqCMjFQ9HQB05iRKCQ.text: Love the staff and the spicy rolls! Great music, love the alcohol choices , I love voming here weekly

t24Nq5JEzlejOHhsVPmtVQ.text: The chefs do not deserve this. The food is pretty great and quite fresh. However, the service at this restaurant was absolutely atrocious and quite a hostile environment. When my family and I came here for the AYCE, we expected a great meal. After a few orders, the waiters (and what I assume is the owner) got tired of coming and we were forced to wait 15-20 minutes between orders. The owner brought us our check before we even asked for it and kept staring and laughing at me. I assume this is because I'm a big man and can eat quite a bit. They forgot quite a few of our orders as well. If you have a big stomach but no soul, I suggest you eat here because the owner seems to lack one as well as soon as he sees customers who can eat quite a bit. Otherwise, if you want a non-hostile and nice service staff, I suggest you eat at another restaurant.

UYU0FjR0YZ7Mt4BR0WX3ZQ.text: Me and my boyfriend wanted to try sushi for our first time and we choose the right place! We did the all you can eat which was helpful in trying serval rolls for a good price. Our waitress was very helpful in advising what rolls we should chose! We'll be back for more.

bPXlig_LzND15uRSaO9DPg.text: Soooo good I love this place! Best menu and the saki bombs are On point! The staff is very very nice! And all the food was insanely good

YjzofESfnHynBgqJAnqI-A.text: Did Uber eats. I got the poke bowl and a ramen. Food was good. I was glad they pack the soup separate from the noodles. So I ate the poke bowl for lunch and the ramen for dinner. I will be dining in one of these day to check out what other stuff they got..

5izYpzOmmf1QeknAGMsLsQ.text: Sorry to say the service was aweful from the chefs.   Waiter (nice guy) seated me,  and grabbed me a nice sapporo (yummi).  Then i sat for 10 mins with nothing from the chefs (By the way im at the bar seating). Usually, a hello, let me get u started, how can i help u.  Nope, nothing, just me n my sapporo while dude next to me was chowing down.  So i paid for my beer n left.   I used to come here n had my own chopsticks but now i know why i stopped.    To bad, its close to home.

la3eB1AsCdpR74TlsoZUaw.text: Great sushi and friendly service. Hand rolls are amazing and a must try when you come.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Amazing sushi and great service! Spicy Tuna hand roll was perfection : )

psDXLLLDVjASjp7WtDVFug.text: Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff. Had al a Carte which was good but will have to try all u can eat next time.

QXlhQVyYtsNtKhTNkV8pag.text: This place the shit! Celeste is easily one of the most attentive and reliable servers I've ever had the pleasure of encountering. Everything was brought quickly and with a smile. The sushi itself was nothing less than sublime. The garlic tuna was fresh and the flavor of the sauce was incredible. I Will definitely be back!

QnqnytXQcg1ryHheFgA4YA.text: Having dinner with great friends. Food is awesome. Been here twice. Love this place. Great price for AYCE.

ZcLsyL2oDjy03eChPlLHcA.text: Excellent fresh sushi and great decor. Waiters are friendly and the drinks inventive. If you like sushi you can't go wrong here.

bpoim606SL_0SXnKZLBtHw.text: Looking for a new AYCE sushi and found this place.  Got seated right away, however, we were told that they had a lot of reservations so seating was limited.  Ordered our appetizers and first entrees.  Once the food started coming to the table, it all came at a nice pace.  Rolls were a bit loose, and tended to fall apart easily.  They were a bit large in portion as well, which makes it hard to eat.  They restrict how much of certain items you can have for each person and when we tried to order the Uni and was told they were out.  Service was very good, constantly clearing the dishes and taking orders for next course.  Overall, very good atmosphere, great service, good food.  No complaints.  Will be returning!

35Pap2qv6gstTLEqLFcDuw.text: Went for the the all you can eat lunch and wasn't that impressed. Most of the rolls on the menu had nothing but crab - no shrimp options. Overall food was good and nice place.

WNGQRmRZARhYVC3kKcYA9A.text: Moving to Las Vegas from Los Angeles, I have had a problem finding a decent sushi restaurant. Sushi Wa is the best AYCE sushi joint. You have a wide variety of rolls to chose from plus sashimi (AYCE places usually do not offer) and a great selection of appetizers. Extremely satisfied with this place. It is a little more expensive then other AYCE but the quality of fish makes up for that difference. Strongly recommend!

mjvEvK9oqHfO-vkNggwOuQ.text: Holy hell...everything seemed fine, OK sushi, no bad...but not great, until we saw the ROACHES.  I kid you not.  When someone at the other end of the sushi bar said that they saw a bug, both my dining partner and myself tried to put it out of our minds.  BAD MOVE.  We continued to order and eat, only to have a small brown roach crawl right in front of us, on the sushi bar.  When we wigged out and pushed away from the counter, I happened to look down and saw another one at my feet.  Crap on a cracker...I was GROSSED OUT.  The worst part??? The waitress wasn't even freaked out by it....she simply walked over and went after them with a napkin....like she deals with it all of the time.  Googly moogly.  They took 30% off of the check (really????), which we didn't even ask them to, we'd have paid full price...we just wanted to leave.  I didn't know upon leaving what I wanted to do more...throw up or shower.  Super disappointing because the place looks elegant and clean.  Nasty.

izhxnwIxOT4DEk2wZu9uLw.text: Love this place. The Superman burrito roll is an addiction! This place also has some of the freshest sashimi in town. I live in Summerlin and drive over here for sushi. This place never disappoints.

F_FfqoGGnba9zBWwuKHd6Q.text: I would really love to give this place more stars because the food is good but the service is HORRIBLE!  They sat us and then took all more 15 mins before some came over brought us menus and took our drink order.  It took forever to get the waitess to come over and take our order.  I order the simplest rolls out of the whole table and did not recieve my rolls till everyone had recieve their rolls and were finished eating.  This isn't the first time I have been here, I gave another chance and both times the service was awful.  They need to hire more staff.  Don't go here if your in a rush because even lunch took us over 2 hours.

yIDug2ISe3yrURqAEqying.text: I've gone to Sushi Wa several times now, since it's literally within the same business complex as my work. The big perk for me was the "1/2 Off Lunch" special, which had sushi (6-8 pieces) for anywhere from 2.50 to 5 bucks.  They no longer offer this, and the 'new' lunch specials are meh. I dont go to sushi places for california rolls. $9 for a few pieces of veggie tempura, chicken/beef teriyaki, and 4 cal rolls with a small salad.  The food itself is good, and service is nice.. But I usually planned to gorge myself on decent sushi for $10, not a cheapie bento.  Of note, they do have an 'all you can eat' for $21.

sgAqkJ5wvVmpQckjU5dRSw.text: Pretty good sushi for the most part, nothing special to yelp about. Decor is semi modern and there are some intimate looking booths to sit in, but we were not even given that option for some reason. Service is very good and refills of drinks happened very frequently. Good rolls, but like I said nothing that really stands out. I had a order of UNI, but it wasn't really that tasty. It needs to have that fresh ocean taste that only True UNI fan will understand, mine had that unfavorable "mediciney" taste to it. I often order UNI at sushi places and it takes 10 to 15 minutes for it to come to the table for some unknown reason, maybe it's frozen and needs to be thawed out? Well the UNI at Sushi Wa came out right away, but tasted off.  The All you can eat price is a few dollars higher than all the rest, but then again it's not a huge negative, but just saying. I REALLY  don't like to hear loud obnoxios hip hop music when I am trying to have a decent dinner. I guess they are catering to the young crowd, but it would be cool to have some traditional Japanese lounge music playing softly in the background? I would actually trade loud conversation from diners than listen to loud music.

CTaf6PCIjA5VAKU2DyyBhw.text: I was at a party with a friend and they said they were hungry, so I pulled up the Yelp app on my Android smart phone and search all restaurants that were still open in the area; it was about 10:50pm on a Tuesday.  Sushi Wa came up displaying a 11:30 closing time.  We got there at 11:10 and set at the bar, the owner came up and told us they closed at 11:30 and that our choices were limited.  I told them we only wanted Sushi and they said no problem. Roy and Ken were the chefs and did a great job.  I served them a few rounds of Black Raspberry Saki and they were more than happy to stay and talk to us.  Great guys and they really seem to love their job.  We ordered their version of a Screaming Orgasm which was very good.  It has a more liquidly dressing but is spicier. There was so much dressing left over that we asked for more Daikon. Ken obliged us with a mountain of the stuff.  We also had the Blue Fin sushi-mi on Roy's recommendation, which was excellent.  Sushi Wa is nicely decorated and very elegant. Perfect for a nice romantic date with plenty of booths that seem to be pretty private.  I will go back if anything just to see Ken and Roy again.  Great guys.

hAIIqW3FrAUz2CqgMmzqmg.text: I love sushi, and this is hands down one of my favorite sushi places in Vegas! The atmosphere is amazing and it's decorated perfect. There are a mixture of booths and tables that are all spaced out perfectly so you never are too close to another group, unlike some other sushi places that can be very crowded and you feel like you're sitting with the table next to you. I always get the AYCE sushi, such and amazing deal! The cucumber salad is some of the best I ever have had, and I have never not enjoyed a roll I have gotten. Unfortunately I live on the other side of town now.. closer to places like OYSHI, but every time I go somewhere else I just miss this place terribly. The staff is always super friendly and the owner is usually there and says hi to tables. My one friend is a regular and they always take great care of us and everyone who dines there. I truly recommend this place for anyone who lives sushi, it's THE BEST! You won't regret it!

Wa6C2yYWufm35unjYjAaQQ.text: I just finished my shrimp tempura roll and California roll, and I had to write a review for this place, because it is excellent. I'm new in town, and don't think I'll bother trying to find another sushi place in Henderson.   I didn't dine in, just got carry-out, but the girl that took my order was extremely friendly, was happy to accommodate my requests, and even offered me a beverage while I waited. I'll be back to Sushiwa soon!

_TaLyh89Sz8kCR0IK7ft-g.text: Mmmm. yum. even for the veggi... The all you can eat menu for lunch is a GREAT deal. I recommend going at odd hours, like after 1:30p for lunch and after 7:30pm for dinner. If you go during peak hours the quality of the preparation is a little limited, but not enough to lose some stars. Love the Vegetarian (requested) bikini roll!!!

ZI2L9_we1euR_VQgPPJD2Q.text: My new favorite place.  I have always loved I Love Sushi and still do but the atmosphere was 10 times better and the food was great you have to try the Who's Your Daddy appetizer and all of the rolls we had were great.

6tsPsLg8zg3MsYYratYGTw.text: First time there...they have plenty of staff and the rolls and drinks keep coming...sushi and rice are fresh and bomb ski!!!! Must go...all u can eat is right price!

iAXTw4LQQztn2gtHtZx81w.text: Phenomenal! The fish was delicious. You really can taste the difference from other sushi joints. Roy was my chef, he was fantastic! I had the Ultimate Salmon Roll, Garlic Tuna, Phillie Roll, and the Pimp My Roll. Everything was wonderful, especially the garlic tuna. I've never had fish that tasted so fresh and just melted in my mouth. I found the Pimp My Roll to be too spicy for myself, but the flavors were good. I will definitely be going back for more!!

es9T6YtW-rcVYhFtjqU2QA.text: Went in tonight for a dinner, the food was good, but the customer service is the worst! Every time we ordered more stuff she always inpatient and bad attitude ! Let us Felt like we shouldn't order more, and she lied to us said the regular ice cream only 1 per person , and I told her I been here a lot it was always been unlimited for Ice cream! And she admit the Ice cream is unlimited , but she said " you all had 2 ice cream already I think that's enough for you!!!!!???? Are you serious?! You going to a all you can eat place and a waitress tells you that you have enough ??? I don't think she's the owner that will worry the clients will eat too much ! I think she just so lazy to get us food!  I used to be regular here ! But definitely will never go bak ! The food is no difference with other sushi place , but getting treated like this so not wort it!  If you are looking for a all you "can't" eat place this is it!!!!

NiI2xgi5aKRngIGS3wC53A.text: Had a lovely lunch with my friend. The Scallop roll is to die for! sushiwa is one of my favorite places to lunch in Newer henderson....it is so relaxing and the staff is friendly. The Sushi chefs are absolutely adorable!

yot3gNPUMzL0WaQ8QHp48A.text: Sushi Wa is incredible.  I am not a huge Sushi fan, but Sushi Wa is delicious.  I am a big fan of their chicken and rice.  The wait staff is extremely friendly and will answer any questions you have.  The atmosphere is great for hanging with friends and even birthday parties! I highly recommend Sushi Wa!

NfYTFIYUFft0-vG4xLYn0w.text: I 100% agree with Alex N. It wasn't that the fish was bad it was more like the whole thing felt like the McDonald's of a "chic sushi restaurant".

bE9pcsNlaz2hT3ItH5TAKg.text: My boyfriend and I came in at 5 pm on a Sunday. There was hardly anyone else eating at this time, so the service was very fast and efficient. The rolls were HUGE and really tasty. The AYCE is definitely worth it. I recommend the Screaming Orgasm Roll. The only iffy thing was the Korean short ribs - they seemed a little undercooked, so I'd stick to sushi.  Regardless, I'll be coming back again.

Bv4mEfcIXzps02vHpB4hdQ.text: We had a very pleasant experience dining here. Our server, Miko, was perfectly attentive and provided great recommendations. The house Saki is nothing to cheer about and I won't order it again. Food highlights were the green lip mussels and the "Sex Bomb". They were excellent and worth having more than once each visit! I think the only damper on the evening was their choice of music/entertainment channel.

wGWghtnXhGUfnonekxGp_g.text: Ambiance is modern and sleek. Service is good; the employees are nice and helpful. The fish is fresh and the rolls are amazing; i got the garlic tuna sashimi and several other rolls that were pretty good. They serve beer and sake; I got the cold house sake.

rgfOKwPvNB7FuWrKpLRh_Q.text: Great AYCE menu! $23 for lunch and $27 for dinner. Very extensive and includes hot tapas and the most delicious banana tempura you've ever had! The service is a little slow sometimes, but definitely worth it. The Rose Roll is a must have at this restaurant!!

pPZI0TmQ0te9hh64Q7Gd3w.text: Always a great meal at Sushi Wa, my go to place for all you can eat sushi. The quality of the food is top notch. Friendly staff, and very attentive. The all you can menu offers is amazing, with many items not offered at other sushi restaurants.

mWor4J8expdWgpaWbL2Zrw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to go to Sushi Wa and it was an amazing expierence.  Ricky and Juan were are servers and they were over the top.  Everything was more than u can expect and would recommend this restaurant to Any one who is looking for a sushi spot to go to. Sushi wa is the way to go. !!!!

wlnFJD0vaexpXkMqj03CSg.text: So disappointing! Came here because we were going to an event next door afterwards. Stuff we ordered showed up when we were finishing up then their machines went down. It took 45 minutes before they went back up and they didn't offer anything for the inconvenience!! I will never be coming back!

mN-ryL25Q1top74SGcZw6g.text: We came in today to celebrate some birthdays in our family. The food was decent; the service was terrible. We ordered the AYCE. I waited almost a half hour for my first roll. Our other guests ate three rolls and I hadn't even received one yet. When I asked one of the servers or he would check on my roll, he was rude. Honestly, the service was deplorable. They forgot to bring much of our food and we had to ask repeatedly where it was. To make matters worse, their point of sale system was down and after 45 minutes of waiting for the check, told us we would have to pay in cash. It'll be the last time I come here!!

wvZGYxCZePYY0GP0r0i8SQ.text: First time here. Recommended by a friend and it's  The nigiri options are  and they had my favorite: hamachi kama  The hot tea was refilled quickly and the ambiance is the kind of intimate modern that I like. (Especially when the lights were dimmed and the color changing neon light accents were activated) Our server Aaron was funny, helpful and attentive. I'm still here but thinking about my second visit already!

tCyO0nURSgdBq3UORLgv7g.text: The food selection was amazing. Came by after work with a group and we had a lot of amazing fish to choose from. Definitely try their Albacore with Jalapeno sashimi or White tuna sashimi to start. There are some limitations to the AYCE but definitely loved the variety on both sides of the menu. Their spicy tuna and Uzura was amazing! I would have posted pictures but forgot to once the food came. But trust me when I say that the food was amazing. Staff was super friendly and prompt with seating, drinks, and our appetizers. Loved the special that they had for us leaving our yelp review about how bomb their food was. If it's your first time here, ask for Aaron !

gZfOyFKuzfphO3r5YMZ5eA.text: This one of my go to places for sushi. The baked mussels are amazing. The firecracker appetizers are amazing. I always order the super white tuna, mussels, firecracker, miso soup, and a couple of the same rolls each time. I absolutely love the space. My kids love it there and they never charge me for sharing with my 3 year old and 13 month old. The reason I deducted a star is because the service is sometimes hit or miss. The servers are usually pretty good, but I'm assuming the shorter man with short black hair barking orders is either the owner or the manager. He tends to start berating servers and will even go as far as pointing to your table while berating them and it makes us uncomfortable.

bPlUOOzF9jzXVLiYIWgHAA.text: awesome place to go to. good sushi place. you get yours moneys worth! get the hamachi kama and soft shell crab.

sYEUr8_5UrqxH-yF7fzKfg.text: Came here with friend on a weekday late night, because they open until 4am. What I didn't expect was the great qualities of food, definitely the best Japanese place I know that's affordable. Salmon sashimi was in huge cuts and tasted amazing. c0c-kXBWB0jRl51tZwCmDQ.text: We arrived around 730pm and the service was lousy in this place.   The guy took about 10 min to seat us looking around for a table, even though the place was 1/2 empty.   I was there for a business dinner, 2 people, and we both got AYCE.   They kept forgetting stuff we ordered and would bring the wrong orders to our table.   It also took FOREVER.   After a while, we just ate whatever they brought by because it was getting late and we had to work the next day.  The sushi was just ok.

cDB-OCTBIFrTFSPgpHq_Og.text: Sushi Wa Located in Henderson , a nicely decorated all you can eat sushi and Japanese restaurant offering a variety of sushi and Japanese inspired entrees and appetizers. This place is Yelp friendly as I noticed they suggest you ask how to get a free drink or app from the server.  My only confusion was that they wanted my to write the review before I obtained my free drink right there on the spot which didn't make sense to me as I don't review a place for he most part until after a few times even. So I mentioned I'd show them my review next time I come in !  I tried a variety of nigiri, sashimi, hot appetizers and they were all good. I generally don't go to all you can eat sushi spots but this one hit the spot ! Their service was more than exceptional.  I think next time I go i will try the Ramen!

YTysDoVd54spJYFnC2CqOw.text: We had a pretty good experience at Sushi Wa. I'm glad they stay open till 4. We came in around 2:30AM and were the only ones there. It was nice, but I hope they get busier during the late hours.   Our server was very nice and polite. She took our orders promptly and the sushi chef was very nice too, checking in on us.   We liked the salmon sashimi, I liked their ikura too. Their spider roll was one of the best ones we've tasted too.   The bikini and lava rolls were also ones that stuck out to us. They were pretty big portions.   For dessert we did strawberry mochi ice cream, pretty generic but good:-)  Would definitely come back for the ayce when I'm back in Vegas.

mTFy4_Y8sSSrlHTHTJsRpA.text: Say it in a Snookie voice... "Sushi Waaaaaa". Wow, what a dated reference.  This location is right next door to my barber and I've been wanting to try this place for the past couple of months. Sushi Wa has the basic look and feel of the old standard sushi bar, but with food items like the Super Spider Roll, Shrimp Killer, and the Superman Burrito Roll, needless to say the menu is far from basic.   I rolled in (pun intended) around 3pm and the place was empty, perfect! My lunching partner and I sat at the bar and ordered a small meal because we were in a bit of rush. We stayed on the beaten path as far sushi orders go with Spicy Ahi Tuna Roll, Calamari Tempura Roll, and a bowl of Udon. Like I said, "we were in a rush", which now I realize is bad idea to go to a new place and not take the time to snack on their interesting and funky faire.   The Calamari Tempura Roll was plated beautifully and set the tone for my hunger right off the bat. The large rolls filled with crab, avocado, and coated in a tasty fish sauce were not only easy on the eyes, but they didn't stand a chance against to my chopstick to mouth skills. This plate was accompanied with a generous helping tempura calamari along with little dollops of japanese mayo and dots of spicy oil in the center. Amazing!  The Udon was a nice break from the calamari munching mayhem. The noodles were cooked to firm perfection and the broth would have been slurped down with a straw if the server would have obliged my gluttonous tendencies. The fish cakes and tempura veggies that came with soup were a welcomed addition to this large bowl of awesome.   The Spicy Tuna Roll, fell flat. I mean like Wile E. Coyote falling from a cliff flat. So much so that I didn't finish it, which says a lot. Who doesn't finish sushi? I can't quite put my finger on it, but it just had an interesting texture and a weird flavor profile.   This location still gets a 4 stars because just like the majority of the meal, the service was stellar and I didn't walk out feeling like my wallet was just bent over and taken advantage of. I will be back to try aforementioned rolls and this time there will be no time crunch, just seaweed wrapped, saki soaked, sushi eating enjoyable dining.

KzL28M8nBWZbIMK-sli0mA.text: Sushi Wa has officially become my favorite sushi place in Vegas.. even if it is on the complete opposite side of town for me.  The sushi bar is stupid busy, and they get food out fast.  My friend decided we were doing AYCA sushi for me, lol, and I usually worry about these decisions because I usually don't down a lot of sushi in one sitting.  Buuut, this AYCA includes sashimi,  and appetizers, and dessert.  There was LA kalbi on the menu, and I get it's portioned small because it's an app and it promotes variety, but damn they were good.  They were done so right, and this was my friend's first opportunity try some Korean BBQ. Yeah, this is another sushi place run by Koreans, and it's good.  She got their garlic edamame and I got the spicy one, it's actually spicy.  I liked it more than I usually like edamame.    We got the rose roll, and it had lobster and baked scallops and sauce and sweet  onion and was really tasty, her favorite is the ultimate garlic tuna roll, it's on a plate surrounded by garlic sauce.  We got salmon sashimi, and this other roll with white tuna on top and I forgot what it was called, and bunch of other stuff I can't remember the names of, I can't remember the menu, but just eat it.  We got coffee and green tea mochi ice cream, it was a nice little end.

7VvBrMnovhRWD9GqpaH8cw.text: We used to love this place..  Got taken care of by this server Mark. (Barely checked on us) All I can say is TOO MUCH RICE. The portion of the rice is more than the portion of the fish.  Fish quality, awesome!   We used to come to this place all the time. Used to brag about this place to all my friends. Now, I cant.. I seriously can't anymore. When we brought to the manager's attention that the rice portion was ridiculous (now I wish I could have taken a picture of it) he was totally cool about it and told us they'll fix it but the server came up all irritated and told us they can't tolerate it and will have to charge us next time we can't finish the rice. Server barely checked on us, it was mainly the manager. Server didn't smile for the most part.  Just super disappointed. We thought so highly of this place before & loved it so much that no matter how long the drive was,  we would go for the overall quality of the restaurant.. heartbroken Still tipped them good ;) cause it wasn't all bad. Manager was very personable :)

RJNqDe4nnzN98LATHYL1Ww.text: I'm a little upset about my visit tonight at Sushi Wa. My family and I go there just about any chance we get, but due to changing schedules, new jobs, etc. it has been about a month since we came in last.   We were seated quickly, in a booth that we requested- there were a couple at a table, a few people at the bar, and one other booth occupied when we arrived.   We noticed right off hand that the menus were new. Which made us wonder if the management or owner had changed- because it was a completely different style.   The waitress, who didn't introduce herself wasn't one that we had ever seen before. She brought back our drinks rather quickly, and took my boyfriends order, but as soon as I opened my mouth to ask for my rolls-she walked away. And she didn't come back until she delivered our first order of food.   When I did ask to order, her face completely changed. It was shocking to me.  At first I thought it was just me, but my boyfriend saw it as well. It looked as if I was severely an inconvenience to her, and as if she had somewhere to be.   I know that menu items take time, however, with a restaurant that isn't even 1/4 full, waiting 30 minutes for two rolls that were ordered by my boyfriend the first time is a little silly.   The food was still delicious, I recommend the sex bomb, bonsai, crispy rice, and the seared peppered baby tuna. However, it's the worst service that we have ever experienced-and I'm disappointed in sushi wa. Hopefully this was just a fluke.  Also, they do not have child pricing.  So a five year old will cost you the same $28 for an adult's dinner.

TOwUGwNE6SkkNNg9Acv16w.text: I'm totally disappointed! My husband and I go here to eat all the time, we left town for about a month and when we returned the first thing we wanted was sushi.  We noticed after we sat down that the menu and  prices had changed, and also the "rules" for AYCE. Then we waited 20 minutes for 2 rolls and a miso soup. (We were the only 2 people in the restaurant)So sad we really love the staff but the service and quality have left the building.  We've  gone back once since, hoping it was a fluke....... but unfortunately we had the same experience.  There are SO MANY OTHER CHOICES.  Sorry guys!

This made no sense to us because we were well aware that there can be charges for left over food. This honestly ruined the mood and the food which is why I took an additional star from my review.

zgRnVXe3rJ7uIWPoiIXHNA.text: I have never had sushi as unique and amazing as Sushi Wa. The owner and staff are awesome, and the AYCE idea is brilliant and a great deal. The rolls are phenomenal and the ambience is really nice for a group dinner or even a date night! TVs, bar, large dining area, everything you'd need. I have eaten sushi in pretty much every state I have been to or lived in, and I have been to the most well known and highly ranked sushi restaurants in the Bay Area as well as Southern California and Hawaii. Sushi Wa comes close or is even better than any of them. Something about the restaurant and the rolls I just really love. I hope everyone gives it a try! Great location too.

2R9Y8QE6U-VcBB4rVU_Z1g.text: Kind folks & great service made this dining experience pleasant. That combined with the food made it great!  The Albacore with Jalapeno sashimi was delicious. It was much more robust than imagined with the albacore seared and wrapped around pickled red onion and then topped with a sweet garlic-ginger sauce. The sauce, for me, was too sweet, but then, I just don't love super sweet things in general. Once I dabbed off some of the sauce, it was great.   I also had the 911 roll with no rice. They were so accommodating, and it was fabulous! I loved the fresh fish, and the spicy & savory sauce. The avocado added a wonderful richness, and the micro greens gave it a nice peppery taste. I loved every bite, though I probably could have only ordered this and a glass of wine and been completely full!

k_l-5iW6IP_LSz7iUiho6g.text: Came here with a friend and the food was very good. Definitely a hole in the wall. The decor inside was beautiful as well. The only thing I wasn't a fan of is they only do half rolls on your last order, and i'm the type that loves to try all different types of rolls.
