_563asWbuQX56Et42qq-xg.text: They sat us right away. Love the vibes. Definitely get the volcano roll! Dope af place. Weird music though.

SVsdPjY9EwQHydkuLNtsAw.text: Went here around 9:30pm on a Sunday and asked to sit at the bar. The place was pretty empty just a few people inside. The waiters were a bit slow given there weren't many people, but the sushi chefs were talkative and friendly, especially Joon, he's funny. The inside was a bit dark, had like a fancy restaurant layout. I recommend sitting at the bar if you want your sushi quick. The sushi were well made and the rice to fish ratio was great - small portion of rice and large portion of fish (as seen in the photo). I recommend getting the Rose Roll (Sushi Wa Specialty Rolls) was amazing. It was like a sushi roll piled up with the Dynamite. There were mushrooms, scallops, and baby lobster smothered with their special creamy sauce and oven baked. Yum!  The sashimi (part of the ayce) was fresh and thick. The Ebi (Sweet Shrimp) Nigiri was interesting because it had a special sauce on top that was very delicious and went well with the sweet shrimp. First sushi place I've went to so far that had this done.   The menu, as a first timer, was a bit confusing something I think they should work on because for example, the menu made it seem as if you can order one order of sashimi for each type of fish. However, it is one order of sashimi in general, so choose wisely. Another was how difficult it was to tell which was included in the AYCE and which were not. Also, I didnt know what kind of appetizer was appropriate to order from the waiter/waitress or the sushi chef. Those made it a hassle having to remember.   **If you want a free soft drink, sake, draft beer make sure to write a review and show them so you get it! :) **They are open pretty late, I think until 4am. Nice if you have those late night sushi cravings. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Sex Bomb (their most popular roll)
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Scallop Popcorn
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Soft Shell Crab (one order per person) Not really recommended as the crab portion was so small.

RXKW8N0ZC7gy5ZvdSLt81A.text: Sushi wa is my everything. Its quality AND quantity. I dream about the garlic tuna everyday. If I could I would come for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I don't live in vegas anymore but when I come back I make sure to come here at least once! Do yourself a favor and bask in the wonderously delicious sushi wa!

yt0SD6XDQqSJnGWbcIDG4g.text: Took my girl here and we sat at the bar. At first we got some ramen and some sake and some rolls. Our server let us know that if we got another roll we should just switch to the all you can eat and drink option because it would be cheaper. She earned herself a great tip. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for either ramen/sushi. Order up!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

uy9b3Zo_TAuN-UND4SE1KQ.text: I have been on a sushi binge lately and have tried several AYCE restaurants in the area. This ranks pretty high up on my list. I will definitely come often especially with friends or on a date. The decor is nice, with high backed circular booths and high backed dining chairs. This place is packed on a Friday night. The appetizers are delicious, they have one order of sashimi allowed with the AYCE. The sashimi is thick cut and fresh. I ordered the Superman Burrito roll and it is indeed big and tasty. Must try appetizers are pork belly and soft shell crab tempura. The nigiri are small so you don't have to worry about filling up with rice. I have to mention the pork belly which is amazing. I rank this as good as Naked Fish and Jayde Fuzion in terms of taste and quality. Definitely 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Dynamite- greasy
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Agadashi tofu, pork belly which is so good, and tako yaki.
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellowtail collar and soft shell crab. Both really good.

OnoIo23jeaGyWjQcdlla5w.text: Oh yay!!  Happy that I stopped in - had this place bookmarked for awhile. Had the ayce - started with yellowtail sashimi, poke salad, mango salmon roll (oh my goodness I'm full) and a dynamite hot tapa. Everything was delicious!!  Super fresh- excellent service too. This will be on my regular rotation.

VCgrnISx6OsFvOsHmrxOrQ.text: I love this place, I have never been disappointed in the food, everything taste very fresh and the service has always been great. I have been coming since moving to Vegas, that was over 10 years ago now. I have tried other places and I always come back to this place.

fXAKlpLr_kVDVfPYinsfuQ.text: The AYCE sushi on Sunday night was amazing. Aaron was the best server I've had ever. He was super attentive and very funny! We had a big bday party, and he accommodated us all so well. Thanks Aaron!!! We will be back

RimYO-XwHrcKTvESyJrt5Q.text: this is my family go-to sushi place, i have never had a bad experience here which is saying a lot considering i've been here over 10 times. my family always comes here for special occasions and they are very accommodating for bigger parties. my favorites from here are the screaming orgasm, superman burrito, and the who's your daddy, they are too die for!! i would definitely give this place a shot if your in the area!

1Sde0qdtc1A7giS_XBNeBw.text: This is my go to spot for sushi. Service is great and the food never fails. You will definitely never leave hungry!

p9FOgCuP-rq2XdjDX9HrFg.text: After trying several sushi restaurants in the Henderson area we've settled on Sushi Wa as our go to place. The ambiance is great, the restaurant is clean and the staff is wonderful. I recommend sitting at the bar and having a conversation with the sushi chefs. Joon Son (owner) was awesome, he delighted us with his personal choices of fish, shared some great stories and made our time memorable. If you are reading this post please check out Sushi Wa, sit at the bar and enjoy the company and food.

IxGn1dhmIMCCahgVG2i8fA.text: I thought this place was pretty good. All farm raised fish, but the service was good and the food was very nice. There was a roll with lobster that was to die for. Much better than the other places in henderson

2kBCLqbfl7w-CtAxzC9tpw.text: This place was okay. I came here with my friend and we sat at the bar. We ordered a couple rolls and I asked for no avocado on mine. An order comes and I start eating it but it tastes nothing like what I ordered. So I let my friend have some. Then two orders came. One was the one I ordered and the other was what she ordered. Mine was loaded with avocado and hers had completely none! The taste was pretty good, nothing too special. But service sucked..

sKrCFjKGpdo7E7K8R1x9Pw.text: having been there several times I can say the food is good but their customer service is truly awful.  Just had my third and FINAL experience bad customer experience.  They do not even try tobe customer friendly.  They are doing you the favor - not like you are paying for their sushi.

j-ZgkvjdMmOya-_9eZZ4rA.text: I've been to many AYCE sushi places around town, but this one has, by far, the most rice and the least fish.  All the rice you can eat, with a little fish on top. I will not be back.

vap7WLOxP83iKmQCya7mcg.text: 4 or 4.5.  I went here with my SO when he was visiting because we already went to Osaka that week and wanted to try a new place.  The fish is super fresh. They have the normal rolls, but their special rolls are amazing!  The decor is great, definitely chic. You don't feel out of place in jeans and a T, though. We went here late afternoon. The LSU game was on (SO went to LSU) and it's a nice place to watch sports. It was interesting...all of the sushi chefs were into the game, but normally at other places that means the rolls take forever to get finished and are low quality. All I can say is...great multitaskers! The rolls were awesome, the fish was top quality, it wasn't busy, very attentive staff.  Try something new and order a roll that sounds intriguing. At some sushi places I am not happy when I do this, but everything here is described well and they tell you exactly what to expect. YUM!

KMnRNb1mBIeNmxh5L21zOg.text: I was nervous about dining here as we'd noticed that many yelper friends had rated it just below taking a cruise off the italian coastline :). Alas, we were nearby and the Mrs and I decided to roll the dice.  Taking a gamble paid off. The yellowtail nigiri was some of the freshest and highest quality cuts I've had in Vegas. I thought the salmon was gonna swim off the plate and it tasted like butter.  We also tried the Pocky roll which is about 10lbs of avocado with some crab and albacore inside. I love avocado so this was yummers but it might be too much for some.  I've been back 2 more times, we did the all you can eat once. The price for all you can eat is competitive with other restaurants at this level but maybe even a little better as you get at least one serving of sashimi and one or two other specialty items which you wouldn't usually get with A.Y.C.E.  Highlights: -Pocky Roll -Mango Salmon Roll -Pokey Ahi Salad -Salmon Nigiri -Hamachi Nigiri -Banzai Roll -Good selection of asian beers including Hite which I didn't see on the menu but they did have in stock

QBVCycQtAWbRLPlrNKKZFA.text: I have eaten here three times. The first visit was with a sushi group from meetup.com. The fish is as good as it gets in the middle of the desert hundreds of miles away from the ocean. The rolls inventive enough to keep your interest. The service while attentive isn't top notch. Too many rules to follow should you choose the AYCE option. Tonight, while entertaining friends from out of town, I had a truly unpleasant experience paying the bill. Without looking at the check, a credit card was presented and charged. They added an additional 20% gratuity and labeled it as TAX. Then they added sales tax to the total INCLUDING the gratuity. When we questioned the charge, the manager said they automatically add a 20% gratuity to parties of five or more. I pointed out their menu states 18% on parties of SIX or more. He said they've changed policy but have not changed the menu. SAY WHAT? Had to argue with the manager to have the charge reversed. Told him that if he didn't immediately reverse the charge, I would dispute the charge with the credit card company. Time to find a new sushi bar.

vWelrJdCG2eqNSJ-gm6VhQ.text: SushiWa is a very trendy looking restaurant, which will throw you off on entrance, because from the outside it looks like a mom'n'pop operation. However once you roll in its definately upperclass.  the interior is very spacious, with private booth seats, regualar tables and an expansive bar area which we graciously occupied.  You can get the regular-whatever's-trendy in west LA fancy rolls here, but we befriended the Head chef (by ordering daiginjo sake and pouring a round to all the chefs;-) ) and asked for Chefs choice (Omakase style) but on the traditional side... and it was just crazy good! I think the constant Kanbai's with the chefs helped, cuz we got all the usual, but high grade toro, ikura, uni etc, but he also showed us a flying fish, live and whole, then fillet it before our eyes, and we had flying-fish sashimi, garnished with flying fish wings. Ditto with the Uni Rice where the rice was mixed with seasoning and Uni and served inside the Uni shell. I don't recall all that we ate here, i lot of stuff was new to me, but thats part of the fun in going to a new restaurant! oh they had Orion beer here too, which is a plus. The head chef also showed us a picture he took with the Princess of Belgium? who is apparently a regular there, but what i couldnt understand was, what the heck is the Princess of Belgium doing living in Vegas...

ece61t5fb5VOmmMbv_1dJQ.text: Great sushi.  They take forever to bring you a check, but food is great and staff is friendly.

euAi0sTzo87nQglgOl4i4Q.text: Best fish in Vegas offering all you can eat. Joon gets his yellowtail from Japan, salmon from Scotland, halibut from Hawaii, etc. They care about offering a top product. The atmosphere is very modern and service is fast and friendly. Bring all my friends from out of town to have some great sushi.

1Be5QQwa9Yya5iK4PU1z3A.text: Accidentally found this place when I was going to get a haircut next door.   Thought it was going to be a hole in the wall but when I walked in at 11:30 am I was taken back!  Beautiful interior and really authentic Japanese, but modern like I like it!  Very Spotless inside!  The place quickly filled up for lunch!  I started off with miso soup and a house salad!  Soup was good salad was not! Old lettuce for sure!  Then I had tuna sashimi and it was excellent!  Good Value for the amount! Usually doesn't work that way!    Proceeded onto a Veggie tempura and Salmon roll both excellent!  The  service was perfect and I liked the fact that there were real "Japanese" sushi chefs and employees, kept it authentic this way!  Whenever I come back to Vegas I will make the trip off the strip to come back!  It's only a few miles east on the 215 off Pecos Blvd.   I

tm2-xPyPj_i4j93Dfu5ffA.text: I was surprised to see Sushi Wa did not have at least a 4+ star rating overall.  I was turned on to this place about a month ago from a colleague and have since been back twice.  The short story is:  I love it.  The $22 all you can eat lunch is a great value when you consider virtually everything on the menu is available, fresh and super delicious.  While the exterior of the restaurant is seriously underwhelming, the interior is very tastefully decorated with a cool modern vibe.  I also like how people can store their own chopsticks in these big racks with their names on the boxes.  I've had probably 6-7 different rolls, regular sushi, desert items (great Mochi) and have found portion sizes generous - and I reiterate most importantly - the fish was very fresh!  The service was also exceptional.  I've only sat at a table, so I can not comment about the Sushi Bar service experience.  All in all, I can't wait to return!

BBAQHS_apG7zDc4RQH8H-w.text: I don't know if they get much business here because the mall it's in seems kind of quiet. But... what a great find! It's a place I'd imagine in Santa Monica or West Hollywood only not as crowded and not pretentious.  The tofu salad was very tasty. I generally don't like Japanese salad dressings but the one on this was quite good. On the other hand, I had a seared tuna salad that was a little too heavy on the dressing and I couldn't taste the fish.  I'm a purist when it comes to fish. Give me sashimi! However, it's fun for me to look at a menu and see that mango is being used in rolls. I tried the salmon skin roll the last time I was there and can honestly say I'd recommend it.  There's something on the menu called, "monkey brains" but I noticed it on the way out.

Eoy_5R424lv3gHmYGuQILQ.text: I love this place.  I love their AYCE but what sets it apart is also their cooked items are extensive and yummy.  I could eat their salmon collar all day long!  The fish is fresh and I love that they have a half price AYCE price for kids.  I love Goyemon also (esp. Bc they have half rolls) but I'm not paying $27 for my 4 year old!  Now if only I could get half rolls here......

myQADoBlRF_Ou1-VxeXC-g.text: I am giving one star for a reason...  I used to love this place, food quality was good and service was great.  But that all change today, and it was unbelievable what the server had told me.  The Nigiri was not fresh today, food was ok.  The service I would give 0 star if I could.  Every time we are trying to order, the server always give us this bad look.  And we don't really eat that much, trust me.  The worst part was the server lie to us in our face saying there is a limit of the Ice Cream per person...  Which is not True and I told her I have been here plenty time.  She immediate change her story saying it is not limited "BUT I THINK EACH OF YOU HAVE 1 MOCHI ICE CREAM AND 1 REGULAR ICE CREAM I THINK THATS ENOUGH FOR YOU GUYS"  I seriously start to laugh and tell her forget about it.  And this is my first time in my life left a $0 tips.  I thought it's AYCE!!!!  As a business owner, I feel sorry for Sushi Wa owner to have staff like that.

x9R_u9495W6p4SPm44nQYg.text: If you don't live in the area (Henderson) or nearby you'd never know this place is there. It's hidden in a strip mall, which, I know is such a shock for Vegas (not!), next to the social security office. My husband and I discovered it one day after they first opened and went back several times.   The fish is very fresh and the rolls are very very tasty. If you sit at the counter the chef will prepare a special dish for you; we had something called Screaming Orgasm, and well, it speaks for itself. If you live in the area or have a local who can point the way for you, definitely give it a try.

hwkut0pU0EgflfxyGelanQ.text: This is one of the best places to get beautiful and delicious sushi in Las Vegas.  It's located across from Trader Joe's on Eastern and Coronado Center.  Maybe the location is the reason why it's always deserted, but that's no reason to miss out on fantastic nosh that tastes as great as it looks.  Joon, the owner, is a fantastic and the service is excellent.  They're attentive without being intrusive, which is always a treat to find in a restaurant where you aren't paying over $60 a plate.  Joon also treated my boyfriend and I to real wasabi--not the green kind, but the kind made from real wasabi root--because we had mentioned that we had never tried real wasabi before.  The fish is fresh, and the rolls are creative.  I would recommend the monkey brains and the tuna tartare for appetizers.  You will also be offered miso soup with your dinner, but there isn't anything standout with the miso soup.  It's good to cleanse the palette before your meal.    For their rolls, try it all out.  I like the tiger roll, superman roll, Joon's special.  I don't have them memorized, but I've never been disappointed with an order.  Overall, the food is wonderful, the people there are friendly and unpretentious and the decor echos their menu: modern, chic and tasteful.

l0x3vlXRmD93n8yZhfKikA.text: The Chirashi was off the hook! What a work of art... A+ for presentation, fresh fish, and good serving size. Something out the ordinary... it even had a few slices of what I think what super white tuna topped with some black roe. Delicious!   A+ for ambiance, service, and good prices.... And opens late.  Oh another plus... there is a U-Swirl self serve yogurt place right next door. Sorry Sushi Wa, I'm sure your fried green tea ice cream and mochi balls are probably delicious, but you can't beat 30-something cents an ounce of yogurt + toppings next door! =)

IIPXbshawW037zhn07LveQ.text: Have been here for take-out lunch several times before and all was good. Service was quick and food was good.  Not today though.  Came in around 12:20PM and one of the four waitresses noticed me standing near the "Wait to be seated sign" (she was near the bar). She said "Hi" and then disappeared.  So I stood there and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited and waited. After 5-6 minutes of waiting, none of the 4 waitresses came over and asked me if I wanted to be seated, or if I wanted take-out or anything.  No one said a word to me and no one came over. So then I started to feel like an idiot just standing there, and so I left and went down the street to Spicy Tuna. Spicy Tuna was busier than SushiWa, but they took my order almost immediately as I walked in.  So sad SushiWa!

PWDGshi371ItH6L8cAc3mQ.text: Lunch special is awesome. 1/2 price on many of the sushi items during lunch.  My recommendations are the ultimate salmon lover's roll, pocky roll, spider roll, and the 911 roll. The 911 came with this really good spicy sauce. It didn't taste like ponzu but it was just as spicy.  The service was friendly and good. They brought every roll that we asked for and filled our drinks whenever they were low.  The ambiance and decor was really nice.  I think you can purchase your own chopsticks and they keep it there for you.

82n6amrtDxn_Mn5ei2VEFw.text: favorite sushi house in Henderson  must try rose roll, white tuna sashimi, korean bbq bulgogi and tuna poke salad

9ut02iH_7KUGxFDZK61ZLw.text: One if yhe best sushi place in vegas...andits buffet.. Must try is their white tuna sashimi, grilled yellowtail collar and rose roll... Salmon skin salad is goid too

baMBJqINm0kzMKPRfuVYjQ.text: I haven't gone out with my wife in awhile and we wanted to go somewhere close to the house that had Ayce so we came to Sushi Wa. After we got seated it took them 10minutes to ask us what we wanted to drink then after we got our drinks as we were about to order the Asian lady said hold on and she turned her back on us and grabbed something from another table then when we were ordering she said hold on I'll be back in the middle of ordering our food. Was trying to figure out where she went as she was gone for 3or so minutes, I seen her taking dirty dishes from another table so we waited for a few minutes. She never attended to us so we decided to take off, horrible service and it wasn't even jammed packed. I wanted to try the sushi there but o well maybe not meant to be maybe it was a sign but even it was I still give it a 1 star because customer service should be #1

RJqotB9XMnddpzoLv_gtIA.text: Excellent sushi! Best place so far to get great sushi. Very nice and clean restaurant! The staff is very friendly, we will definitely be back! I recommend the Rose Roll, superman burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Superman burrito.
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Rose roll.

XY3jQ2oljvNz6Yiaeq5QFQ.text: Another great experience tonight. Best AYCE in town in terms of service, quality and variety of rolls.  Gio does a stellar job in managing the room.

IgTuPGqv6Jn242enAw4Udg.text: Great food ! Friendly staff we drive across town just to come here !  There is usually a wait but it's worth it

R-I0aL42B8hXnpq3wA9-zw.text: Solid service, great atmosphere, nice location, very good sushi! I've eaten at sushi restaurants all over the country, and this one is the Goldilocks spot in Henderson. The prices aren't too high for what you get, and there's a good selection of different rolls, unlike some sushi restaurants whose rolls are all very similar (i.e. all filled with tempura shrimp or cream cheese). The service was good, although a little inefficient--our table was served by multiple people, so it was sometimes a little confusing who we should be asking for what. Still, everyone was fast, friendly, and attentive. The decor is simple and elegant, and we liked that there aren't too many TVs to distract you from your conversations. We love how convenient the location is to us, and we can't wait to go back for all you can eat sushi!

MBeSPjUVr7uPRafZv40iMw.text: My boyfriend and I were on the way to get some meat jun but, he changed his mind and wanted salmon skin handrolls... and obvi, Sushi Wa is our favorite for that. We were both excited as we haven't been back for a minute.   Initially, I was going to order just a bento box with one salmon skin handrolls but, BF convinced me to do AYCE.  We order about 6 (4 spicy for him, 2 regular for me) salmon skin handrolls; and since they don't do half orders, we went light on ordering too much.  So, 3 specialty rolls, hamachi kama, and gyoza to start.   I got my handrolls and they were just as good as I remembered.  Then got the specialty rolls SMOTHERED in mayo...ugh, I forgot they like to sauce up their rolls.   BF got his 4 salmon skin handrolls and they were double the size of mines...I thought they put a lot of jalapeno in there. Turns out they STUFFED the roll with rice! Like, really...That's their game of making you full.  I mean, I've seen other sushi spots do this but, this place used a ridic amount of rice.  BF ate about half the rice for each roll and they leftover rice coulda made 2 specialty rolls.   The waitress picked up his plate with all the rice and showed the sushi chef.  I didn't see but, my BF said they were pointing, looking, and talking about him.  So disappointing as we were excited for our lunch and this just kinda ruined the mood/day.  Thankfully, they didn't try to charge us for that rice but, that is most def our last time there.  The sushi itself isn't anything to miss anyways.  So with that: BYE SUSHI WA!

FDXp9S5tgIT1iysGoPNziA.text: Sushiwa has amazing customer service. Jenny was amazing at making sure everyone got what they needed. She's amazing and the food is amazing. The variety of food on the all you can eat menu is among the best I've had. Also, try the white peach blossom cocktail, it's godlike.

ZGYV6mfhPh8HiBhvzums0Q.text: Amazing interior design, and a welcoming warm atmosphere. Fish is professionally prepared and great presentation. Staff is friendly and patient. Shout out to server Jenny, she is a champion! #amazing #jennyisachamp

b4nHCRZQYYNzBkUYX-bb0A.text: Some of the best bang for your buck on AYCE. Some things are limited to one and you will see why. Serious chunks of fish, big servings, tasty sauces. Wish I lived closer!

9ZYn1zeR3-fn7pLXk2IlmQ.text: Good food and good service. Came with my wife in Valentine's Day and got us in and out in a timely manner. I sold one of the owners a Jeep and made it a point to try this place. Tasted great! Thanks, Soon Kim (Daniel)!

85V2Lp2qoioGClghBJox6Q.text: I came here today with my mother. We came pretty hungry, and we wanted to try somewhere new.  The decor is super beautiful. Almost too nice for an ayce place. The waitresses are very nice and are always refilling your water and tea. The male waiter was pretty good looking lol. And very prompt. The food came out fast. They don't do half rolls, which is a bummer.  First things first. We got a miso soup, two cucumber salads, agedashi tofu, and two rounds of nigiri to start. The miso soup was huge and delish. The tofu was GINORMOUS and sweeter than any agedashi tofu I've ever had. Nonetheless, still tasty. The ikura was good. The salmon and yellowtail was also very thick, minimal rice, and fresh. The baby seared tuna was AMAZEEEE. The cucumber salad, I would avoid. Pretty tasteless.  We got a rose roll, which was again, huge. But okay. Lots of baby lobster and scallops. The superman roll was the hit. We loooove spicy garlic ponzu. It was delish! The pockey roll, or avocado lover was odd. Not what I was expecting at all. The jalapenos inside were pickled? Which I found odd. Fresh minced or deep fried would have made it better for sure. The bikini roll was also pretty yummy, this was a riceless roll.  All in all, a pretty good place to go. Definitely coming back for that superman burrito roll and try some more stuff.

5bNNozw8oSTo1493Jg1yqw.text: This is probably the best sushi restaurant I have ever been to. Great service, amazing food.. They are All you can eat  but food quality is better than A la carte.  For the sushi lover this place is a  must try!!

5qlgvFGMmlEkFz7Rc2QKRQ.text: This is my first time at Sushi Wa and I am not disappointed. Great service, friendly people. $23 for all you can eat lunch and $27 all you can eat sushi for dinner  I will be coming here time and time again for the drinks and the service and the delicious sushi

0RH7xUOXuH3Bonekh_XMMQ.text: Came in for a quick dinner and that's exactly what it was. We were seated within seconds of walking in the door. The server took our drink order as soon as we walked in the door. Great service fresh fish. Good food. Highly recommended

8konajGjrDtu3JiqzR-uKw.text: My friend and I were looking to try out a new AYCE sushi place. Although Sushi Wa didn't have as high a rating on Yelp, my friend wanted to give it a try. There are so many sushi places on Eastern, almost too many options.   This place is adorable. It seems like a nice, high end sushi place. When we arrived there was basically no one in the place, but by about 20-30 minutes later and the place was pretty busy.  We both ordered AYCE and each started off with Baked Lasagna and Mussels. Mussels were pretty good but neither of us cared for the Baked Lasagna. I've had better at any other place I've been. There was a lot of cream cheese on top if that's your thing, I'm not that into it so I usually take half of it off. Regardless of that this roll doesn't compete with surrounding spots. There is definitely some kind of distinct, additional flavor being added and I'm not really into it. It wasn't bad, just not as good as other places I've been.   We also ordered the Fire Cracker ($6) and it really good. Equally as good as any other place I've ever had it. I highly recommend trying it. I don't think it's as spicy as it sounds, but there is definitely a kick to it. Popcorn Scallop was also pretty good. The sauces they served with it were ok.   Beef Teriyaki roll was ok. My friend liked it more than I did. I don't think I'm ready for a meat/sushi infusion yet.   Rose roll was pretty good, description says that it's a baked baby lobster on top of California roll with eel sauce. I'm not sure but that doesn't sound like what we got. It was a roll covered in a lot of stuff, I tasted scallops, there was definitely a really good creamy type sauce. This dish looked kind of messy, but as actually not that hard to eat. The only thing I didn't like about it was the red onion that was mixed on the top. They were pretty easy to remove but one snuck through on my last bite.   Screaming Orgasm was pretty good, but again I've had equal or better at other places.   My friend ordered the Las Vegas Roll, I didn't try it. 4 Kinds of fish, crabmeat, avocado all completely deep fried. It's not my thing. I don't mind some light tempura, but I'm more of a raw sushi kind of girl. I did try the sauce that was in the bowl because my friend didn't like how spicy it was. I usually like anything spicy, but this didn't have a great flavor.   So for my first visit here, I'd say it went ok. I mean I don't think I'll be rushing back here. I feel like I can get better value at any other place. The best thing about this place is the ambiance. Service was ok. Servers seems to be friendly, but also ambivalent. It's also one of the more expensive AYCE places that I've tried. I don't think that mixes too well with the level of deliciousness. Sushi quality seemed legit, but I also want quality flavor.

CNJbX7rkpp7sZLIaOQXQag.text: I just left this places and I am so very disappointed!!!! I was in at exactly 2:30am... I ordered 2 yellow tails and one bake mussels, the bake mussels came out at 2:45 and the sushi came out at 3:05am  I have been to many sushi spots and never in history have a chef took over 30 mins to make 4 pieces of sushi especially in an establishment that was SO EMPTY.. The chef was talking instead of working which I let it be known, he also look more Hispanic instead of Asian(I added that in there because I don't know his name).. He needs to be fired or cleaning, not cooking. He is talking over the sushi with one lady that was sitting at the bar about "what she's doing this weekend"  and he moves very very slowly....(maybe he need to learn how to multitask)? Again, I have never been to an empty sushi spot where the chef took over 30 mins to make 2 little yellowtail tuna not even in a busy one.  Oh and since it only takes about 2  mins to make two order of yellow tails, my mussels shouldn't have came out first... I am very mad I drove that far for all you can eat to deal with a slow incompetent chef! I paid for my soda and LEFT still hungry, I didn't eat anything because I was upset and lost my appetite

sV1HTa60plX66E4O4KdkJw.text: I will keep coming back again and again! I love this place. I recommend that you try it as well. AYCE included one order of sashimi, which most places don't do anymore. All of the rolls are fresh and the presentation is impressive. I usually order Tuna sashimi to start which is always good here, but my favorite rolls are bikini, hawaiin, mango salmon roll. I finish off with Unagi Nigiri because the sweet eel sauce tastes more like a desert to me. Sushi Wa is also on the Uber Eats list and they give you a 10% coupon for your next in restaurant visit. Perfect!

IlQ7ozbiVeWLjWQv7FI-qw.text: This place is amazing! The selection is huge! Our server was terrific she gave us recommendations and of course my group had everything! The lunch buffet was well worth it. My recommendation was the grilled pork belly and the baked volcano roll! Just a tip, go with a group of 3-4 and all get the lunch buffet so that way everyone can order a couple of different sushi rolls and you can literally try a bunch of rolls at the same time! YUM!!!

w-3EUj-OlSxv4uN4ERSMRQ.text: So I'd give five starts but... Let me start with what is really awesome, the portions of meat for the nigiri was quite generous and seasoned very well. I also was pleased that they had gluten free soy sauce in an identifiable container. The sushi chef was fairly attentive until he got busy. This is where things began to take a turn. I ordered an Alaskan roll (salmon, crab, cucumber, asparagus and avocado -also the roll in the picture) it didn't come with the cucumber or asparagus. The avocado was barely there, when I mentioned this to the sushi chef he said "sorry wonder been really busy and are out of a lot of stuff" that would have been nice to know before giving me a roll missing a third of it's ingredients. My husband and I say idle for about 10 mom waiting for our check, server or someone to notice us. The other thing I was most disappointed with is that the "green" mussles were not green mussels and instead regular black mussels see the picture not a hint of green. They aren't even close to the right size either. I will still go back I just won't get rolls or other things.

J427mcn_zxvJThRY5tj7bg.text: I've been to a lot of AYCE sushi places in Vegas, and I have to say that this place is one of my top picks. They have a bunch of sushi rolls with ingredients I haven't really seen in other places and their modern, intimate decor adds a really nice touch to the experience.  My favorite rolls include the rose, bikini, dragon, fried salmon, and fried scallop. Rose roll is pretty good because it isn't too saucy and the combination of scallops and mushroom is really good! Bikini roll doesn't have any rice since it is wrapped with a cucumber shell which provides a refreshing and healthy alternative to the other rolls. Dragon is a favorite for those who like eel and eel sauce on top of a california roll. The fried salmon roll is delicious because it is basically a sushi roll stuffed inside crispy salmon. Fried scallop is good too, imagine popcorn scallop on top of california rolls.   Service is really good: the staff refills your drinks periodically without you having to call them over and they are very polite. I would definitely recommend checking this place if you are within the area. The price is comparable to other AYCE places even if this place seems a bit fancier (at least on the inside)!

Every dish I tried was super sweet and I didn't expect that. The only reason I give it 2 stars is because they were speedy. (Possibly  why quality was subpar). If you do choose a roll the XXX was the ONLY roll that I recommend that I had.

5fvaDXcq0meE0uSxmIagIw.text: Sat down and looked at the menu. Our waitress was quick to serve us water and ask my boyfriend and I about our order. So I put in a few nigiri orders. She returned about 10min later with our order and took our specialty roll order. We waited almost 30 min for them to bring out our first two rolls. uAU43jeoJXHaUIX9XhIgmA.text: I've been coming to this location for close to 10 years, since I was a student at the nearby high school. Some of the freshest fish in the area and highly accessible. The AYCE is a great deal that includes 1 order of sashimi (a rarity) and all the nigiri you can fit. Between the service, atmosphere, and quality, I love this place. Since moving out of Vegas over two years ago, I always try to stop in at least once per visit home and will continue to do so!

OMHDDhCcAAGTMza1ZG3dLw.text: it really is hard to find a sushi bar that pleases you in every way.  Some places have great sashimi, but so so rolls.  Some places have great rolls but horrible sides.  some places are just horrible.  Here at Sushi Wa - EVERYTHING is great - decor, service, dessert, rolls, sashimi, appetizer sides - even the water.   Though everything is great, I highly suggest:  -Screaming Orgasm - the best orgasm sauce ever!  not too sour like other places.  4 pieces of fish served atop radish noodles soaking in a bowl of their sauce.  only one per person for their AYCE dinner.  Don't think you can order one for yourself, and one for a friend, hoping that your friend won't like it, so you can have more than one.   because he will.  and so will the next friend after that.  and the next after that.   - Firecracker - a small piece of crispy wonton, a cube of tuna and a cube of avocado, drizzled in firecracker sauce - Rose Roll - baked roll with lobster, scallops, mushrooms, onions - Who's Your Daddy - cream cheese and crab meat and sweet mayo and shrimp and it's deep fried in panko and crispy - Ahi Poke Salad - a little spice by thats ok.  mixed with seaweed salad.    all in all, my sushi palette has never tasted sushi this good.

ZgC51oduZxINPLHLiWtHmw.text: This place is the best.  The pepper seared tuna sashimi is the most delicious food i have ever tried. The all you can eat is a great value with 90% of the menu avaliable.

P61fCwltMKMoYkyzXcFNcA.text: Amazing quality! Great servers, very respectful, and the sushi cooks are great at what they do. It may seem small on the outside, but the heart is what counts. Definitely worth a try if anything else.

JZaW9TQ0u7ig0YJuJuQ0WQ.text: The restaurant has a nice, trendy atmosphere with upbeat music and they serve hands down the prettiest sushi I have ever seen. The flavors though, are a little hit or miss. They were not particularly busy when I went, which was surprising for a Friday night and we got good, attentive service. A lot of their rolls are very unique. Some of the rolls were phenomenal (like the pocky), but some of the flavor combinations and their sauces really did not work for me. I also got some nigiri where the fish did not taste fresh.   Overall, this place is a decent all you can eat option in Henderson but there are better places in other parts of the valley.

FLU-rwf4J9FaGKnfv5gdPA.text: I go here all the time, decided to finally write a review. This is my fave sushi spot by far. Fish is always fresh, I never get any bad pieces, no matter what time or day I go. And I love the mussels. Favorite roll- superman burrito.

f_vunb8LF2VWqJjv9YCHAA.text: Very nice restaurant  and close to my office.  Services  is great  and the food  is delicious.  Great for large party, business  meetings  or take your sweetheart

ka6A_EjcyDI0BTU8MN3prw.text: I really like Sushi wa.  The prices are pretty fantastic, and the quality of food is always top notch.  I am never disappointed when i come in for lunch or dinner.  The only issue I have with this place is that customer service is a little iffy.  The older woman there always seems angry and upset.  I really like the younger server.  She is really nice, but when the older woman is working with her, she tends to yell at the younger one and gets really awkward.  Other then that this place is awesome.

5UZUlQxDQEsvslIw-ezyVQ.text: I love this place! They use only the highest quality fish and they have fantastic service.  You have to ask for it, but they are one of the few places that have authentic fresh wasabi, not that fake green paste that everyone else has.  I would recommend this place as one of  the best "off strip" sushi joints in town.

9hNfLLo51Je7QQ5Z03PvMQ.text: First time here in a while and first time for dinner. This will be my new go to spot for ayce in Henderson. Staff was very attentive sushi chef was friendly and food came at a great pace. Food was fresh and had great flavors. My 12 year old who loves sushi ate the most she ever has and tried many things. I will definitely be a regular here from now on.

EJJ0CNNBJEyK0t72M5wM7g.text: I came here for lunch because I have been craving sushi after passing on a trip with all the Yelpers. It has been some time since I came here, but it is close to home and I remembered liking this place a lot. A couple of years later, it is still good and they have AYCE. I sat down at the bar and did the AYCE lunch ($21.95) The restaurant was quiet, at noon, since they open at 11:30. Not too long after 1pm, people started to come in. That gave me a 45 minutes of my own personal sushi chef. I got the Spicy Sashimi Salad to start. It was light on the dressing, not too spicy, and overall delicious. It could use more heat, but the mound of greens, diakon, and seaweed was a plus. The Agedashi Tofu  had an odd taste or maybe too much flavor. I usually drink all the broth, but I left mine this time. The Shrimp and Sweet Potato Tempura was good. Spears of sweet potato were wrapped in shrimp, lightly battered, and fried. Simply perfect. I also like their Monkey Brains appetizer. Spicy tuna, cream cheese, shitake mushroom which they fry up tempura style before cutting into quarters and placed on their spicy and eel sauce.   All of the nigiri I got were good, but nothing mind blowing in flavor. I do like the attention to detail though. My Ika came out looking like a baby squid. The Unagi was also better because they took a torch to it after putting on the sauce to give a nice char. Sang has some nice knife skills.  I am a sucker for a Screaming Orgasm and must try it anywhere I go. I know saying I like their orgasm sauce because it is not too creamy is going to set me up for a razzing, but I don't care. It is True, because the sauce is more on the citrus side than on the mayo and I am fan. I finished my sushi course with a half order of this roll. I wished I saved more room or asked if I could get it as a salad, because it was my favorite. Ordering a half roll is like declaring a cease fire. Once the white flag is up, there is no more sushi to be had. Make sure you are ready to call it quits before asking for this. The chefs are upfront about it, but just a warning in case it slips their minds.  At the end of my meal, I got the banana tempura with green tea ice cream. I don't normally order tempura items at Japanese restaurants, but Sushi Wa does it so well.   The service was polite, attentive, and quick on refills of my green tea and water. I had an enjoyable lunch. There can be a wait if they get hit with too many eager AYCE diners, but patience is rewarded.

UnNB6jxxq0nIZt1yZ6eAVQ.text: If I could give not a single star I would because management is absolutely awful!!! Never had management be so rude to a customer in my entire life we got the all you can eat sushi and we ordered the mountain roll which was 15 dollars!! and it was disgusting!!! we asked if we could send it back after one bite and the employees INCLUDING management fought us tooth and nail because they tried to enforce their "rules" and charge is for the roll that we clearly only took a bite and where disgusted by it so we called over the server and the manager to came over and said we had to pay for it but then against their own rules! said we could take it home but no one wanted to eat it because it looked like a dog ate garbage puked it up ate it and puked again on the plate after fighting with them for almost 15 mins. They finally took it off but where so rude about the entire situation never been to a sushi restaurant where they won't let you give back food that was disgusting... just completely unprofessional... never ever EVER AGAIN will go there... and their chicken katsu for 11 dollars was the smallest portion I have even seen I was done with it within 5 mins... please if you like sushi and good service avoid this place at all possible...

XnvO0c6fH8oU3EL7rHDbow.text: Food 5 Stars - Service 3 stars.  We went on New Years Eve, and the restaurant was crowded... but not that crowded.  We had a reservation for 7 - they put us in a cramped rounded booth - maybe room for 5-6.  One server asked us for drinks, and then no one came to get our order... ten minutes later we asked the drink server, about ordering, and he said he wasnt' our server and left.  Finally after getting the managers attention, we got a server.   Anyway - seemed like we were an inconvenience to the manager.  She didn't smile once- looked irritated at everyone the whole time we were there.

GmM-PLsBBGo2zu-_yv94BA.text: Just came home from a disappointing visit at Sushi Wa. Wish I had gone back to Oyshi instead. Service staff was pleasant and attentive, but out of three chefs, there was only one who was pleasant, and he wasn't the one serving me. The menu was explained poorly. One order of sashimi per person, (huh?) and one order of sweet shrimp.. description that took much longer than necessary to get across. I had eaten the rest of my food (2 rolls, 3 different orders of sushi, the sashimi, and a couple of appetizers) and the sweet shrimp was MIA. The one pleasant chef, upon my inquiry, mentioned it was coming. But it felt like every time I spoke to my chef, I was bothering him. And what was his name? Well, according to their chef jackets, they were all named Joon Choi. The sweet shrimp came out right as I was asking about dessert. I had given up. To be fair, the quality of the fish was good. 4 stars for that. But there was so much more that was wrong. The rolls were poorly wrapped, the carrot in one of the rolls should have been thrown away. I had to pick it out! Seriously. I tried their Korean Bulgogi. Bad. Just Bad. And then... the sweet shrimp arrived. I. Have. Never. Had. Shrimp. This. Bad. I couldn't eat it. I asked for the red bean mocha. The waitress asked if I wanted it as I finished the rest of my food. When I indicated I was not going to do so, she told me they charged for pieces I didn't eat. I understand that policy is in place to keep down waste... but when I told her the food was undesirable, she didn't really say anything. In the end, they took it off my bill. But what a waste of a night of sushi! I ended up feeling full but  extremely dissatisfied. Never again.

I7Ra3J9XD2cbzd2kI1vJAQ.text: I've been here twice now for the all you can eat sushi and I'm a fan. I recommend going in a group and all getting AYCE so that you can share and try more things without getting full on a single item. It is good quality, made to order sushi. They limit very few items, like you can only get one order sea urchin and of sashimi per person. I loved the Screaming Orgasm and the Pepper Seared Tuna sashimi, definitely getting those again. Appetizers are also included in the AYCE deal ($26 at dinner) which was a pleasant surprise - almost everything on the menu is unlimited. But leave room for desert because the AYCE also includes your choice of ice cream, mochi ice cream, tempura ice cream and banana tempura. I was stuffed but I couldn't resist tempura green tea ice cream.

S_DBayT6vqZmzQCifO3xWQ.text: I came here with some buddies for the All-You-Can-Eat option and it was NOT disappointing in the least!   For $25.95, we ate some of the best sushi we've ever eaten, and in copious amounts. I ordered approximately 7 or 8 rolls, and I enjoyed all of them, though the Mexican Roll was my favorite.   The neat thing about the AYCE was also that it included appetizers. The Spicy Chicken was fantastic and the gyoza were decent. Another highlight was the chocolate mochi for dessert  :)  The service was excellent as well. The waitresses were all very funny and accommodating. They also were very good at moderating how often they came to the table with the next round of rolls so we were never overwhelmed by the amount of plates on the table.  Definently a great place for a good AYCE deal on sushi! Come if you're hungry for fresh fish at its best!

qrnm6KPs4Qs9uII8TA7Cpw.text: I have been to many AYCE sushi places and I must say this one was awesome, not just for the food but for the whole experience. Our waitress was very attentive, as were the other two men that were on staff. Some AYCE sushi places I have been to that have a time limit will let you order a few items and then just ignore you for a while to let the time pass before they can kick you out. This was not the case, they constantly checked on us and even when we were waiting for food we had ordered, they asked if we saw anything else we would like to order. They had great suggestions too. We had a few rolls, the superman burrito is a must try and the gyoza's were great. They had a large choice of cocktails and sake as well! Thanks for the great experience Sushi Wa staff, I will be back!

xtvHi-ZACExK3SlK1xuyJg.text: We've eaten here a handful of times and while the service has been slow, the sushi has always been worth it. Sadly, not the case today. HORRIBLE service. Our waitress was so incredibly rude and recited the AYCE rules and time limits on top of trying to charge extra for things we've always gotten in the past. The halibut was disgusting. With no one in the restaurant you'd think they'd try and be accommodating to our party but it was exactly opposite. Won't be coming back here ever.

tLv7AgnnQY-NLiPp4Z3lBg.text: Please,  this is the worst place I 've been to so far . The service was horrible , there was 1 guy running around like a hamster in a wheel doing everything . I came in with folks that ate and left and i was still waiting for my order to go , rainbow roll and a sashimi  combo ,40min really? I had a hungry husband and a baby waiting for me . The food quality was really below average , avocado on top was brownish , my edamame  was falling apart coz it was over cooked , fish was small and not so trusty so I microvawed  my salmon and gave tuna to my cat  . Never again !

5vpLQgkk5NcO_sG-qXQDKg.text: This place is definetly one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places that I go to. 2 of my favorite things that I ordered during my last visit was the pepper seared baby tuna and the baked mussels. Last night was my first time trying the pepper tuna, but when I tried the first one it was so good, I swear I ordered two more orders, it just melts in your mouth so nicely. As for the mussels. If you are a fan of baked mussels, you need to try theirs. One of my top two places to order mussels from. Most sushi places in Vegas has them either too burnt or the cheese that they use gives an odd taste, but Sushi Wa's is perfect. Also ask for Jenny if she's working. I haven't really bothered to make any reviews about this place, but she was the best server I've had there so far. Very friendly and constantly checked up on us to see if there's anything else she can get us (we are A LOT) thanks again Jenny! :)

AN2jRyH8rW-6OjeXU5eO3g.text: Sushi was amazing. me and my girlfriend did the ayce and were very satisfied. I also had great service. The waitress that served me brought the food out fast and constantly checked up on us. Overall great restaruant and I would recommend you come here.

1jeTIYOLWWorI92fAy4b3Q.text: This is probably one of my favorite sushi spots in Vegas. All of there fish is fresh and I love that they're open late. Definitely a must!

eIoJJajleqVX2hrBaosGng.text: Very kind service and great ambiance! Love the layout and design of the restaurants and good food!!

g3KL6ilHh_ekOIU3a0LaSQ.text: Been coming here for years. always fresh and great service.Unique rolls and some of the classics are on the menu. Wonderful atmosphere for the family or a first date.  Modern and clean.

NfRrlyFXAgIonSzvg7iE-A.text: My fiance and I visit sushi wa at least 3-4 times a month and we love it! By far the freshest sushi I have ever had! Sit at the sushi bar, order a cocktail, and enjoy the all you can eat!

Zt7Ub5Z_h8X_-m4v5z33lQ.text: My wife and I frequent here pretty much every time we want sushi. It is by far the best sushi bar in the Vegas Area. Prices are good, sushi chefs are amazing, and quality of fish is paramount. Our regular Sushi Chef Waldo is our favorite from all the sushi places we have ever been too, and he does great work. Beautiful and artful plating and great cuts of fish. He always remembers the first thing I always order when I sit down, the Superman Burrito, in my opinion the best roll ever. Definitely give this place your business!

12-yFBTOYvFzuLF61E59ZA.text: This was my first time trying sushi. The reviews seemed pretty good and my friend wanted to go back because she has enjoyed it in the past.  Only one other table of diners, we were seated quickly. We had some questions about the menu and the all you can eat option.  Friend ordered some sashimi while we decided.  Decided to go for the all you can eat $26.95.  We were told she couldn't because the sashimi she ordered wasn't part of the deal.  Expressed my frustration because we TOLD him we were thinking of that option.  The manager gave her approval though we had to pay $9 for the appetizer.  Things were going well. The food was quite slow coming out of the kitchen and we were not getting plates at the same time.  It was throwing off the tempo of the meal.   We were talking and then the waiter decides to tell us that we will be charged for any food left on the plate.   We did NOT over order. It was that he brought 2 plates out at the same time.  Then after we expressed our irritation with him. The manager came over again and said, "I see you are really trying."  Gee thanks, so you won't charge me MORE money.  Left there spending $80.00.   Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

Wdz7oPzkqG_JFMPDBsq8Wg.text: Good sushi and location. All you can eat is always awesome. Clean and quite would recommend.

cd-otEEYNViTjUsHn29-Ww.text: A friend invited us to try Sushi Wa a couple of years ago and we are still loving it! Great presentation!  Nice interior, too bad it's in a strip mall. One caution, don't tell them "something REALLY spicy" you might get ghost peppers. It took a few hours for the heat to die down. :-)

v28j9mBVXCdYmvz2ssQr-w.text: Got the recommendations from my sister in law and she said everything was so good there... had to check it out so me and my fiance walked in and it was empty but the decorations were very modern lounge kind of feel.  The one manager was awesome giving us recommendations on which roll is good... and the waitor was super nice and funny... for AYCE they give you sashimi per person. I got the crunch albacore because I was already hooked on their calamari with the honey dipping and he got the screaming orgasm which I wish I order another one because it was so good!!.. the appetizers were amazing too... their mussels were cheesy and pretty big mussels compared to some places.  overall my experience there was amazing... chill ... friendly ... I definitely will come back....

They even let us make a modification to a roll to add cream cheese, I can't count the amount of sushi places that won't. Great experience and we will be back here.

CFQHg79yvo18oHn6OdQbBw.text: Great service with good food! Will come back again! I enjoyed the "screaming orgasm" and spicy tuna rolls!

UEpNpfJOXc2P-FQQLAH_Mw.text: Excellent service. Didn't have to ask for anything more than once. Joon helped us at the bar the entire time and the sushi was incredible. Fish was fresh and the bulgogi was delicious. Myself and two others had all you can eat lunch and our bill was $70. Unbelievable food for that price. Service and food for this price is the best on this side of Vegas.

lJqnGGt4iwx92Ccb_t903A.text: The perfect example of what customer service should be. Their food is amazing and their all you can eat pricing is amazing! Their ambience in there is great and their lighting is comfortable even on those, "I drank too much the night before"  days. The sushi is so fresh and their spicy rolls are killer.  I have referred so many people to this place and I recommend it to anyone looking for great service and amazing rolls!

XTo_4yxwtHIV_ZEGlOn5jA.text: Everything about this place was ehh. We won't be returning or recommending.  We get there when the place first opened, and upon walking in I'm thinking that because it looks nice, we'll probably have a really good experience here. Yeah, not so much.  It took the waitress a few minutes to acknowledge us after she gave us the menu to get our drink orders. Upon returning to take our order, there's like 30 thousand rules that are already listed in the menu, but the waitress decided she had to make sure we knew. I know that with AYCE sushi, you're supposed to finish your food or they say they will charge you so that people don't just order a bunch of stuff to waste. So when we're ordering the waitress made sure to tell us we needed to finish all of our food eor we would be charged.   Another issue we had was when we tried to order, everything we wanted, like plain roll were on the dinner menu. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind paying dinner price for AYCE sushi during dinner, but it was lunch. This lunch ended up costing 70 bucks with tip.    The food was meager. The sashimi was good, but nothing spectacular. The screaming orgasm was really good along with the peppered tuna. Philadelphia roll was very plain. The shrimp tempura roll my bf said tasted "super fishy." The Japanese lasagna was delicious.  Cucumber salad was bland. Ice cream was ice cream.  The waitress did, however, keep refilling my bf's soda without having to be asked. Which was nice. Usually, drinks are ignored. Here, it wasn't.  This place is very close to home, so we were hoping we could find another neighborhood favorite, but I guess it's back to SushiMon.

5Nhk0viEiQnGIJLUQoyxQg.text: Great services and great sushi rolls.  We had all you can eat and it was fast and good.  The atmosphere is nice and relaxing great overall... found out new sushi spot

NmL6I3FauMnaOhB6gbkkxA.text: Finally tried this place after living right up the hill for almost a year. Definitely the best place we've been to south of 215. Everything we had was good, it was later in the afternoon, service was excellent.

8iUcVtM1HbRGbpIRH38paQ.text: Sushi wa always has great food and you should  definitely try the fresh wasabi!  The selection is always fresh and the staff is great.

Ut9ja9g0Yxq2xf_tnZtjIA.text: I don't even know where to begin with this review. The only reason I gave this place to Stars was because the roles were actually quite flavorful. With that being said, the service at this place was terrible. I understand when call-outs happen or being understaffed, but there is no sense of urgency in either the Cook or our waiter. First we ordered our appetizers, and when we noticed that they were taking a little bit longer to come out, we asked the waiter if we could place our order for our roles. He responded give me just a second, and then took 20 minutes to come over and take our order. We ordered three different rolls at one time and it took 30 minutes for them to come out because they serve them one at a time. Then we look over to the sushi chef and watch him having a conversation with which I assume is the dishwasher, and he is taking his sweet time and continually touching his earphones in his ear with his gloves on and then touching the rolls that he's making. He was more interested in his conversation with the person that he was talking to then he was making sure that the rolls went out in a timely fashion, or in the order that they were ordered. We ended up canceling our last roll because after sitting at the table for an hour and 15 minutes, and only having two rolls, needless to say we ran out of patience . All in all I would not return to this establishment. There were plenty of other sushi places in town that care about the people that come in.

vnEvWDHPTIsUKHtbu8n2CA.text: Favorite sushi place in town. The new server Shea is amazing, she really made our experience here wonderful! There is also a huge selection of amazing quality sushi here. Definitely will return.

r0EwoajCP34sQwaOgBvAJg.text: Pretty great "Hole in the wall" atmosphere. Stopped in for lunch on a Sunday and it wasn't busy at all. There's plenty of parking outside and the staff greets you promptly when you walk in. Our waiter was awesome and the food was great as well. They don't have the biggest menu but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. Their appetizers is also not as "trendy" as the other sushi places nowadays but they make up for it in taste. I'd recommend this place to anyone in the area craving some sushi.

tXPXWwhxAZZMCT0GJmKwMw.text: Went in on a Friday night, pretty busy, service was a little slow. But hey that's a Friday night everywhere. Anyways time to pay the tab bill was $101 gave the waitress $60 in cash and the rest card. Simple math $41 on on the card. Get my card receipt back but not the original receipt. I was charged $76. Mistakes happen, called the manager and he fixed it. Now that I think about seems like the waitress try to pocket $30 and try to charge me the extra $30 plus the tax. Just seems shady. Moral of story check your receipts when you pay cash and rest on card.

sIHcWCHkoAkxSBRK-Fs6Pg.text: Best sushi from Joseph, the recommendations were great and he is so personable!!  Definitely coming back for the rest of my life.  (Pictured: Cajun albacore sashimi)

yR0yJKpMdFXcsw1G_cX8Yg.text: This place has the worst customer service ever. I was very disappointed because the rolls were really good but not worth the service we received. We came in 09/02/19 @ 12am and there was only one cook and one waiter. I understand why it was awhile to get our food but as we kept watching the cook make our rolls, he kept talking to an employee and showed no rush to make our food. I also saw the cook touch his air pods multiple times with his gloves on and go back to touching other peoples food. We received one roll at a time even though we put in our 3 roll order 30 minutes ago, in between him making our rolls, he would make other peoples orders between our order and those customers just came in. I informed our waiter that we wanted to cancel our last roll because it was now 1am. I gave 2 stars because the food was good at least but definitely not worth everything we went through and especially watching that cook touch his ear with the same gloves on, gross.

Xend4AC3JWVcomc0CVT2xg.text: I thought I already knew of the best place for Las Vegas sushi. That was up until I visited Sushi Wa for an all you can eat sushi dinner. I've been back three more times since. The ambiance is welcoming and the service - always kind and attentive.   Their all you can eat sushi set up isn't a check list you hand over to your server. You order from the menu, a la carte style. Very few items are limited or not included.   This place is consistent in quality of fish and service. Its simply not worth the money and time to attempt a match at any other sushi restaurant within the Las Vegas area. I've tried; and been disappointed each time. Sushi Wa has set the bar and I am so grateful to have found them.   Thank you for being such a fantastic establishment!

2M7dAroqSA511cq-EsaBVg.text: This place is very accommodating to large parties! The server is very knowledgeable & catered to my friends unique request. mr2RgmT3INWtD_bpFcmAHg.text: I'm getting more and more disappointed in this place each time I go. This has been our go to for all you can eat for a while now but I don't think I'll be going back. The past few times we've been the service and quality is slipping. They forget to put things in on our order, don't check in on us, no refills (or even sweetener for the tea that we have to continually ask for). The only thing I can say is it's at least consistently bad service. The quality of the food is going downhill as well. The eel had a lot of bones in it, the salmon was was too fishy tasting to where we couldn't even eat it, the Uni was very brown (although the waitress explained that it had to do with the time of year), overall the quality of the food is just ok. If you're looking for all you can eat, I would like to hope there's somewhere better than this place.

nJf3cDEAMRCTVATAZwPobA.text: Great place to have all you can eat sushi. Fish was extremely fresh. Service was fast, efficient and friendly. Our waitresses was very helpful with our sushi roll selections.

dhh6uL-Sjz5i9CrR0_QZPQ.text: I swear to never return at this sushi restaurant anbf please customers who intend to come here to dine PLEASE READ THE FINE PRINT and make your you order only as much as you can eat and clean off your plates completely to the last piece with exactly nothing left on any single plate.   My server/waitress had not taken my order correctly and did not admit to her mistake. I told her many times and had asked her please do not put Tuna in the many assorted fishes in my roll of sushi and she said oh yes the chef will simply just out more of one of the other kinds of fish. That seems like it was ordered easily and understood. Then she had mentioned many of the other dishes and rolls I had ordered alsoi had tuna but they were spicy tuna...They were different because they are slightly cooked and not if the same texture I said those are Ok. I'm fine with those. So then when the meal came to the table I told them the order was,taken wrong they admitted fault and asked if they could make a new one we said no we didn't want to order a new one because we were full already. Then when time came to pay they said those were considered left overs. They wanted to charge as left overs.  How ridiculous? Also ayce is only allowing 1sashimi per person. That's really not ayce  then.   There are so many restrictions for the price we pay. They expect us to eat sushi with the fish so that we get full quick. What a scam.   They want to charge if there is even 1piece of food left on a plate. How ridiculous.  This us what management had told me when I needed to speak with manager because he wanted to back up his worker.    This restaurant does not know how to guide the customer on ordering the right things on the menus and letting customers know the rules in the restaurant. Don't assume the customers know they have to clean the plates.   Buffets ayce don't expect people to eat everything off there plates.   You ridiculous restaurant.  Frozen Salmon.  Not so fresh salads. Seasoning is so spicy Mayonaise is so sour. How can you expect us to eat all if the food is not great.  Please get better chefs.

Ku6fp3e6m1j1cXVYzdFIDg.text: This was by far the worst food I've ever had. Not only was their teriyaki beef disgusting, but they also would not comp it after I took one bite and told them it was not good. Instead they gave me 4 gyoza pieces which were also gross. Their yellowtail was the worst I've ever tasted too. Overall this establishment is terrible from management to their disgusting food. I would recommend Kaizen and Jjanga for all you sushi lovers.

iewDBco0l5x3XLYGH7d1EQ.text: I am very disappointed in sushi wa. We used to love this place and frequented it often. Always in large groups and for AYCE. We will not be returning due to the horrible service we received last night. Rude, inattentive, rolling eyes at us when we ordered multiple items. Refusing to even offer suggestions for the kids we had with us when we asked for rice and shrimp he shook his head no (we all know they serve rice!) We only got half the things we ordered and when we asked where they were he told us we never ordered it (we clearly did). Told a member of our party who came in late she couldn't order yet because it will confuse the chef. Put all of our desserts at the end of the table making us pass them out our selves. Very disappointing night for our out of town guest from NYC. We won't be returning. Kaizen across the street is our new place now.

The service was prompt but we were the only people there at the time. The sushi was good, above average. Prices were competitive so pretty reasonable. Bathrooms were clean and above what I expected. I'll be coming here again during normal dinner hours!

PkRGE1FqAL8ha2dhhKam3w.text: Worst sushi I have ever had. I wish I would've asked for my money back because I truly feel like I wasted it here. The sushi didn't taste fresh, even the mango on the mango salmon roll wasn't fresh. The service wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't good. I'm amazed that this place received 4 stars. Not surprised to see it slow on a Friday night.

Xl53h-8LbLCvE9a8UXMHlA.text: Great service, pretty lenient on time limit when it's not busy, and also offers all you can drink. Not too many fancy rolls but definitely a great place to go if you're going for all you can eat!

s5S-rDRs1BTLaydTRSfrXQ.text: We decided to try this place based on the good reviews on Yelp, and this is the first time we've been disappointed. The sushi was ok. The garlic sauce seemed really oily, and not even that garlicky. The most disappointing part was the speed of service. If I knew we'd have to wait 15 minutes between each order, I would have just ordered everything at once. It took 2 hours just to get 4 rolls and several small dishes from the kitchen. I've never been to a sushi place that has taken this long to get the food out to the customer. Kind of funny how they say you only have an hour for AYCE, but it took 2.

C98izP6xLMNxLZ0Q1usHLg.text: Been to Soho and thought they did have the best uni but sushi wa has better urchin...  The one star is for the uni alone.  Dined in just a few hours ago.  The host/ waiter was not very welcoming and the entire experience was ruined from the start.  Very poor service from the waiter.  I felt very uncomfortable throughout the night because he truly did begin the dining experience by being aggressive and not helpful (with suggestions, etc.).  It was my first time eating at his restaurant and certainly the last.  Maybe the food was fantastic but I am having a really hard time overlooking the horrible service aspect of the dining experience.    The biggest restaurant sin is when a waiter or waitress attempts to be nice(r) and/ or genuinely friendly towards the end of the dining experience.  Perhaps, that is a way of securing a good feedback, gratuity or a future visit?...  Nah, neither one was warranted because the service was such a disappointment at sushi wa.    I will never discourage anyone from trying this place.  Some of the dishes (especially the uni) were fantastic.  I will, however, caution to potential customers to be aware that the service can be rated a 0 out of 10.  Sometimes a balance of great food and excellent customer service is the best way of attracting and retaining customers... Tonight, I am walking away from sushi wa.  That's okay though... They seem to be doing well, anyways.

F_m4LR3UcqKl6uVN6uqHjA.text: Good AYCE menu!  Very nice selection for rolls and other menu items.....and it is close to home!

HmPzx1fxaVWxl-dAqnaD0g.text: This place is just okay in my opinion. A friend's birthday promoted my 2nd and probably last visit here. I had been here one other time, and thought it was just okay, but I like to give a place the benefit of the doubt before I decide whether or not it is worth coming back. The second visit confirmed I will probably not be back.  There were 6 of us and the service started out good. We were given waters and menus and after a short while we ordered at least a dozen rolls and appetizers between the table. I was surprised at how quickly the first round of food came out. The rolls were just okay, some better than others for sure. My favorites were the Superman Burrito and the Japanese Lasagna. One thing I don't like is they are very heavy handed with the sauces. They are not very flavorful and don't complement the rolls as a sauce should. I like to taste the fish and not have it covered up with sauce. I also don't like the batter that they use for their deep-fried rolls, but that is no fault of theirs, that is just my personal preference.   Anyway after the first round we didn't see our server for a looooong time. We asked whoever we could flag down to get him to come to our table, but he was no where to be found. He finally emerged and we ordered more food. He was a nice guy, I just wish he came around more often. I enjoyed dessert the best. I got the banana tempura which comes with 6 pieces of fried banana, a scoop of vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. That was deeeelicous. They also have tempura ice cream, regular ice cream and mochi. Bonus points for having coffee flavored mochi :) I probably wouldn't come back here. It's on the other side of town from me, and I just don't particularly care for many of their items.

fVcyIrJtR4q82SlC2mgXeQ.text: A beautiful atmosphere with absolutely delicious Japanese food. We love this place and frequent often. If you want killer sushi and other yummy Japanese dishes, this is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

C3e883QwgMhgGqTshRB9lg.text: Best sushi place in town. My husband and I come here whenever we get the chance. Excellent food and wonderful service!

1hxWQFg3p2E9-dhRlLmZwA.text: What an awful experience this evening. We hardly ever go out to eat with our kids and we decided to treat them to sushi. This is their favorite place. Well I guess tonight was just "too busy" for good service. Our server was nice but I think she might have had to many tables. She rarely came back to ask how we were doing. When we wanted to order she told us to wait until our other 2 rolls were out so when she finally allowed us to order we sat for 25 min waiting for our food. We also asked if we could have a poki roll with only crab meat and avacodo and the manager said the were not taking special orders because they were again "too busy" I should take a picture but it's really not that busy. Haven't even had a wait for the hour and a half we have been here. To say the least we will not be returning. I feel like for $150 we should be able to order what we want. But obviously at sushi wa they don't care.

XpMv3a69-PlVykEcySJy1g.text: Sushi Wa is our favorite place for all you can eat sushi. The food is great. The location is right by our house. And the people are very nice.

1vRhwMcK1pUlbbDUDUbHjg.text: Came here for a Meetup event with the I Love Sushi group. We had a fairly large party, and we ended up placing a huge order right from the start as every one was marking down what they want on the order sheet without much group coordination. We were warned about not ordering too much, but as a group we failed to heed the manager's warning. So a lot of food was prepared and served almost on top of each other. Anyway, at the end of the meal Chef Joon (owner) came to speak to us, and said that they do their best to make the best food they can for the customers, but when they get a huge order they will rush it and may not be able to put as much attention as they normally would like, so it is better to order slowly for the best food. Plus they do not skim for their AYCE customers, and the rolls were larger than we were accustomed to at AYCE sushi restaurants. The restaurant itself was beautiful. You can tell someone invested a lot of time and other resources into the design and the final look of the restaurant. It is very modern and artistic look to it, which pairs well with the beautiful food served. The lighting is fairly bright, so you can enjoy the food visually before savoring it with your other senses. Plus it almost feels like you are eating in a modern art museum, or a restaurant within one, since it is roomy!!! and you are not crammed in there like 7 Vienna Sausages in a can. We ordered a wide range of items from their AYCE menu, which is practically their entire menu (with some exclusions). Below are the highlights and my personal recommendations: APPETIZERS: Monkey Brain (basically spicy tuna and cream cheese stuffed in mushroom and tempura fried) - small enough to eat solo or share with up to 4 ppl. Soft Shell Crab - Tempura fried and delicious. Served san rice makes it even better (more room in the tummy for other awesome food, plus it is low carbs!) SALADS: Tuna Poki Salad - good portions. ROLLS: Crunch Albacore - looks good, and tastes great. Mango Salmon Roll - sweetness from the mango just pairs well with the salmon. Energy Roll - one of the deep fried rolls, great flavor, especially if you like unagi (eel). Tiger Roll - They make a good version of this popular roll. NIGIRI: Uni, Super White Tuna, Ama Ebi were all good and they do not skimp on these just because you ordered AYCE, so you get a nice proportion of fish to rice. And most importantly the fish were fresh! Pepper Seared Baby Tuna - big fan of this! HONORABLE MENTION: Superman Burrito (Shrimp Tempura, Soft shell Crab, Tuna, Salmon, Yellowtail with special spicy Garlic sauce) - it is a ginormous roll, be sure to bring a lot of hungry friends, or you will not get to try too many other items on the menu. Sushi Wa offers lunch specials and 1/2 price sushi menu offers from 11:30am-3pm and dinner specials from 6-9pm, which you can check out on their website. sushiwavegas.com/menus.h... If you live near here, be sure to get their frequent visitor/loyalty card. In hindsight I should have picked up one of these, as I am going back to Sushi Wa next week. The staff here are nice, and checks up on their guests frequently. Our drinks were frequently refilled. And as I have mentioned earlier, Chef Joon (the owner) even came and spoke to us at the end of our meal. The restaurant is located in the SE part of Las Vegas (Henderson), where there are also a lot of other really good AYCE Sushi restaurants nearby and unfortunately for me a little far (by Vegas standards), but I think it is worth the drive or if you happen to be in the area. Decor: 5/5 I love the look of the restaurant. Ambiance: 4.5/5 Very nice Food: 4/5 I found some favorites already, while others I am glad that I have tried and will likely pass up in order to try other items. Service: 4/5 Good. Location: Worth checking out if you have your own transportation for out of town visitors. Otherwise cab fare will be more than the price of the meal. Solid 4 stars. Plus it is still a hidden gem (even though they have been open for a few years already), as you don't have to wait a long time for seats compared to some other well-known AYCE sushi restaurant in the area.
