HHwLTzNM7wWJ21qktImDOg.text: The worst!! Buyer beware!  DO NOT GET ALL YOU CAN EAT!! Service is terrible, food sucks!  Took my family there and they watch you like a hawk to see if you share.  Made us feel very uncomfortable!  Really!!i would not feed my dog the food.  DO NOT GO THERE!

roDKRGeGejheJcgU4CdF6w.text: First time at Sushi Wa and probably my last.   Nothing was terribly wrong, but it just wasnt that impressive. The interior is very nice. We almost felt a bit out of place in flip flops. The service was fine, though there were a few odd moments and they forgot to bring a few things. I ended up ordering the AYCE sushi, not because I was that hungry, but because the individual roll prices are so high (most around $13) that you have already hit the AYCE price once you have ordered two. I found the roll selection pretty much standard with a few surprises, but there was something off with all the things I ordered. I couldnt tell quite what it was, but I have a feeling the fish wasnt the freshest. There was that slightly bitter aftertaste that you get from fish that has been sitting around just a little too long.  Overall Sushi Wa was decent, but there are several other better AYCE places around town that I would prefer to spend $26.

MIt8ClZ8l5kcCbaAfXXS0Q.text: Not only was the service bad today more because of understaffed, but the chefs, which there were 3 were soo slow.  It took over an hour to get a California Roll and a cucumber roll.  Be prepared to spend 2 hours here minimum as most of the time will be waiting for your order.

dZ0a1R3NSL6I2nCwm0AkAQ.text: My new favorite sushi spot!  Beautiful decor, great music, and the best sushi I've had in a long time.  Best of all-amazing service.  We were so impressed and will definitely be back.

Ra-RyaU4HDR3P5jJas8mBw.text: very nice and the staff greeted us kindly. Love the pink accent lighting. Sushi was really tasty no complaints. Waiters were nice and awesome, they got us our food fast. Omg! tempura ice cream was SO GOOD! They only served full roles so it was a lot of food and you couldn't try more rolls.

eFKDvx3tACKfpyRoC28Pkw.text: Most of the sushi is good, but I can't stand the taste of the propane gas torch that is used to sear the tuna. Yuck,

6PIPPp1fytvDT0nA_H-a_w.text: Wa, wa, wa? Sushi Wa is my new favorite place. Let's start with the Ahi Poke salad which is better than anywhere. It is dressed with fresh small bites of fish, perfectly sliced seaweed, and the right amount of seasoning. I'm not a huge fan of Poke, but I'd return to get more here.  As the Mr. said, Sushi Wa's fish is super fresh. They cut nice thick pieces of Yellowtail. Their sashimi plates are creative and delicious too.   If this were my restaurant, I'd remove the TV from behind the chef station but, otherwise, the Asian decor takes me to another country, far away from the strip mall this restaurant actually resides in.  What turns this 4 into a 5 are the sushi chefs. They crack jokes, talk, offer special tastes. They're fun to be around.

UfJd_QIDSO65T_YXDMcLJQ.text: The first couple of times I came here, I was really impresed with the innovative sushi combinations. However the last couple of times, I've came, the service has become  slower, the food is not as wonderful as the first couple of times I've been. It is AYCE sushi, which is awesome, however it can be a tad pricier than most AYCE joints. But if you're in the Henderson area and looking for good sushi to try without driving too far that is AYCE, this is probably the one to go with.

qtdTBuKPgY3gZhmvihpFCA.text: The best sushi ever!!!!!! This is a great place for All you can eat sushi ! The staff are friendly and the fish is always fresh.

exW8q2SMG2brKbN7Qc7kpw.text: Awww man!!  This has been my favorite sushi joint for a year-ish!  The Japanese Lasagne is to die for.  We got the all you can eat sushi and was ignored the whole time we were there.  It was taking 20 minutes in between each order. WHA???  It wasn't even busy. The waitress was evil, she was rude and I swear she shit in my food because after I left I was sick!  I was so nice to her and tried to give her the benefit of the doubt, she had helped me two times before and it was the same story. So now, here I am venting my experience here.  WA, ditch that waitress, she's tainting your business. The runners were delightful and very sweet.   Really sucks, I would gleam over Sushi Wa but after this visit, I won't be going again :(

wweMMY_Hqnqpr8t0xZBdSg.text: It would've been 3.5 stars but I do like this place so I round up. Not the best place I've been, but the food is pretty good. Pricing for AYCE is like anywhere else, but they do offer sashimi with AYCE, but limited to one order per person. And the Pepper Seared Tuna, yum!! And the yellowtail.... mmmm  The service, though, definitely lacking. The 2 times I have been there has been on quite nights, with only 3-4 other tables, but yet still takes forever to greet the table. Okay okay, so we usually have 8-12 people and we order a lot, but we make it easy for the servers cause I do all the ordering and I keep it organized. But she had troubles getting all the orders, and some of the orders never made it out, and some got confused, etc.   But they got uni, amaebi, raw oysters, soft shell crabs (very small orders, but no limit), and the superman roll was good too. I usually don't go for many rolls cause they fill me too quick, but they are good! And handrolls... at first they were amazing, but after the first order, we ordered 6 more hand rolls and they went cheap on the fish!  Still, a good place to dine, if you have the time. Good and simple decor, TV at the bar for sports, and fresh quality fish. I recommend this place to lots of friends and family. Had the commute not been so bad, I'd be here every week. Well, maybe in the winter when I don't have to watch my weight.

Hh53LjnGY_8YQ8VHKaSxpA.text: My family always comes here and only here to eat sushi. Why? Well their quality of sashimi is amazing. Always fresh and has the buttery crisp taste sashimi should have. Even the uni is good and not as pungent as other places. I've had all of their rolls and I think of all sushi restaurants you won't find another like sushi wa. Definitely should go here for sushi if you want quality and good price.

SVeoD-pIycNxasjLtFhjnQ.text: Being from LA, we have amazing sushi bars. This one really blew me away!  It's off the beaten path from the strip, in a quiet mini mall. This was recommended by a local. Totally worth the trip out here from our hotel in vegas. Came here with a large group on a Monday night. Easy to get a table. It was fantastic. Quality of the seafood is great. And especailly great for an all you can eat sushi bar! Much better quality than the best buffets on the strip. The service was stellar. Manager Geo and server Mark made sure we were all taken care of!   There are rules to the all you can eat sushi, so you need to plan well to get a nice variety of sushi. You need to finish all your sushi, or they will charge you, so don't over order. Even if you get a few rolls, it's totally worth it. You even get an amazing dessert. I recommend the tempura banana!   If I lived here, I'd eat here all the time.

igH3oW5GysXLLbm3meIngg.text: Where to start?? The old, overly sticky rice? The dry rolls with no sauce? The brown avocado? The undercooked scallops that were still cold? The veggie roll that was comprised mostly of lettuce? The wasabi that was an odd color, nearly brown?   Don't understand the rave reviews, this stuff wasn't good at all. There are much, much better sushi places in Henderson people.  Two stars for the nice manager and the ambience.

jQgvtJNyOjlxlt6iUZKs-Q.text: The inside looks SO much nicer than the outside. Decent menu selections. Our waitress was very helpful in recommending the AYCE and finding things my little kids would like. Both my hubby and I felt the sashimi was a bit fishy although it looked beautiful. The rolls we selected were pretty good. I'm partial to another sushi place up the street but I think this is a good back up place.

UZikKQUd2pdVX1DX2tPjWw.text: We were looking for a late dinner on a Saturday and discovered this little gem..open until 12:30am..AYCE $25.  Excellent service.  Nice decor.  The food is delicious and well presented.  This is our new go-to for sure!  Easy parking, tucked away in a corner strip mall.

1FABPEMmU44qUEyJd1yFpQ.text: Amazing as always!!! Service and food so good. Totally worth the money for the all you can eat.

U9dCyEzE3w9zFIa3LM1gww.text: I went here on my lunch hour with coworkers. As a sushi newbie, this is only my 2nd time eating in a sushi restaurant . The atmosphere was nice, but the service was slow. Very slow. If  you got all the time in the world come on in. If the clock is ticking, pace yourself!  I had the cooked sushi and tempura, very yummy though.

pyncV06y5b2wyw5gUm1m5g.text: Good price for the all you can eat.  Interesting sushi choices.  Had one that tastes like a whopper.  One was like lasagna.  Nice atmosphere.  Good customer service. Quick.  Correct.  Good suggestions from them.  Ill be back.  We did some damage here, they lost $$$ with us.

NZ-7Q9zc-ezsrjF15Le7NA.text: Heard this place from a family member that she talk so highly of. I was impressed with the decor, price is reasonable,  food was ok not great liked their ahi tuna poke a lot though. Too bad you can only have one per person if you're doing ayce. And here's the negative part why I'm only giving them 3 stars...service was mediocre at best. Server is rushing to drop plate on the table and by the time she says what the food was she's gone and they are not even busy! Our orders were wrong and our drinks were not filled for the last hour and had the balls to tell my husband he can't order drinks after we paid. Menu needs a lot of work. I don't think we'll come back.

1n9uP8QpahiPBSPYGq3KrA.text: Food was great but the nigiris had TOO MUCH RICE. Our server didn't even check on us unless I waved her down.

WpBng1OIOj5Xcc436tWnjw.text: Went and tried out this place today and it was awesome :) waiter was nice and very fast. Didn't take long to get food. Bill was 60$ for all you can eat both plus a tea. Not too bad for a date night. And definitely got money's worth!!!!

WjA05kNwQt4eaaLvug3opg.text: We had AYCE which was awesome!!! The presentation as well as the quality was the best.Lots of choices and a great and comfortable atmosphere. I almost gave them 5 stars except the service was a little slow.Sushi Wa is my new go to place for Sushi.

fEezdT7-S3sn89nPTckTIw.text: I don't say this often (sad to say because a friend of mine swears this is the best Sushi place now in the Las Vegas area), but this is the worse sushi buffet/place I have ever been to. Maybe it was because it was lunch time, but everything stunk!  First of all, there are limitations to the buffet, like one of each poke salad, dessert, etc. In addition, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters were only offered at dinner time. They also don't have sashimi for lunch time. After seeing this, I had a second thought of maybe leaving because my hubby already had several things marked off of his "must-have" list at a sushi place, but I decided to stay.  After ordering a few sushi/nigiri, the waitress asked us if we were "sure" we wanted to order all of this because there was 16 pieces for the both of us. Keep in mind, we haven't even started eating yet. Ok, I guess she doesn't get customers that eat a lot of sushi?  Again, we just brushed it off, and said we still wanted it.  When we got our sushi, I was disgusted. The raw fish was breaking apart already (most likely 2-3 days old), wasn't as cold, and the rice also wasn't as sticky. Ewwww! Gross.   The best part of the lunch was probably the mochi, and the banana tempura with green tea ice cream dessert I had them make for me.  Don't go here unless you really have to.

ngxSpyo34M96SYrq_IH20w.text: I love this place so much. The staff is very attentive and the food is so good! I love the ambience and decor. Very modern and cozy with the dim lights. All in all 5/5 in taste, comfort, and service!

IdXWGjPsIFku9mRzbGtZ-w.text: Ponzu everything. Rude staff. Warm, unmanageable rice. Waste of money.  Will not be back

cZKgnyPFr_wHqR9wIYdGLg.text: Excellent fresh fish, the staff is friendly, helpful and the restaurant is clean with a great vibe. The desserts are incredible.The only thing I would change is adding more items to the menu for those who come in a group and would like something other than sushi.

kB5k9ieVf_wMjHf2WkjZEQ.text: ... Where to start... I first tried sushi wa based on some awesome reviews I read and really wanted to find a place in Henderson that can be my Togo place... Well when I arrived I was immediately told to try the tuna because it was fresh well this was sad because it was far from fresh so I began to try things that they didn't recommend and I ended up having a good meal the freshest fish that day was the super white tuna.. So I only killed 2 baby cockroaches on the sushi bar table that day and despite the not so fresh fish I decided to go again and take a friend the next week... Because I liked their dynamite and mussles  We had a sushi chef named waldo .. Waldo seemed to have a bad attitude and didn't like the fact that we Ordered a lot of food in fact one order he doubled the portion saying we ordered two orders instead of one which I know I wouldn't have ordered two orders ... Also I found out that they charge you if you order fresh wasabi I had it last time I was there and when I ordered it today they said there would be a charge come to find out I was charged for it last time but was not told so watch out ...  Now to the worse part of this meal there... I ordered the super white tuna and ate the first piece quickly I swallowed everything when I should have spit it out.... The fish was rank and bad and didn't even smell right I pointed this out to Waldo who smelled it and told me there was nothing wrong with it ... I asked his sushi chef friend to smell it himself and that guy said it was bad and apologized....   It's now Monday evening and I'm finally over the terrible bout of food poisoning That overtook me for the past 3 days since .. I'm finally eating solid foods rather then chicken broth and burnt toast... I never ever want this to happen again ... I believe that sushi wa does not keep fresh fish or quality control as I've read a lot more reviews about their quality issues.. Needless to say I will never eat here again nor will I recommend you eat here either I will also tell everyone I know about my ailment and 3 days of bed rest acquired from their poor quality control performance

6ZoQPjQ4pwuFO-8cgcv3qQ.text: Our favorite! !! We get our fix here weekly,  I highly recommend the peppered tuna!  Food, atmosphere and service deserve 5 stars!! Gio the manager and Mark the server Rock!

mssPEEZPcfpRFDdwgSGgCA.text: I'm sad for 3 reasons.  1. Sushi Wa is a far drive from my residency and from work.  But because my friends raved about this place, I really wanted to take the time and drive to try it.  2. My favorite kind of sushi which is the simple Salmon Sake Nigiri was laid on top of a super huge portion of rice and more importantly, the fish was NOT fresh.  HUGE disappointment!  3. My favorite roll which is the spicy tuna over crispy fried rice here was bland!  The fish looked like it has been out for days and they don't use fresh jalapeno?  Makes no sense.  I was a bit disgusted.  I also had their Yellowtail Nigiri; also not fresh.  I tried their garlic edamame; no taste and not even a hint of garlic.  When you say there is going to be garlic in a dish, I better taste it.  It's as if they like they completey forgot the ingredient and it's in the freakin' name.  Boo!  Then, I had their Ultimate Garlic Tuna Roll...and THUN THUN THUN.....again, no taste of any garlic.  The roll even sits on a bowl of soup that only makes it even worse because the soup base doesn't taste like anything but yuck.  I couldn't believe my dismay!  The one star goes to one appetizer: Fried Oysters, and one roll: Volcano roll.  The volcano roll was a little too much on the saucy side that if I had to finish it myself, I would feel guilty for my because of all the mayo clogging up my heart valves.  But because it had sauce, it was the only roll that had any flavor.  This was a huge disappointment.  Not only the taste, but the fish wasn't fresh.  Fresh comes first!  The wait  staff though was really nice, and the place is decorated nicely; kind of too fancy though.  Also, they over do the food presentation.  They need to work on the food taste rather than the presentation.  Just because something looks good, does not mean it tastes good.     I'll end on a positive note though.  They do have coffee mochi for dessert.  Not many AYCE sushi places have this mochi flavor.    If my friends convince me to go back to try their orders, I don't know.  Because the fish might still be from today.

6qdjOdLHnUSZZFUWOcmHJg.text: I've had sushi all over the country. This is the best I have ever had. Perfect texture and presentation. A+++

Cjy9aU8vyVHDu7RDv-P96g.text: Can we give this place a negative star??? The food is good but the service SUCKED bad! We only received half our order and I took literally 35mins for the first roll to hit the table, there was only like 8 tables being used so it was not busy at all. All and all I'm never coming here again.

ArMO1DfOtad285R32zZ36g.text: Absolutely perfect! Beautiful decor on the inside & out. Once you walk in, you are completely shocked that it is so elegant, but yet comfortable for dining. Sat at the bar, and our order was taken right away. Drinks were always refilled, and food came out in a perfect time. So stuffed from the delicious food, & prices were great too. Terrific customer service. Chef JJ told me he liked my glasses, too funny! Definitely going to go back! Probably in my top 3 favorite sushi restaurants. & please tip these guys, they do such an amazing job.

WXki8H5nDIXCAFydP0rkOg.text: Went here last month been meaning to write about the excellent quality of there fish. Sat at the bar and JJ was our cook, we did the all you can eat. Great service and food. JJ even made us a little something special after we were full. Thanks for great service and food.

w4xZdcwCvhaWHC8QvXfFGQ.text: My favorite sushi in las vegas area.  Try the Hawaiian roll and superman burrito!  Fish quality is better than other places and the flavors are popping! Decor is nice as well and adds to the experience.  Sushi chefs are friendly and helpful.

A17QVBUiZqPWK-hww_GLpQ.text: Another sushi joint owned by Koreans. This means that they also have a couple (ribs and bulgogi) on their [AYCE] menu. I enjoyed coming here, but it is hard to make it a consistent visit because it can get quite pricey even without the AYCE.  I suggest coming here to eat their uni (sea urchin) and octopus though! It is one of the most fresh sushi joints for those two that I have had!

jI4CCInN1AJwgZ2Vqm_FLQ.text: Food is great but service is lacking,. Especially the Japanese looking lady who stands around. I'm not sure if she is a waitress or a supervisor but her attitude needs some improvement. I do not want to go into detail but my brother and I did not feel welcome at all. We felt insulted even because we eat a lot but then we ordered the AYCE so that should not have mattered. She kept talking to our servers until they came to use less and less frequently. She even held up an order for some reason before it finally reached us. We followed the rules on their AYCE menu so none of her attitude was called for. My brother and I agreed to find another sushi place as our go to. Never coming back.

nqxLQR5qnC80FdKq-tIfyw.text: Not exactly sure where the 4 stars rating came from.  My husband and I dined here for lunch and was far from impressed.  We started with hamachi, ahi and salmon nigiri.  Was that really sushi grade? All 3 taste nothing like what it's suppose to and left our mouths with the worse metallic after taste. Sushi rolls and appetizers have zero flavor and they love to serve things one at a time with a 5-8 minute wait time in between each entree as well as use tons or rice to get us full much faster.  As for the service, the lady at the door wasn't very pleasant but our server was nice.  Doubt we'll ever come back.  Goyemon seems to be at the top of our list and the best ayce sushi restaurant by far.

_pYTxhKO3xu1VOuun2Sz_w.text: I really love this sushi restaurant!    Not sure why anyone would give this place a bad review...?!  I am a sushi lover and have been to VERY expensive sushi restaurants all over the US.   Obviously, fresh fish is the most important criteria for finding good sushi!    Sushi Wa goes the distance in this catagory.  Believe me, if it isn't fresh, I'd know!  Sushi Wa provides a very nice ambiance in their restaurant.   Semi circular booths and tables are all very comfortable.  If you want one of the booths, come early or see if you can arrange for a reservation before heading out to eat.  What is fabulous here, is the all you can eat menus for lunch and dinner.   Yes, they have rules, but the wait staff was very good in helping us with our choices and explaining the rules to us.   I thought the rules were very fair and simply created to stop people from ordering food they weren't going to waste!    Seems logical to me!  The sushi is amazing!    The presentation is superb!      Cons:   I would like to see the people who bus the tables do a better job of cleaning off the tables!      Sushi can be messy, and the tables need extra care in cleaning them.  Believe me when I say, "I'll be back!"

Gp6dM43lQc1y_3HfoaS-BQ.text: This is more than likely my favorite place for Sushi in all of Henderson.  I really like the set up its not a huge place but the use the space well.  I have been here at least 5 times and have done both bar seating as well as one of the many booths.  I always get AYCE because it is a fantastic value.  The ambience is good too, I used to dine at Sushi Mon but it has a more of a banquent feel to it.  Our waiter was pretty quick and attentive as well( he did forget an order of soup) but he was good enough for us to not really care.  If you are looking to try one of the many Sushi spots on eastern.....this is a must try.

jExwb7ylOL5HuIkzvPg_gw.text: this was our first and last time coming here.    we had 2 servers.  the first one (tall/skinny) was nice.  the second server was shorter and NOT NICE.    i let the 2nd server know that our sprite tasted more like soda water and she said it was sprite (basically saying i was wrong) i asked for a coke instead of arguing with her about the taste.   the 1st server was nice enough to say they had to change the bag on the sprite.    we got 1 tiny serving of ginger (like 3 slivers of ginger) / wasabi for the 2 of us.  we asked the 2nd server for more ginger.  she never brought it.  we asked the 1st server for more ginger (since the 2nd one didnt bring it) - she brought it.    then they changed servers and didnt tell us so we waited forever to place another all you can eat round.    after the 1st server let us know they changed up, we decided to just order dessert and be done with the place.    1st server convinced me to get 1 banana tempura and 2 different scoops for ice cream instead of 2 banana tempura (since they use an entire banana).  ok, cool...sounds amazing.  2nd server drops of 1 banana tempura with 1 scoop of ice cream.  1st server comes back after the dessert is eaten. i let her know we didnt get what she suggested and the 2nd server didnt seem to care, come back or ask us about it.    then the owner drops off the check and asks if its ready to be picked up.  sure....   hey, thanks for asking new customers how their experience was. it was kinda crappy!      SIN CITY SUSHI - sit at the bar.  better service. better sushi. better experience.

v-C2m7sVZnLAuwjFl_28Gg.text: Great all u can eat and great service. We love coming here because we can get right in. Get the fresh sashimi

ikDuXLDhJ9OkKY-SYbOozQ.text: Best all you can eat ever! So much variety and options to choose from. Service was fast and very hospitable. One of my all time favorite sushi places.

lt9ocMsscy2D94yNUQY7eA.text: WA WA WA.  Yep, every time I passed Sushi Wa, I promised myself I would never eat there.  Why?  Because I had eaten there for lunch one day with the wife and mother in law.  I found the food was average at best.  However, one of my kids friends from 808 said that this was one of his fav places so I said, okay what the heck....  So, on a Saturday night about 8:30 pm, I came here with my young son who has never had real sushi before, only the western style sushi...  a.  Ambiance - We sat at the bar, which I never do due to larger crowds and we want to have conversation.  The bar is the best place here to sit. Everywhere else seems a bit too "cold".  but the bar is really simple and comforting at same time.   b.  Service - Very, very good.  Attentive to our needs, mostly Korean speaking, but basic Japanese words are discussed.  Small amounts of rice, that is cool!  c.  Food - here is where it is amazing:  a. Tobico - Flying Fish Roe with squid ink to a black caviar style look.  what a cool dish. Tasty and unique.  b. Amai Ebi - Here the sweet shrimp was perfect and the fried shrimp heads were suckilicious.  Meaning I  was sucking and chewing on these fried heads like it was fried chicken!  Yummy.  c.  Maguro - I always ask for Maguro with a sliver of lemon and jalapeno I did not get this here when I ordered it. Instead of a sliver of lemon, with the rind and all, I got a peeled lemon with the meat only and sprinkled with shavings of jalapeno.  this was AMAZING  d.  Uni - Fresh, awesome texture.  My young son ate it too!  That says it all.  e. Breakdown - OK, broke down and had a Dragon Roll, the quintessential westernized plan for sushi.  even this was good and I was most impressed.  This place is my newest and most favorite sushi place in the 89052 area code.

ISDeeODEeALT_yEQUsAUjg.text: This is my second time eating here,it's very good place for me because I get off the work really late at work...so I am so happy they open till to 4am.last time I order spicy Korean ramen and tuna poke ,tasty very good and tonight I will try something else..

ZvEFiHDgum3n626z2Kw5pA.text: I have always enjoyed this place because Joon, the owner, always makes sure to take very good care of us. Usually we order the all you can eat sushi which in and of itself is amazingly priced and encompassingly delicious. Everything from the udon to the seemingly endless list of rolls. But Last night my girlfriend and I decided to try something new: Omakase.  For those of you who are unaware, Omakase in Japanese roughly translates to "I leave it to you." Meaning the chef has free reign to give you whatever they think you'll love and you as the customer must have full faith in the chef that they will provide you with a meal that won't be forgotten.  Joon blew us away with amazing attention to detail. The fish he used literally fell apart in our mouths before we even started to chew and the flavorful combinations this 15 year veteran delivered to us were nothing short of daring and delicious. If you have the budget for it, I would highly recommend that you try Omakase from Joon, you won't regret it and I'm positive it isn't the last time I will do so either. (Oh and don't forget to tip your chef with some Mu Sake after the meal!)   Bravo.

7VrI1G6fQtnDOs-zp4dM2w.text: This is our go to for AYCE on this side of town. The late hours are great.  I had the bento box.  At 1am it was a good mix of items and really hit the spot.  The mango salmon roll was surprisingly refreshing and crisp quality.  Thank you Miko for always taking of us!  Excellent service.  Asks before I even realize I need something.  I love that!

q6GOHCEEyKHgSLKMvQ8krg.text: I'm assuming this place is better during dinner time?!?   My daughter and I came in for lunch before hitting TJoes across the street. I've never been here until today. When you walk in it is quite impressive, tall half round booths, dark rich colors and a hip atmosphere. We were seated right away by friendly staff.  We decided to go with the lunch box and a couple of rolls. I opted for the salmon for my lunch bento. I highly recommend NOT getting the salmon with your lunch box. Apparently, "cooking" fish isn't their thing. It was a flimsy piece of salmon but it was the $9 lunch box so I get it. But did they have to overcook it? The edges were hard and dry, thank god for the teriyaki sauce. The tempura was tempura, the rice was rice and the California rolls were California rolls, no biggie.   What I found interesting and cost efficient was placing shredded iceberg lettuce underneath the mixed greens. Did I sign up for that? As Cher said on Clueless, it's like a Monet. From a distance it's pretty but when you get up close, it's a mess. It's not word for word but you get my point.   Then after we were finished, our soup arrived?!? Our server forgot.  I'm going to leave the review on the rolls alone. Just look at the pictures.

pLYvbSprHixdWfMnSR86GQ.text: Came in today from nor Cal. Went in search of a place to eat from my hotel. Saw the sign for sushi next to another restaurant and a yogurt place. Decided I would try it.    Was very pleased with great service,  great sushi and some excellent green tea. I had spider roll, mango salmon roll and veggie tempura. The spider roll was one of the tastiest I have ever had. The crab was just perfect and fresh. So was the mango and salmon on the other.  Very fresh tasting. The vegetable tempura was also very fresh tasting and not overcooked or over fried.  If you like green tea,  try this one, you will be pleased. Best of service by waiter and sushi chef. I Would recommend this restaurant if you want fresh and tasty sushi.   They also had lots of other options for people that don't like sushi, including bento boxes, teriyaki and traditional Japanese.  If I lived here I would visit regularly. Keep up the good job!

F7l5Nz0JQpLmXBZ0saFIBg.text: My girl and I were coming back from a film screening and it was already 10PM. We weren't feeling like getting fast food so we jumped on the yelp and found a couple of places that were open late past 10pm.  As a rule of thumb we don't like to eat at any restaurant especially a sit down restaurant when it's 30 mins to closing. From our experience the food quality isn't as good, the staff wants to go home, and the overall service can be less than standard.  Well it turns out Sushi Wa stays open till 4am. WTH? Who does that em' I right? So we dropped in to give it a shot.  We went on a Wednesday and the place was empty except for 2 other dining parties. We were seated immediately. The interior ambiance is best described as on the darker/dimly lit side. I guess it's to make things seem romantic, but I didn't care for it. I prefer a brighter setting so I can see my food and the menu easier. My weary old eyes aren't what they used to be.  The menu has alot of rolls, noodles, and bento box options. They also have all you can eat (AYCE) with specific items designated only order once meaning you can only order that particular item once. They don't want you scarfing down the super expensive sashimi and premium goodies too many times. This is typical in an AYCE sushi place as Yama Sushi and Goyemon (the two AYCE sushi joints I typically frequent) do the same.   We weren't feeling super hungry so we went with their Teriyaki Bento Box meals. We got one with the Tonkatsu and one with Salmon Teriyaki. They were both identical in content except one had pork and one had salmon. Overall the bento was pretty tasty with the shrimp and veggie tempura, miso soup, salad, rice and california roll. Everything tasted good, but wasn't extraordinary. We had the teriyaki on the side so the grilled salmon was un-sauced and pretty tasty on its own.  Overall I'd give Sushi Wa another visit because the food is decent and more importantly it's open super late. 4am late. Nothing good ever comes about around 2am, but if you manage to survive till 3am then you might as well get some Japanese food if you're in the area.

The mussels were actually good, but the energy roll had way too much too it and we couldn't even finish it, halfway through I started gagging, there was something about it that did not taste good at all. The spicy tuna was decent but it was really spicy compared to the other spicy tuna I've had before. And the screaming O tasted extremely spicy and the fish tasted off. The waitress only came to top off our waters twice, which I  kinda get since she was the only waitress working there. The manager however stayed in the back the whole damn time when he could of been helping, he did nothing to help out at all which pissed me off even more.  It took us 30 minutes to even get our Check. I have never left a restaurant more angry and disgusted until now. I will never be recommending this place to anyone OR be coming back here, you guys f***ing SUCK. Please for the love of god DO NOT COME HERE!

H5hSg9_AaSJu0ziavNM0Bg.text: Sushi Wa isn't the top option for AYCE but they're good enough to get regular visits. We can always walk right in when our go-to spot is busy. The sushi is consistent as is the service for us.  With plenty of seating, including some high back booths for privacy, there is rarely a wait here. On busy nights, they'll have two to three servers running the floor with male manager/owner that's doing all the seating, running food, and helping out with take out. I've noticed two servers that are consistently there, with frequent turnover with the other servers which may lead to an occasional inconsistency with service depending on who is there.  The AYCE menu is pretty standard with your regular lineup of nigiri and hot apps. Some of the hot tapas aren't that impressive such as the soft shell crab and pork belly and I would suggest you steer clear of to save room for sushi. I usually don't make it to the rolls, but when I'm there with friends the do prefer rolls, they have decent list of interesting and unique ones. For the non sushi eaters, the bento boxes are a good value with Korean BBQ short ribs being the favorite of my wife.  Pricing is $23/$27 for lunch/dinner with super late hours for the night owls. Some people get their panties all bunched up over non Japanese owned sushi joints. But for me, you can come from Mars and have an extra arm coming out of the top of your head, as long as you can make sushi rice and can place a fresh piece of fish neatly on top of it, I'm a fan and you'll get my business.

Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Pistachio ice cream

b5zyTbVouEAjoUf5rcoqUQ.text: My friend is a sushi enthusiast and raves about this place so I decided to give it a try! I think Sushi Wa has THE BEST rolls and I normally don't go for rolls when we get AYCE sushi. Each roll was so flavorful and really well put together. I usually always go for nigiri and overall, I think nigiri here was okay. However, the peppered seared tuna is amazing and I haven't seen that particular nigiri at any other sushi place. My friends also said that their uni was really good. I wasn't able to try too many of their appetizers but they all looked good and I look forward to trying those next time!  The only thing I didn't really understand was that they said they started a timer and I believe the limit to dine is about 1.5-2 hours. But at the time we came in it was not busy at all and so I felt a little rushed. Also, if we put in an order we weren't allowed to put in another order until everything on the previous order came out which I felt really delayed our dinner. Towards the end of our meal we were planning on ordering a few more items but our server was already asking for our dessert orders so we assumed our time was coming to an end.

kkW8sDvrPEJzPX0esXQL6Q.text: Sushi freak here, I have been coming to Sushi Wa for over a half a decade and I can safely say... this is my favorite sushi spot in the whole damn world. It has only gotten better over the years. Straight up, you need to get the all you can eat and immediately order a dozen garlic tuna's, it will change your life. Also make sure to get the screaming O right off the bat because you can keep the sauce around and dip the other items you get for the rest of your meal. The salmon sashimi is soooooo buttery.  Seriously can't go wrong here! Love this place

GyA9CAjLA04ln-FWMbx6tg.text: This is my second time here, not by choice but because the other sushi place was closed.    But my first time here I thought that this place was just okay.  Decent, but okay.  I didn't like that they didn't have half orders and the sauteed calamari was INSANELY INSANELY salty.  Other than that the servers where nice and service was great in general and the food was good as well.    My second time around, I kind of enjoyed it a lot more.  I think because we had my brother with me and he would finish whatever we didn't finish which allowed me to try more rolls.  Plus, if it weren't for the table across from us and me asking what they were having I would have not know of the other rolls.  I saw the other table with a no rice sushi roll which I didn't see on the menu the first time.  Maybe the rolls need to be sectioned off so you can tell from the no rice or deep fried rolls. Or maybe because the menu look so busy with words like "NOT A.Y.C.E" and the numerous sections that I didn't pay too much attention to the ingredients in the rolls and/or how its prepared.  The way some things are worded on the menu confused me too when it came to the Sashimi part.  It sounds like I can have one of each time in that section one time but its not the case.  The servers this go around where awesome again.    So with that being said, I wouldn't mind coming back.  Happy Eatings!

VL8yHQjFvBxrrKZiLI6IWg.text: I have to say probably one of the worst sushi places I have ever tried. The food was not fresh the crabmeat it's fake crab meat and has a really fishy smell to it and not to mention I ordered the Rocky roll and it came as a big ball which did not specify that on Uber eats this place has nothing special to it.. you are honestly better off going to eat a are you can eat place it's just not worth the money to be honest

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Rocky

oPKPPAEBW2y7tKj_SCmx6Q.text: This place was such an after thought I wondered if it was worth reviewing.   Two stars for being open so late, but that's the main thing it has going for it.  The beginning of April I pre ordered my role at probably 2am, and when I got there I stood there at least 5 minutes before being acknowledged.    This late at night I usually let service pass because I'm just greatful I can get food so late.  However,  the rolls are not cheap if you are doing Al la carte rather than doing all you can eat.  The fish and execution are on not high enough to merit those prices.   It seems artificially inflated to get you to choose the option of gorging yourself all night.     The roll I got was bland,  it was wrapped in cucumber, and the decorative cucumber on the side was not even cleaned. I rubbed my finger on it and dirt came off....if this is what you offer who would want all you can eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Dirty cucumber decoration
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Bland,  something was missing to make it pop.  Fish was not super fresh to pull it off.

L8YImRa5f5CR_okDm3a3EA.text: We always go here for late night dinner but got disappointed with how rude the server was... The food is great but the servers are not really pleasant compare to other all you can eat sushi place... giving it less than one star for customer service... I think they need to retrain their people on how to approach customers properly....

bhC8kSmZKN2dcrs4i_1lrQ.text: Wow, we went as a party of 6 today. The food was good but the service ruined our experience. I have no idea how they have 4 stars!  The waitress was not helpful, nice or attentive to our needs. I understand you already know that you're getting an 18% auto gratuity but it does not create cause for bad service. We like to eat a lot and it means 3 or 4 rounds of ordering. We had to keep flagging the servers to put in additional orders. She didn't ask how we wanted to split the bill or provide eye contact as we were hoping to get another dessert round since it wasn't limited.   The meal was $28 each for AYCE which some items were included and others not. I really liked the nigiri and sashimi as well as the other dishes but it's not enough in a service based city.  We will not be coming back to Sushi Wa or recommending it to anyone. The location had a trendy look and feel when you walk in. Music was loud playing with hip hop music, it was a low lighting environment and the part that bothered someone in our party was that we were told to put the menus on the floor for more table space which means dirty menus in our hands.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Checking this place out

kbXo9b7rbPBxyY269yfRvQ.text: The food is okay for all you can eat. Please be aware that they don't honor the free beer when you check in. We were told that you have to write a good review on yelp to get the beer with yelp check in. They will only honor one beer per a table.

g5eDSWhz563O9wRClzOLMg.text: This place is the SAKE BOMB!   You won't go wrong. The all you can eat is legit. I think I need a nap.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. This place is fantastic! Like Asian Thanksgiving!

AqPM9CtOCMQletzuWwWIkQ.text: I was in today and waited over 10 minutes and no one ever tried to seat me.  I watched as the staff horse play over the food while I waited. Did not stay! Will not return!

aW_Un8ICLiqXEe8jH6i2ug.text: Awesome atmosphere! Should probably out uni shooters on the menu, but that my only qualm. A-Aron is the man!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Sapporo and love

ozVEdrc3-5fvlzF-SavVYA.text: It's rare to find a good quality AYCE sushi restaurant that includes sashimi. Sure certain restaurants (starts with a T ends with odai and the other place starts with an M and ends with akino) serve AYCE sushi and sashimi but the quality's poor.  Although there's a limit to how much sashimi you can order at Sushi Wa, you're guaranteed to have fresh fish that looks and tastes superb. It's a 20+ miles away from where I love but it's worth it. The interior is clean and modern. The servers are great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Amaebi, fried shrimp heads, salmon and uni

g7-9huY1ebMnc-3vlOwtmA.text: This is my favorite AYCE place by far! The lady who greeted us was super nice and friendly, the food was super fresh, amazingly good and came out extremely fast! The two servers working (Jenny and Shenna) really made my night! Their service was phenomenal! They helped everyone find things they would like on the menu; they were extremely attentive to our table and not to mention hilarious! I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends. Great job guys! :)

Q8lo8PfCO-Amn6CEWIbGyA.text: This place is great for sushi night. Nice location and the inside is comfortable. Tried many rolls and all were delicious and creative. Definitely try the XXX.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Dragon Roll

fsjNE8q-aTP2iRGkjz7wZw.text: I wish I could undo that meal selection.  Decor, music and plating of the meal were excellent  Service, freshness of fish, and pricing were good.  Here is where they disappoint.  The amount of rice they pack into the Nigiri sushi. I'm not one to fuss about eating the rice. I enjoy it quite a bit but this place over did it.  Some of the sauces were terrible and do not belong on the Nigiri that I was ordering.   The jalapenos on my sushi were dark forest green, pickled and cut to the same diameter as the canned ones you put on a ball park hot dog. Gross!    This was the worst sushi I've had in town.   This place could be excellent if they would just use proper recipes and ingredients.

fsbYzv2FxQRE7sWI60eZpw.text: I have been coming here for over a year and I honestly feel like this is one of the best sushi bars in vegas! Ayce sushi usually means a little bite of fish on a huge chunk of rice but not here. The fish is usually ample and so amazingly fresh! My favorites have to be the salmon and garlic tuna! They also have a great selection of rolls that do not leave you wishing you had gone somewhere else. The superman roll is by far my most favorite roll of the restaurant then the screaming o roll! Those two rolls are what keep me coming back time and time again! So if I were to rate this place on just the quality of the sushi and the rolls it would definitely be a 5 star place but unfortunately there's another part to the stars which is service. The wait staff is awesome some are more attentive then others but generally they all make yoy feel welcome and treat you well and keep your drinks filled up the sushi chefs though are not all wonderful! I feel as though sushi chefs should be personable and care about the people they are serving which I do believe two of them do but there is one sushi chef ( I think his name is danny) (I could be wrong) he is scary and he makes you feel bad for ordering more stuff and even though he's speaking in Japanese you can tell he's complaining about all the people who are there to eat or what they are ordering. He does alot of huffing and puffing and eye rolling sighing and complaining. It's horrible and every time I walk in and see him behind the bar I give a quick prayer that I don't have to sit in front of him or that he's not the main sushi chef for the night cause he makes the other chefs grumpy also. So food is amazing, prices are average for ayce in vegas and the service is great if you don't get the one chef that can make your night rough.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmmmm scallop sushi!

JBI6FfYj7dsOa3CLwSnwrA.text: Best sushi place in town! Always good service and the most amazing food! It's a little pricy but definitely worth every penny!

iOtiuzqPs1QaG7CqkHj78w.text: wowwwwww! Its so delicious! We really loved so much and will be back for sure! Its so good quality of sushi! Top 5 in my life!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. So delicious!

3gFmWWWnu-wjjfDHOSwgLA.text: First time coming in! Everyone was very welcoming and nice. Kept checking on us. The food as well was amazing! Not a big sushi fan but if I were to get sushi again I would recommend this place!

SuBQLQQxdHe9oqXXQf_meQ.text: First time coming here, my expectations were high as a I frequent many sushi spots around Vegas. I heard good things about Sushi Wa so I was very excited. Upon coming in, I was greeted and was seated right away. The ambience of the place was casual and soothing. Not many people were here because maybe it was around 9 pm on a holiday weekend.  I sat at the bar and was immediately asked if it was my first time here by the chef. I said yes, and he told me to ask if I had any questions. The food selection is great with many variations. I  chose to wat AYCE and I definitely got my money's worth by eating here. I ordered and I got my foos right away. Also, Chef Joon oppa was very accommodating and nice to me. He was friendly and made me feel very welcome in his sushi restaurant. With that, I have been coming here regularly.   Food:  fresh and consistent  Ambience:  clean, casual, and relaxing (music is not too loud) Service:  topnotch as always

TY3deL0xFCaD6m1DfMuynQ.text: The AYCE option let's you try everything, which hubby and I love. We hadn't been here in a while but we're glad we came, for the most part. The tuna poki salad was good, we loved the Mango Salmon Roll, Double D, and Baked Salmon Roll. Hubby ordered the Albacore Salad and it was huge, so unfortunately he got full on that pretty quick.  The disappointments were the Ultimate Garlic Tuna Roll, which surprisingly lacked flavor, and the Green Tea Tempura Ice Cream, which wasn't very crunchy at all. Also got a very oily sweet potato tempura, which we didn't eat. And one shrimp tempura with the Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura left me wanting more shrimp. They should offer half roll options too, not just for the last roll.

Fp4OO2NgFruSUV1G-whiDA.text: This is a hidden jem, The service always exceeds my expectations..The rolls are unique and very tasty.. I try and order something new every time but find my old favorites the Superman and lava roll.. It is worth the drive and money no doubt. ..

ZchyhXR-Na9eGEtuB1tw6Q.text: Boyfriend was craving sushi & this place is literally down the street from where we live so we decided to check it out even tho a lot of the yelp reviews mentioned horrible service. I don't know if it's because we came for lunch and it wasn't busy, but everything was AMAZING!   We were immediately greeted & seated upon entering the restaurant which was surprisingly large & beautifully decorated. We sat at the bar and chose to have the AYCE. Our waiter was extremely polite and helpful in explaining the menu. His timing on checking in on our needs was perfect. The sushi chef even checked in on us periodically to see if we wanted to order anything else. So to sum it all up, it's unfortunate that so many yelpers had bad experiences here with their service but thankfully, ours was PERFECT! We'll definitely be back!  And the icing on the cake... SUSHI WAS FANTASTIC!

_zmzqVmTG8HRvJjtFZUrfA.text: Horrible service. We ordered uni that came to our table looking discolored and smelling really weird, we told our server and he's like "well if it's bad then don't eat it." What a ridiculous response!  At one point we also tried to order more and our server was like "you have more food coming...just wait" and he refused to take our order.  Overall just tremendously rude. Sushi was not fresh. Lots of rice that was way too filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Discolored and smelly uni that was not fresh.

bcB8R3x0wmEXuEh7dRIOXQ.text: This is by far our favorite sushi place. Such Quality and detailed service. The Sushi is amazing. They also just started staying open for late night sushi. (I believe until 4 am) which is wonderful for us late nighters!

rpWKCTKijq9SQNL3UzO6og.text: I judge all ayce sushi places on the caterpillar roll.  That being said...  The caterpillar roll was bland. There was no real taste of eel, from the actual eel or the eel sauce. I don't use wasabI and soy for this roll because I like the eel taste, but I did here.  The crunch scallop roll was generous. This was also on the bland side of the taste spectrum, but it's scallop so that's not surprising.  The spicy tuna roll was all heat and no flavor. This was disappointing.  The cucumber in the rolls was chewy. Cucumber is supposed to be crisp and crunchy.  The service is great though. My water glass was never empty and the server was always available for questions.  The pricing was fair for what I got and I left full, so that's good.  But I really was not a fan of the taste of the food.  It was an ok choice for a sushi lunch gamble on the other side of the world from where I usually am.  Would I come here again? Not likely.

qMIs0C9RyniLAwOl1PHx6w.text: This place is ridonkulous.  I don't use the word "ridonkulous" often but this place deserves it! AYCE is phenomenal. Wa Salad is some incredible sashimi salad concoction that deserves it's own platform to perform on.  Kid friendly yet posh looking on the inside. Standing ovation.  I will be back.  Maybe even tomorrow.  Moved down to 4 stars from 5.  This last trip back, the food was still good bit service not so much.

rcxOFY4tnkVCVs-10b-D1w.text: Great food. Nigiri sushi size are just right for you to enjoy.  Sushi Bomb Level 10. A must for those loves spicy food.  They should do a challenge for this

lf5ovK-AY7m16VsaPcjZFA.text: Sushi Wa -  the ambiance here is nice, modern chic.      We had a huge party of 24, made a reservation the set up was quite confusing. But we got it handled.       Obviously 24 people could get pretty confusing for AYCE but the server was patient. He did forget things at times but we we tried to be patient and understanding.     Quality of sushi was good. I liked how they actually have sashimi in the AYCE

ZH0AN3RUwNdu-hyjzuYFOw.text: The staff was extremely friendly and kind. Loved the atmosphere and not to mention the sushi is AMAZING. Definitely one of the best in Henderson/Las Vegas area.

cSRStQjLmRt85_8CmwyXoA.text: I went with my two friends expecting to have a nice dinner. We asked for two orders of sashimi to start, and got our drinks. I noticed that my water tasted off, kind of fishy. Which surprised me because it's just water, it shouldn't be that hard to screw up.          After 20 minutes of waiting for our sashimi our waiter came up and asked us if we were ready to order, but our sashimi still wasn't there. We asked him if our sashimi was ready, and he said that he had totally forgotten that we had even ordered. So we waited again for them to bring out our sashimi. After they brought it out we were already feeling weird. They were serving everyone else in the building, but we felt neglected.          The sashimi was thin and crunchy, after we asked for the check because we just wanted to leave after all of that. We had a terrible experience. After we paid we walked out, and went to Osaka.

PDcBN2t5PxIarX8x5sfrwg.text: This is one of the best sushi joints around. Super cool ambiance and some of the best cuts of fish ever! Awesome service! Try the Superman Burrito.

g-GtXO6m_Krjs4bZZJ80Ww.text: Love it, the ambience, the service, the food...all wonderful. Went last night around 10pm and was immediately greeted and seated at one of the comfy booths. Super friendly staff, not pushy or overbearing but always available when needed. Can really tell that they have fun and enjoy working there together. Ordered bulgogi bento box, tonkatsu ramen n chicken katsu bowl. Everything was awesome, yummy and plentiful...next time we just gotta share a bento box or get two bowls cuz we failed miserably at trying to finish it all.  They offer AYCE also for $27 and the menu choices are extensive, will definitely try this option out one day when we are much more hungrier. Can't believe they are open to 4am! This place is a win for Henderson...don't pass it up!

78VszHd2WeCVSrl7qq2gqw.text: Very pleasurable experience! The food was on point and Aaron and Joon gave great service, but the part that I really liked was the fact that they're open until 4am which is nice for me cuz I typically get off at 12 or 1AM

V9gLfHHaNiyFfzjMiT_zYA.text: Awesome service and the pocky roll is a must!!! The fish was very fresh tasting. Definitely becoming a regular.

1gJxF8ZukpeF61uF-PoUYA.text: Amazing sushi!!! AYCE is a must.  The "Salmon Crunch" is the best.  The Garlic Tuna is superb. Great restaurant!

o3xcTGgSn9ixkx764E0f0A.text: DO NOT EAT HERE unless you want food poisoning. I've eaten at other sushi places and I've never felt sicker in my life. Also the services was not that good. The waiters would get annoyed if we asked to order more stuff (we were a group of 12) and seemed like he didn't want us there. Overall the sushi may be good when you're there but you'll regret it as soon as you're stomach begins to feel it.

rq53yuwIxY6m80kQk8hdJA.text: This place is awesome. And I love the little Asian server lady at night. She's the best we have been coming here forever and I will always come back I love the food, people and chefs

GsQbQy4gOGjJ8M9K3dYS5Q.text: Update: I don't know how I didn't mention this before, but if you like salmon this place is the best. Something about how they prep it makes it better than all the other spots around town. It's almost creamy, melt in your mouth type deliciousness.  This place was great. AYCE and the dudes are quick and the food is delicious and fresh. The screaming orgasm is great, but if you're just a simple fish guy like me know that everything is fresh and delicious so just ordering perpetual salmon orders is good too. The baked salmon roll is one of my girlfriend's favorites. See pics to experience envy and hunger.

Rn2PALd4StZ773z0SuiBxg.text: Service is not that good. Ramen tasted like water. AYCE has sushi and rolls, not a lot of selections. It wasn't a good overall experience for me.

gmWOHrMHaZe0FWuIKBL6gA.text: Lemme start by saying:  If I could give this place a 3.5 I would. The fish was great for the all you can eat price. The environment was awesome, large alcohol range, and the menu is huge. The staff was also friendly. My first complaint is that you can't order half rolls until your last order. Personally, when I come to all you can eat sushi, I like ordering half rolls to have more variety. My main problem with my first and only visit here was that the staff, while they were very nice, they kept forgetting or messing things up. As someone with experience in food, I get mistakes happen. But after an incorrect drink, two plates that we didn't order, and our forgotten tempura ice cream, it got annoying. I would be open to visiting again for the food, but am open to finding another sushi joint.

iG4SLLQq8Q-8Iopu2mNAjQ.text: Im taking stars away for a few reasons.   1- my sisters and I are practically professional at AYCE sushi. So we may have frightened our sushi chef when we ordered 20 different items right from the get-go! Need I mind you, 20 items mostly consisting of sushi that comes 2 to an order at which we order 3 of each can seem like a lot of orders but not between 3 girls. Our server came back to tell us "you know you have to eat everything in all you can eat or you get charged from left orders?" My sisters and I looked at each other with a smirk. Oh yeah! We know!! She proceeded to tell us that they are going to break up our order in half just in case we don't eat it all. Needless to say we shocked the staff by ordering more and desert!! We weren't worried about them breaking it up in half because we knew we would eat it, the timing between was just slow. Hence why we order everything first. There's nothing like a 10-15 minute gap between orders.   2- this might be TMI but I'm breastfeeding, so I can't have spicy food without burning my son's butt. I am also lactose so I can't have cream cheese. My one sister doesn't like to try new things so she likes to stick to what she knows, while my other sister is adventurous. The fact that they don't do half orders during AYCE is disappointing. The half orders are a good way for us to try a little bit of everything so we can see what we like. But we were told we can only have our last order be a half order. Bummer!! I honestly Never heard of that, and I frequent sushi!   I will say the sushi was good, and the service was ok. But what sets this place apart from the rest is their AYCE- it really left us disappointed. Being a big sushi lover, I'm sad to say neither of my sisters nor myself will be coming back and is no longer on our recommended places of sushi.

liWQ7W-GJS-V6U4UGfuXJQ.text: Knowledgeable, happy staff. Great food that came out hot and fresh! My plate had so much food! I ordered the lunch bulgogi special and it was great!

F4KMWq8Lz9fACnXJX8-Wlg.text: My brother lives in LV so he is an avid AYCE sushi eater...always in search of the next big thing. He stands by this place as his new favorite sushi place.   1. They are open till 4AM! Ridiculous, but amazing for Vegas people.   2. Service is great. All the servers are very attentive.   3. If you checkin in and write a review you can receive a free beverage! (Hence, myself writing a review...when I normally don't)   4. Everything is fresh!   The almost perfect items...  1. It's super dark in the restaurant.   2. I wish they didn't have a limit on Uni! Or other popular items...but I guess that's how they maintain cost.   Other than that! Everything was great! I wish there were more AYCE sushi back home. I will definitely come back.

Z2SLUC5eh1eEimOY63V1Iw.text: Food was good , Farley priced! Great Service !! Nothing really to complain about . For two people the portions were big for us like the rolls it would have been nice to just do half of them. Too rich to each eat four of the same thing. My only complaint!!  Portions were big for a sushi place lol ! Weird I know but my preference only!

CUfS_KSsjRot7zkBcR5UsQ.text: Probably my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. Off the strip with ala carte or a great price in AYCE. Fresh fish, great service, and a bit off the beaten path of the strip.

Td1thC3ezVJUObBnL0c4Ug.text: In town visiting my brother, we both love sushi and Japanese food so he knew I'd love it here! I always take his advice on food because he is a chef and knows what he is talking about. Sushi Wa has a great vibe and the food is amazing. Probably some of the freshest, most flavorful sushi I have yet to have. My favorite and I think we ate almost every item in the menu because we came multiple days is the Sushi Bomb! I can't get enough of that stuff! The staff is friendly and so helpful. I only wish there was a Sushi Wa back home in Texas!  Go, eat and enjoy! You won't be disappointed! Thanks Joon, your food was delicious! I will be back next time I am in town!

n6fGod4pbE0NVDhd0a-fgA.text: Girlfriend and I dropped by with our best friend for all-you-can eat one day and we simply had to come back!   Great, friendly staff, lots of choices, and the only place open till 4am. Really was great for the rare late night sushi craving.   Dont be fooled by the number of check-ins, I've been here more than enough times to love this place. Highly recommend the Pepper Seared Baby Tuna and the Scallop Roll. For those looking for a fried treat, try the Who's Your Daddy and if you like spice, try a Sushi Bomb! It's spicy level is from 1 to 10, with a 4 being like tabasco sauce and a 6 being like Habanero levels. Order 10 at your own risk!  Highly recommend this place for couples, groups, or for anyone looking to get their sushi fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Bomb Lvl 5 (Not for the faint of heart!)

af4WByyoi62-W1JNI4wJEQ.text: Super great. Excellent service from A-Aron!!! Would recommend to a friend. I love the all you can eat specials.

OjWUFwl5scbIj0v6soSVmw.text: A-Aron is the best server, definitely sit in his section. Best all you can eat sushi!

32StUfmGOVHPJ7JyGmJgjQ.text: Went here for the first time with a party of 6, around 2AM. We were seated immediately.  The atmosphere feels more higher end than most sushi spots. At night, the tables are dimly lit and the seating areas are nice. The interior has a modern feel and overall, it felt pleasant.  The food was great. One of the main pros is the size of their menu. It probably has the best selection of appetizers that I've seen, which I consider to be equally as important as the sushi. The portions here are extremely generous. The size of the sushi rolls are definitely on the large side.  One of the strongest aspects of this place is the service. Our server was Aaron. He had some great energy, and was just a generally fun person. Always came around when we needed something, and filled up our drinks often. The sushi chef even checked up to see if we enjoyed everything. Aaron and the sushi chef that night (sorry, I didn't catch your name) were very cool people.   Overall, this place ranks pretty high among the other sushi shops in Vegas. I recommend trying it.

i589CD0VTPAc8rhkB5t0BA.text: I ordered Sushi Wa dinner through UberEats one night. I had the edamame and Pimp My Roll. It was packaged well so nothing would be soggy upon arrival except no soy sauce was provided in the bag. It did however come with chopsticks, ginger and wasabi. The edamame was cooked perfect and extra salted like I had requested. The roll was good but a little too spicy for me. But the tuna and salmon tasted very fresh.   They have a large menu of both hot and cold tapas, sushi rolls, sashimi, bento boxes, noodles, soups, and desserts. I had a difficult time trying to select just one roll! I'd like to try more next time!

q-uGkCsto2-t1XPbYdGvzg.text: This place is amazing! The service is awesome and consistent! We've been here a couple of times and the server Nicole recognized us and what we ordered!  The food is delivered quickly no accurately. We always get a bento for lunch and a special roll! The portions are large and satisfying! We've also had the ramen and it's is exceptionally good!   Try this place you won't regret it!

WD0uxIlzRPsKoA4dZcVauQ.text: I've been coming back here pretty consistently getting carry out and eating in occasionally during the wee hours of the night and the quality has been consistently good. Everyone is very friendly and the staff is attentive. Definitely give this place a try if you're craving some good sushi.   What's better than an AYCE sushi restaurant? One that's open late - this place is open until 4am folks! I love having a sushi place on this side of town that's open late. My first few experiences with this restaurant was with take out orders only. As far as take out - some of the rolls can be a little pricey, but hey - you're ordering stuff that's normally AYCE if you eat in, so it's bound to be less cost effective than eating there.   I went in the other night with my friend to do AYCE, it was fairly late - around 2:30a and there were a few tables in there. The server - (I don't know her name but she's always there) is very nice. She was very prompt in getting us drinks and patient with us as we looked over the menu. We placed a few kitchen item orders from her and ordered our sushi directly from Juan the sushi chef since we were sitting at the bar anyway. Our food items and sushi came out really fast! I was impressed.   They have a very extensive list of different kind of rolls. I'm not really big on rolls but we did get a volcano roll that I thought looked freakin cool. Pieces of sushi were stacked up like a volcano and had an orange lava sauce coming down from the top. Pretty creative.   I usually like to only eat nigiri - while their fish quality was good, I was a little disappointed to see that they put a ponzu like sauce on several of the pieces of nigiri. I'm not a big fan of ponzu on my nigiri - I think it's overpowering and masks the flavor of the fish. If I were to do it again, next time I would say hold the sauce.   Ordered a couple kitchen items too - pork belly - a little over cooked and dry, salmon kama - also a little over cooked (on the outside) but somehow still tender on the inside. Perhaps their heat was just a little too high in the kitchen that night.  All in all a good experience, especially at almost 3a on a Wednesday night. Friendly staff, decent menu selection, and pretty good value at about $27pp

KayevaPmnsgPfZkhFwFNpQ.text: Not surprised it was slow tonight after all it is 1 am and there open until 4 am and it is a Sunday, but since this is my Saturday why not right...  Very attentive staff and the food was really good, The waiter recommended I eat what i want and when the bill comes I can decide if I want AYCE or per dish, Good thing because by the time I was finished I had 2 sake Bottles and Sushi and the bill was less than the AYCE selection.  Always a great time here

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Kirin beer

YhExukXd19o4_iWi3CQTVQ.text: Definitely one of the better sushi restaurants in Vegas! My friends and I went for a little bite before our night out and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the sushi/food overall (especially for the price). Our waitress Sarah was so sweet and she recommended a few things for us to try. We got a whole bunch of things but I personally thought the sushi platter/combo (?) was the best bang for your buck. You get 10 pieces of sushi + any roll for $22. Loooooves me a good deal :)   I'll have to come back next time and try some other things from the menu! It's a little far from the strip but better than paying 3x the price

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Part of the sushi combo
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Tuna garlic roll? Yum

oES98yb5z1aRRZokeYqOEA.text: I am not a fan of AYCE sushi but Sushi Wa may have just changed my mind. We were quickly greeted as we walked in and seated at a table near the sushi bar. The service was excellent from the time we sat down until we left. Several people, including the manager, always checking on us to see if we wanted to order anything else and water glasses were always refilled without asking.   We did the AYCE which was $27 for dinner. Besides the large selection of sushi, sashimi and rolls they have a huge selection of appetizers, salads, ramen and dessert that is all included. Sushi Wa is quite generous with the sashimi, uni, and other higher priced items being part of the AYCE.   We started with gyoza which I didn't care for. Too greasy and I prefer pork or chicken over beef. We also shared a seaweed salad, cucumber salad and 1/2 order of tonkatsu ramen which was huge. The broth was little bland for me but everything else was very good. We continued with several pieces of sushi with the cajun albacore a favorite, as well as spicy tuna roll, philadelphia roll and the sex bomb which was our favorite roll. They put asparagus in the spicy tuna which I don't like so will have to have them hold that next time. Overall the sushi was very fresh and tasty.   For dessert we both chose the banana tempura with ice cream. This was a perfect ending for our dinner and at $27 I think we definitely got our money's worth. They have several lunch specials including bento boxes so I am looking forward to coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellowtail and Cajun albacore
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Seaweed salad
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy tuna roll

Bj6q_KO4U8SRhL5uHJXq5g.text: Came here for lunch on a Saturday. First impression looked good, they have decent reviews, and the staff was great and friendly.  My wife and I did AYCE and started with nigiri. The RICE was terrible!!! Maybe it was left overs from the night before but it was hard and dry! I've had better rice at a fast food sushi joint!!!! The tuna I attached we spit out because it was sour. The fish in general was not fresh. I've never wanted to walk out of a sushi place more... It was national sushi day and we wanted to try a new place and it was not good at all.... Maybe we had bad luck but I will not go back. I ended up ordering a California roll so can get full and leave. I've never had sushi this bad and I'm not very picky!   Also- the flow the was bad, we waited really long in between plates and we were the only ones there. I hate giving bad reviews but stay away! It's not worth it.

The ambiance is perfect, a lot more spacious than most sushi joints and such pretty decor!!!!   If ya need your sushi fix, come to sushi wa and see Nicole!

They didn't even offer me compensation of any sort for not getting my food . I work in one of the local adjacent offices and was going to have our office gathering there but I refuse to even use this place now.  Very poor customer service.

q9WO4Re66T4uyRqmuWRAvA.text: The food is excellent here! Always fresh! I love IP sushi. A-Ron our server is amazing! He always made sure that we got everything we need. Thank you for an amazing time! Can't wait to be back then!

U1JJY5SKucmV6QDHVFHFXQ.text: Breathless...is how I left because I was so full from their bomb af sushi. Food: phenomenal. Playlist: fire. Service: excellent. Interior: beautiful. Overall great experience. If you're a sushi virgin, I'd suggest popping ur sashimi cherry here. Make sure you try the pepper seared tuna and salmon! Also, ask for Aaron (ay-ay-ron) or Shea, they will definitely take care of you. Will be coming back soon!

XTtQv2cq4unFp0ShA6Ebnw.text: First of all; I LOVE that they're open until 4am!!! Me & my husband tend to be late eaters & we both love sushi!   Second: the staff here is always very nice, we haven't had a bad experience here, and we go here a lot! They make great recommendations for my husband, who loves to try the different rolls they have. (I usually stick to my nigiri)  We've always done the AYCE (all you can eat) since it's a great price (I believe $27 for dinner? Give or take a dollar) and we tend to eat A LOT, so it's better for us to go this route.  The fish to rice ratio is good, and they come out FAST. The fish itself is also good. Not the "best", but still really good (especially for the price lol)  It pretty dark in here, which isn't really a BAD thing, I'm sure it's brighter during the day, but we have only gone here after the sun has set.  OVERALL, We love this place and always suggest it to our friends and family that visit (:

ZlOofBupxaIHSKy7jsgESQ.text: Love that they are open until 4am.  Great service. Kind Owner whos there a lot, good sign.  Really bomb fresh sushi. Favorite part is everyone gets 1 order of sashimi included in the  ayce. Not A lot of ayce include sashimi ever!

OWGcWjhmNothjZgiCWqqfw.text: OMG, this place rocks!  I found it after my last favorite sushi place closed.  You MUST try the Superman Burrito Roll and the Dynamite Appetizer.  Their baked mussels are to die for and I LOVE the Screaming O Sashimi.  I can't get enough of this place and we're here a few times per month for the all you can eat.  Also the Bikini Roll is yummy, no rice, just sushi wrapped in cucumber.   Can't wait to go again on Friday!  Yummy!  :)

NJJY_HN0QdDi83KOoVPKYg.text: Went here with my little family of 3!   The look of the restaurant was very clean with a modern look. The decor reminded me of a restaurant on the strip.  I did the AYCE and my husband and 1 year old daughter shared chicken teriyaki.  My husband thought the chicken teriyaki was alright.  I always order nigiri sushi. Hamachi, my fav, is very fresh and good here! So is the tuna! The sweet shrimp is one of the best I've had!  Although the sushi was great, the service is slow. The service is friendly, just really slow.  Don't do AYCE at the booth because the service is slow for that, so sit at the bar. I don't recommend to bring your kids here at night because there is a pub right next door. Outside of the pub there is an outdoor seating area. I didn't like walking out at night into crowds of smokers with my kid.  I would love to come here again with just my husband. I would come here during the day with my family. My husband is not a sushi person, so it'll be awhile till we come back.  It wasn't bad for our first time. I just wish the service for me was quicker.

TmSqZFriioW9W2KVFf-JVw.text: I really like having another all you can eat nearby. They have amazing salmon. The chef will be more than happy to give you recommendations. The Superman roll was my favorite. The chef was more than happy to create something for us too. Fast service. Never waited for my tea to be refilled. They even left us the pot. Definitely will be going back.
