wPpsjHhs_hApX5q308ld7g.text: Food was so great! Some of the best baked rolls.   Went on a Saturday night and they seemed understaffed. The service was so genuine and helpful when we couldn't make up our minds but soooooo slow. Luckily we didn't have anywhere to go.   Will definitely go back but we'll make sure we don't have any commitments after!

8EQ0P8pxJNiaGP7nxpeWJw.text: I'm in love with this place!  There are so many sushi places in town and they are all nice.  But the service in this restaurant is amazing and they have the food to match it.  We ordered our food and I felt like it came out in minutes!  We have attentive staff that made sure our glasses were completely full.  The sushi is extremely fresh and you can tell the chefs take their time and do things right.  I love this place, and I'm always here for my sushi fix for sure!

KrJAjYhc6cHfmFanA1PVKw.text: Been going here for nearly 5 years and I will not be going back after my experience yesterday. We ate AYCE and when ice cream came out, there was a BUG laying in the ice cream!!! Our waitress claimed it may have flown in or "fallen" in, but it was clear this bug had been dead for a while! She apologized and expected that to just be ok. She offered us more ice cream, which we declined because obviously the whole batch was contaminated. She offered to take a 5 dollar drink off the bill, we declined and said that we come here once every month, and that they would be losing a customer. Waitress gave us a gift card for us to come back but we will NEVER be going back to this place. To top it off, I got home and got extremely sick and was in the bathroom all night.

-8nsOqoPNWfWzklHvz9kUg.text: Excellent sushi experience! Wonderful sushi chefs who will make anything for you! And I mean anything! Attentive and friendly staff, excellent decor and interior design.   Will definitely return! The sashimi is excellent!

vufjI1Ro9uAmD52wTaqf8A.text: I found this place about a year ago and it is the best sushi I have had in Vegas, which I know is a biiiiiiig statement.   Over the past 10 years or so I have eaten at dozens of sushi restaurants in this town (on the strip as well) and I can't say I have enjoyed any as much as this place. The fish is stellar, the customer service is amazing, and the rolls are innovative and flavorful.  What brought me back is the fact that I can easily eat $100 worth of sushi in one sitting. I prefer all-yo-can-eat venues because frankly, it's cheaper. Most of the time you find yourself at one of these places, the rolls are basic and not very good, or you are prohibited from ordering any of the "good" rolls. Not this place!!! If it is on the menu, you can order it (and as much as you like). Any app, roll, sashimi, nigiri; it's all fair game. The funny thing is the place is almost always empty! It's a really nice place right next door to Shakespeare's (a trendy bar). I am positive that this is just a secret among those who live in Green Valley. This place is a must-go for any Vegas sushi-addict.

0T9_ZmsfC3g83aL_bj59iw.text: Sushi Wa is currently my favorite Sushi place!  I personally like that they bring items out 1-2 at a time, I hate having 50 plates at the table...just my opinion, but I can see by some reviews, some yelpers are gluttonous and are angry about that.  The ambiance is nice, I like the booths...I always feel that the service is good- one time I felt neglected by the female waitress, but today we had a different waiter (cant remember his name) but he is my favorite.  The screaming orgasm is delicious, as are the Who's Your Daddy-- I will keep coming back!

6Ysk1U1iL5U_597FxLheyg.text: I haven't been here in 4 years, so when we were in this part of town we decided to drop in to do some all you can eat. Long story short the hostess sucked from the moment we walked in, til I signed the check and was walking out. Even the worst restaurants  I've been to, had the respect to say "thank you" after I spent a good sum of $$. But not today...no "thank you," no "hope you enjoyed it," not even an "f*** you," as I walked by thanking them. For what? Not quite sure.  Wasn't a total loss, our Server was okay and the rolls were excellent, but not enough for me to come all the way back again.

TKzkyNa6czOo0BqFOv6rng.text: Awesome Food , Best Sushi I have had in Las Vegas. Staff is great! Love the owner! We are definitely regulars here!

twVusk0NbEdOr4ys3mJB8A.text: Go to spot in Henderson for nigiri. Try the "Sushi Bomb" but be cautious, it will explode and all you can do is hold on for the ride.

bGZy8EKlixk609UFO5dlMA.text: Had a nice lunch with 3 kids. Fresh fish, attentive service and reasonably priced. Kids really liked the chicken teriyaki which they tend to be picky about.  Thumbs up.

DVPBUavu18U8E7KLvoUbSg.text: So I live right down the street and been wanting to try this place ever since I saw it. Came in for lunch and the price is reasonable. The environment is nice and appealing.... But the big swordfish hanging alone... Doesn't make sense in the decor. Anyways, the food is good. Fish is fresh and cut in good portions. The waitress I had was friendly and to the point. For the amount of people here for lunch on a Tuesday I did expect food to arrive a little faster. But considering I wasn't in a hurry I didn't mind at all. Now my review of the food is based on nigiri because I do not like rolls. I'm not a sushi elitist by any means, I just like to taste the natural fish with little to no flare. To that aspect, the food was amazing. All the fish that I had was very fresh and minimalistic. Definitely will be coming back for dinner, might even bring the wife.

GGL5jX59FAEv-mImpNuBwg.text: Been here 6 times.  All you can eat is worth it. The superman burrito is a must have. Even if I'm full, I still gotta have it. The Uni is hit or miss. I guess depends on the season or their supplier.

uWhikSqo3VAx8ov_-ci14g.text: Great AYCE sushi been here twice now. The service is good. The appetizers are good. The price is comparable to most AYCE sushi places. They have a good beer and saki selection. The sushi chef pays attention and is attentive to the customers at the Bar. The staff seems very friendly.

8ldOv7bjrmtAQzk3C0WPKg.text: All you can eat and very nice atmosphere.  Not the best sushi in town but is pretty good!  The side dishes are pretty good and they have a lot of choice.  Recommend the nigiri ones rather than the rolls.  Price is average for ayce sushi.  Will continue to frequent here.

98IreyrRgDIszJs53UQesw.text: This restaurant used to be good in the past but now it's just a disaster. Came in on a Friday night, waited for our food for an hour and a half and only got 4 rolls. The wait staff apologized repeatedly but did nothing to rectify the situation. The rolls that did come out were sloppy and fell apart as we picked them up. Definitely won't be coming back anytime soon unless they get their act together, there are plenty of other sushi restaurants in Vegas.

VMf_AgC5ME4gJRceu9dhBg.text: What a wonderful little gem that our friend George/Debbie introduced us to.  I've been to a lot of sushi places in town and seemed like with the all you can eat menu's, everyone seemed to be cutting down on overheads.  It's always we ran out of this and we ran out of that.  To our surprise, everything we ordered was delivered.  Food was excellent, and presentation was fabulous.  The service was 5 stars as well.  Definitely recommend this place to all of my family member.  Will come back again even though we travel from Summerlin.

-_KzgjnQlgNsSP1lSKYVmQ.text: Here's  the deal people on here don't  understand. Its all you can eat there's  a reason some rolls have alot of rice, the place needs to make money! If yoy want sashimi or low rice go with the ala carte option.They still have sashimi and sashimi salads on the menu which most AYCE places don't. The fish portions were good not extravagant but alot better then most ayce places. Also they had alot of appetizer options  which are unique and not skimpy  in meat or chicken. Also the most important  thing is that unlike every single sushi restaurant in that area this one has never been closed down by the health department.

tUnKnDBDySuH05spTrzm5w.text: I'm here at Sushi Wa for supper. This in the best sushi restaurant in Vegas. Their all you can eat deals a fantastic deal!!!

EnWIzKmvsaEw3JS_BmR5OA.text: After reading all the raving reviews here and seeing that it was in our new neighborhood, we gave this place a try. Why oh why oh why?! Let's start with the positive. The contemporary interior was a pleasant surprise considering the banal exterior facade.   Now for what really matters, service and sushi. Much MUCH! to be desired.   1) The temakis served were overfilled with unseasoned, mushy WARM rice. Nigiri rice appeared about 2 inches x 1 x 1.  Required two bites or a disgusting crammed-mouthful. Length of fish was not slightly longer than rice and sliced too thin.  TWO stars off.   Sushi rice properly cooked and seasoned and freshness/quality of toppings are key to the success of a sushi establishment for more discerning patrons. Fish quality here was fine considering you're in the middle of a desert.   2) twice reminded server that I had not been served my uni nigiri yet. Never got it although we were seated as dinner AYCE diners. ONE star off.   3) took 20 minutes for server to return to take second order. I'm a very patient person--still tipped 20%. Perhaps understaffed for the night? Not server's fault.   4) didn't appreciate being reminded to finish rice. See #1  5) 7:15 pm and they were out of hamachi kama. Perhaps they were slammed earlier. No star off for that.

QXwz9OFTepSVq29VjPNt8g.text: We love sushi. We HATE Sushi Wa. We decided to try a new sushi restaurant and regret it. First their sushi wasn't good. Their sauces were bland. Second. And this is a HUGE SECOND.. The staff is awful.  The guy we got must of been in a badass mood or just has had a bad attitude.  The whole experience here was bad. We will definitely never come back. Go somewhere else for AYCE sushi, seriously.

S7MGl7kUD6lYgfBq8MCJ7Q.text: I love AYCE sushi so I came to check out their sushi. The nigiri was amazing and the restaurant decor was really nice. There was only one problem. I love AYCE sushi because I love ordering A LOT all at once and I come hungry. Throughout my meal, I was reminded over and over again that I had to finish everything to avoid getting charged extra. This was a total buzzkill. I understand the server was probably trying to help me by informing me, but after the 1st time was plenty enough. Food was great, customer service was not.

907kIxC4HJBPQ8HkSiXOHQ.text: One of the best all you can eat places in town. Great quality, great price. They just updated their menu and added even more to their already extensive menu.

LyQi-BWayGOTQhmf_0rlXw.text: Cant go wrong with the AYCE! Price, and selection is amazing compared to most sushi places. Lovely decor, nice service as well. I ordered a baked roll, attempted to eat it, but my stomach wasnt having it! They gladly took it back and did not charge me for the roll.  Will definitely be back!

thCDa7HeNwTJPitMXa7_9g.text: Upscale feel to the decor. We went in today and we were the only patrons, but that's probably because it's been raining all day. The staff was very friendly and the food was amazing! This is now one of my favorite sushi places. We had the pocky roll, the rose roll, the superman burrito, baked green mussels, monkey brain, and the energy roll. They were all to die for. We wanted to try more things but just didn't have enough room. Didn't even have room for dessert. We will definitely be coming back.

9XMUi5MinK6D79SRsx6oBA.text: Great food, excellent service in a nice cozy atmosphere.

s2uOyambajMNzL1lnsVnJA.text: We have been here multiple times over the years. The food itself is good and the decor and dining ambiance as well making it a good choice for group occasions. But the service is actually pretty terrible for a few reasons. First reason is they don't greet you in any sort of nice fashion. Then you sit there and wait quite a while for a person to give you water or menus. After they come, they walk away so fast and they don't come back. When they do come back for the order, they take a bit of time to make it. Then they don't come back for your next round of ordering. We know how they roll, so we just try to order all we want in the first time, rather than smaller rounds. But then we end up over ordering and becoming overstuffed. All you can eat sushi problems. I just wish they would get their service game together, because then we would definitely go here more. There are just better options with better food and better service around here. When I bring in people from out of town I would prefer to bring them here due to the seating and ambiance, but I just can't after past attempts. I brought my brother there from out of town with his wife and kids, and we ended up with a free voucher card with $15 on it because we were there for two hours and they knew the service was bad. I can't bring people here until I know it's fixed. Edited: I edited my review to remove the part about the ordering with paper and pens, I must have remembered that part wrong, we do have two sushi restaurants we used to go to with that same issue. But yes, I do know this is the proper restaurant and I do have the free voucher gift card somewhere that was given to my out of town brother when I brought him there with his family. This was a couple years ago, and we have been back a few times since. Its the size and shape of a credit card and If I can find it I will take a picture to prove it. One of the last times we went we were with another couple who had also been there before and we joked about the service as it unfolded again to be sub par. When we do go,  we know what to expect but we keep crossing fingers that it would have gotten better by now. It's definitely not a good business practice to respond how you do to patrons. Best advice is to learn something from what you are reading and make improvements. Not try to appear that everything is perfect and your patrons giving you feedback are crazy. This review is real, but the service is still a joke. We have been back a handful of times since, but not in the past 6 months. We will try it again when the time is right.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. The voucher we were given to make up for bad service a few years ago, the current manager did not believe this happened.

kMnmiVd29HitDmKe5A4ZMw.text: Been here a lot of times but this last time, really bad service and overwhelming rice underneath a thin layer of fish. Couple years ago, this was my go-to sushi place but now, wont be coming back. The screaming orgasm and the amaebi nigiri was still really good but all the other nigiris were all very thinly sliced over an overly large portion of rice. It seems as if I'm just eating a big chunk of rice. Couldnt even tell if there was fish on top.   The biggest factor of this one star review is really the service. I'm not sure if it was just our server or just generally speaking. But, it was terrible. On the get go, once we said our first batch of orders, he just questioned us if we would be able to finish all those cause they charge for leftovers, etc. Now, we've been eating AYCE sushi for the longest time and we already know what our limits are. But making that statement seems more like an insult rather than a reminder. Then he kept asking the same question after every order. Now we felt like we were challenged.. so we had like 4 batches of a ton load of orders that we finished (no leftovers). With those statements and questions, we felt totally uncomfortable throughout our dinner which just ruined the whole night. Towards the end of our dinner, we kinda had the attitude of anger and sarcasm not just towards our server, but with the whole restaurant as well. Btw, server's name is Mark.

ZcSZSfBu9K2U-z17Ejvqnw.text: A little pricey, but this place is worth it. It's only my second time here but service is always good. Atmosphere is very pleasant and very clean as well. Would definitely recommend!

e9THnNrSCZdZlKTBJo88Dg.text: Seriously? This place gets 4/5 stars? I'd give them 0/5 if there was only an option. Ok maybe 1/5 just because of the screaming orgasm and ama ebi. Service was awful. The server, Mark, we got was very rude right from the beginning. Really, why will you question our quantity of orders if we could finish it? Every time we order "Are you sure?" It made us very uncomfortable the whole time especially when we try to order. Just awful! Never coming back! Nigiris have very thin slices of fish portion; rice portion was a lot. They try to make you full because of the rice not because the fish portion. Also after the first batch of orders, we noticed they take longer time to get our orders out. Place wasn't even full at that time. There are other much better sushi joints around town. Friendly, better service, and muuuuch better tasty sushi. Pass on this one!

n_O9XAW7SPSXlLwYGt_M1w.text: Free beer with the yelp review!! Score!! Our server is polite and informative, this will be a definite come back spot for me

PM8kJcOOTgZb8Q6hbJkozQ.text: AYCE menu is huge - great selection, and you can get some sashimi too!  Kids 7 and under are half price. New fave in Henderson!

P5F_z3iw2vGUR1pc4u7edA.text: We love Sushi Wa! This spot has become a regular for me and my husband. To the reviews that state that they don't get enough fish and too much rice - I have never experienced that. All the times I ordered sashimi, I receive a huge slab of fish. All their rolls are great and I've never had bad service in all the times we've gone. Love their Superman Burrito!!

gpf6ntxHO0v3YK7-COi0QQ.text: A very nice place to stop by and have AYCE.  The fish here is always fresh and the portions are much better than other places in the area. The staff is very polite. The prices are a bit on the higher side but I believe it is worth it.  Not sure how other people were served but whenever we ordered straight sushi the portions were generous.  I will definitely come here again.

gWOcg7NQUBz86RQzHoDeVg.text: We had a large party of 31, they were almost prepared with seating for 26, so we scrambled to find other chairs to seat our entire party.  We signed up for the all you can eat for all the adults and Alan carte for the. Kids.  The appetizers are good, spicy edamame, but the agadashi tofu was not good.  The sushi was good and their rolls are a good combo.  Their uni sushi did not seem right, and it was a bit greyish, I could eat the second one, oh and was told if I didn't finish it,i I would be charged extra...needless to say, I hid it in the napkin and tossed it under the table. Hubby said the short ribs, korean, was delish, the kids loved the udon noodles, the hamachi Kama was bony but good, calamari yummy.  They have a huge variety of dishes, sides, sushi and appetizers!  You will be sure to find something g delish to enjoy!

E4rPHeQw-oOA_sbSLFC4YQ.text: This is my favorite AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.  The fish quality is high and the selection is great.  Each AYCE order also includes one order of sashimi.  The seared peppered tuna is my favorite, but I have yet to have something that I didn't like.

ZKBw6mltQO28_HcZcODKuw.text: Good, but just not worth it!  The sushi was good... No doubts about that, and the portions were filing. Anything fried was huge. The stuffed jalapeno was delicious. The Las Vegas Roll was good, except the rice was on the outside. I am not a fan of this. I think makes the roll taste too much like fried dough rather rice than sushi, which would be fine, except these aren't carnival prices.  At $26.95 for dinner AYCE, that is slight more than many other sushi places in Las Vegas.. And the sake was $10 for a large. That is crazy. Minus one star there.  Oh, and the $10 sake was not even hot, but warm. Minus one more star!  The service here was good, but when we asked for a table in the corner the hostess/waitress asked why... How about you just do as we requested? Most of the tables were not occupied, only a few were.

zWIB7P380j5TvEQwHt_hFQ.text: Came here to celebrate fathers day and I must say we were impressed. Food was delicious, and presentation is excellent. We will be back.

eESqQ0pfZeo3JNhWBTwwNw.text: Still have the slowest service in town. They finally got nice servers crew but the cooks still need help. Usually you get your first orders pretty quick. When they magically stop working on your orders. And when they finally resume (let's say 50min after placing the order), food comes out as a mess (your "baked" roll is cold in the middle, for example). Be ready to spend an hour more here than you spend in other AYCE places... No more sushi Wa for us sadly

Nby3xWeT4jR3DmZHuZauCQ.text: About a year ago, the boyfriend and I went in to SushiWa and immediately walked out when we saw not one single customer inside.   A year later, it seems like SushiWa is what everyone talks about if you live in the 89052 area code.  We finally gave it a try yesterday, and I was reasonably pleased.   The decor inside is very modern and roomy.  Not like your typical AYCE joints in town - where you can reach over to the table next to you with your chopsticks to try out their dishes.    Their menus cover your basics but with a little more.  This AYCE actually gives you sashimi (one order per person).  That was pleasantly surprising.  We then ordered our usual sushi and rolls.    The fish is VERY fresh.  The boyfriend claims that the super white tuna there is by far the best he has had, even better than the ones in California.  I must say that the freshness of the fish is comparable to the freshness of the ones in Hong Kong, so that's saying a lot.    The sushi was made of little rice and a big chuck of fish - just the way I like them.  The rolls were somewhat difference because they were cut very thinly.  Must try the super spider roll made with soft shell crab and shrimp tempura - yummy!   Their fresh oysters are also very delicious, but also one order per person - boo.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience at SushiWa and will definitely return since it is so close to my house.  Another nice thing about it is that there is no wait.  AYCE sushi joints usually have at least a 30 minute wait, and it is just plain ol' obnoxious.    Aside from the thin rolls, this place lost a star because of its strict rules about how many order per person.  By the time we had our third rounds of orders, I was getting so frustrated about what we had already order or what we can't order.  But it is what it is!  Oh, our server, Monica, was a sweetheart.  However, you guys must be mindful that this restaurant is owned and run by Koreans, so it is not your typical/ordinary Japanese place.    Lastly, this place plays awesome music!  Fresh fish, great service, awesome music!  You should be sold by now.    Enjoy!

l-fCFIaMMaAqQKPF3I7pDw.text: Great little sushi place. We came in for lunch and the service and sushi was great. We both did AYCE, and the food and portions were perfect. Highly recommend the fire cracker app. The nigiri sushi was fresh and the fish was meaty and delicious. I would highly recommend for dinner or lunch as the restaurant has a great atmosphere and decor. We will being dinning here again.

JQx4MBDVJNi9tOHF_2hJww.text: I finally got a chance to come here! I came with 2 friends and only one of them had ayce sushi with me. The other friend ordered a la carte.   Upon entry, our waitresses were nice and friendly. It was a good start. Ambiance is nice and quiet, but dark inside. If you're like me and really love to take pictures of food it'll be hard without flash cause it's very dim in here.   We got served by 3 different servers. The waitress taking our order had issues with her pen not working twice and it felt slow. We were told we were not able to order half rolls unless it's for our last orders. Weird.   Ice cream is only limited to one kind per person. So if you want both the tempura and mochi ice cream, you can only pick one. :( Sad face here.   We ended with a waiter named JooSun (spelling?) and he seemed distant/apathetic but he was also nice. He let my a la carte friend get ice cream anyway. He gave me this bonus card when I asked for the stamp cards.. not sure if they have those stamp cards now. I'll find out soon enough.   All in all, it was a pretty good experience. There was this halibut that I tried which I could not for the life of me finish it nor swallow it. :(  Next time I'm back would most likely be in June for a birthday celebration. I'll update then. :)

Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Vanilla tempura ice cream

DoB2VbMQmbtGOW0lGKJMHQ.text: I've been to this restaurant several times & it's always great. Tonight the salmon belly, uni, sweet shrimp, & tuna were very good. We were in a group & the wait staff was always very attentive to us. We'll be going back again.

Hvv3zqc61TpZEJO8m4taDQ.text: This place is a 3.5 star to me. Decent sushi. Decent service. Decent ambiance. Decent price. I would come back but I won't crave it.   At $21 the lunch all you can eat is a good deal. We had a bunch of different rolls which were all ok, but the ikura is crap. Don't get it.

ioagkhdgghPZXdrgablEiw.text: The best sushi experience ever!  Unlimited high quality sushi that just kept flowing.  Servers worked as a team.  A plate never sat.  Our drinks never empty.  The atmosphere is perfect!  Don't pass on this one.  I'll be back in a few weeks.

dBGoZ9ohIzGVH6WwmahwiQ.text: The service here is horrible!! Very unprofessional. Our initial server, Geo was amazing, friendly and professional. When he left we got this server from hell. It was almost as though an exorcism needed to take place. She told us that we only had 19 minutes more to eat our food and that she would not bring out any other food because "we had been here too long. " According to my last text to my friend letting her know that I would be there soon I know the we were at Sushi Wa for no more than 45 minutes when she told us this erroneous claim. In addition, we did not receive our food on time after what Geo had given us and couple of the orders were for other tables. Save yourself trouble and go elsewhere. By the way, the store owner ended up calling Gio back to the restaurant because this was such a serious issue. Harassing a customer is never ever acceptable. And she never apologized., but Geo and the store owner did for her.  Don't risk it if the waitress from Hell is still working there!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. We ordered salmon collar and but got swordfish collar instead. :-(

I2VV3VHR1DfvMmQzaDLlCw.text: Great sushi, nice staff.  Good prices.

9DyVikzzJ47YVZXQjKP5CQ.text: So this place was recommended to me awhile ago and i am not sure what took us so long to try it but we are so happy we did!  The food is great, truly. Fresh fish that makes you forget you live in a desert. But what really stood out here was service. Everyone made eye contact and smiled and they all worked together as a team and never made you feel like "oh you're not in my section let me go get your server..." (I hate that by the way) and instead, you leave feeling like you had ten servers, all of whom were nice, friendly, knowledgable and accommodating.   There was one young man who chatted with us for so long happily answering all of my questions, seeming excited at the chance to educate us. Haha.   Try the baked mussels appetizer, the himachi, octopus, any signature roll, a seaweed salad, and a bottle of the strawberry sake with some fried ice cream... I know its a lot, but you won't regret it as it is all so worth it!

3fmTvQdBIfdaOXtp5KB-Pg.text: Love the food. Here with great friends. Best salon collar and spider roll. Great service and price.

FJkCiBsAEPfWdQdrbd3A7w.text: This place is wonderful, great atmosphere and modern pop music. Would recommend 5 out of 5.

Xv7A5TRvDjzlaMafxpSE2Q.text: I had my meetup group event there last night. They have some great quality of food. Staff there are so nice and kind too. Manager Gio, was really fast with service he knows what he's doing.  Owner Joon was really kind and nice too.  I liked their Sweet Shrimp Sushi. I've never seen shrimp that big in AYCE places. Impressed! And of course everything else was really good too.  And one more thing I like about this place was the interior. They have some good interior there. I heard this place is about 10 years old but place looks really clean and nice. I thought they just opened up or something. Really good place to have nice sushi night with either family or group of people. Even good for by yourself at the Bar. They have some really friendly sushimans ;P I will come out and have another event there! Really nice place!

bXTrgx-UNd6OH4Jjd-8Ceg.text: This place is awesome!  I have been eating  here since it opened and speak with the owner frequently.  The staff has always been good, and they cater to make certain my wife and boys enjoy their dining experience.   I enjoy their specialty rolls, and especially the Superman burrito roll and 911 roll for those that love avocado. Very good sashimi with great tuna.  Try the Baha for nice yellowtail with jalapeno, if you like a little spice.  The 911 sauce is a must for spice. The tuna poke is also very good. It can get busy, but generally service is very good and prices are reasonable.

wWvDYnunGhFE8n-WHbQPyw.text: Came with my cousins for the AYCE because of the 4 stars. We were really excited to find a new sushi place but we were really disappointed. We weren't satisfied with any of our orders and the sushi rice was terrible. Definitely won't be back.

uZM25YSBBmUSe5eN9Hhw1Q.text: Had dinner here tonight.    I think they were "off their A-game" in the service department.  I'm not going to go into detail because I'm not going to hold it against them... but my tea was cold, they forgot to provide: the individual small plates, the soy sauce dish and the wasabi/ginger side.  But all was remedied quickly once we pointed it out.    They are OH-SO-NICE.  So.... definitely not going to hold the minor infractions against them since the sushi and rolls were Killer Grinds.  Enjoyed the AYCE... started with the edamame and seaweed salad.  Both were great starters... fresh and fast.  Then started in on the fish... salmon, yellow tail, white tuna.  All very good and fresh....and big pieces of fish too which just a little bit of rice.... so they are more than fair with their portions.  Ordered the albacore with jalapeno... it came wrapped in red onion which I'm not a fan of onion so I picked the onion out and ate it.  Was Great without the onion.  :)  Then we ordered the Scallop Crunch, Mountain and 007 rolls.  They were all different and all good... I can't say which I liked better.  The Scallop Crunch had a nice crunch to it while the scallops were tender, the Mountain was a baked roll that was served with a spicy sauce that was awesome... just a nice little kick nothing shocking... and the 007 roll was so simple it was refreshing.  We ended with Tempura Ice Cream... it was 'ok'.  Nothing to expound upon... should have gotten the Mochi instead... next time.

LUKOkc7KtXZ40f7CdCFIfA.text: We love coming to sushiwa for quality sushi and exceptional service! Sushi is very fresh. Many appetizer options. I recommend their monkey brain! Celeste took good care of us tonight

dooMkTtBKHpD69M0Ez7hBQ.text: My Barber Shop is next door so we have decided to go to sushi wa on occasion. i usually never write reviews and often discredit "yelpers" for being super stupid with complaints like the price etc. The reason for my 1 star is a culmination of several things that made me uncomfortable and ultimately moved me to write this.  #1 - got the impression that they were really busy so i definitely expected things to move a little slowly.. that wasn't the problem, the problem was the Sushi Chef getting Visibly and Verbally upset over incoming orders, and our order.. we were the only diners at the bar and he actually was getting mad at us for ordering (he was busy fulfilling the seated guests orders)  #2 Not Once offered Wasabi or Ginger.. and we were honestly so weirded out by the Chefs attitude we were a little scared it would be awkward asking for it...  Go somewhere better, or definitely don't go for lunch on a Sunday. I would love for them to respond and explain

2wWMTduXXTld_orjxAxCMQ.text: I have loved going to sushiwa ever since my mom had taken me there a few years ago. Service was prompt and the food was decent. Last night I went there with my boyfriend and felt sick towards the end of our meal. When we got home, I vomited and am still feeling unwell today (tender stomach, bad 'movements'...).   I called sushiwa and told them what I ate so that they could check their ingredients and to prevent this from happening to someone else, but a rude manager, who I believe is named Gio, told me that I could not have gotten food poisoning because the rolls we ordered had cooked fish. Even so, if the fish had not been handled or cooked properly, or if the other ingredients in the roll had gone bad, there are a number of factors could have contributed to my feeling sick.   Gio did not apologize for my sickness after eating at sushi wa. He was very short with me on the phone and did not say that he would check the ingredients from the rolls I ate.   I do not post this out of anger or for vengeance but because, terrible customer service and lack of empathy aside, it is unacceptable for a restaurant not to investigate such a complaint thoroughly. Indeed, all Gio had to do was apologize for my poor experience and promise that he would check the freshness of the ingredients and the handling and cooking of the food.   Needless to say, we will not be going back to sushi wa. Eat at your own risk.

ut2-VXLsPSlOJzKWH0XT_A.text: Best sushi in Vegas! The Las Vegas Roll is so good! The staff is so friendly and polite. I would recommended the tasty all you can eat.

smiMNYLr4MuKOd3konnkWg.text: I've been a friend of Joon the owner and his faithful customer for around 7 years.  Great quality good, chill vibe, and the food is delicious.  The sushi chefs Danny and Waldo definitely keep the menus interesting.  Definitely a MUST have

ka_AgK5dyTBjczhm_DTgkw.text: Wonderful place! Sometimes they can get live uni if you call ahead. This is my favorite all you can eat sushi spot in the Vegas area.

YfIJ50j8p79LCxRiZbvyZA.text: I've been going here for years, and am always super happy with the food! Had lunch here the other day, and it was awesome. Got the "all you can eat", and everything was super fresh and delicious. Very high quality sushi, and their sushi rice is bomb! Also, service was really great. My server was so friendly and upbeat! Would highly recommend!

ufeN-z19roYbTNAgt6fY2A.text: Albacore with Jalepeno on top was delicious. Service was awesome, ambiance was great. It's definitely a nice quiet location for business or a date.

mTZgSOkqfimt7fWo8ODIUA.text: Great service and atmosphere.  All you can eat was good.  Liked the korean bbq short ribs. Good to know they're open til late night for a sushi place

04MyMro1n3P9wp_wpUZ81w.text: A hidden gem. I love this place. They have an all you can eat special that is hard to resist.  My mom lives in Michigan and my sister in California and whenever they are in town we go to Sushi Wa.  The interior is very nice and modern.  The service is impeccable.  Most important, the food is amazing!

QlLjv-Xcy34fzjA3GeVkjw.text: Came on a Friday night with the family and no wait. Fast service and great food as always.

yxuyRodkcpu0UVP3uSr5hQ.text: I'm kinda at a lost for words because I like how the place is set up and in the beginning when you come here they make you feel happy but after you order your first round they seem to not care about serving you anymore..you literally have to call them or you never get in your second order or drink refills...you guys have some work to do..ive tried this place twice so its not because they were busy or the server..

2AJmV3DY1Vc7uXHzJ-JLlQ.text: My wife heard of this place through a colleague. We've been looking for a good AYCE sushi place near our house, and I think we may have found it. In my opinion, this is the best AYCE in Vegas. Their menu is expansive and all items can be ordered (for dinner, some limitations for lunch). The one thing that got me for an AYCE was their uni (urchin). It was tasty and fresh, not the best i've had, but it definitely tasted the way uni should.  Other pros: The waitresses were so nice. One took my restless 1 year old for a tour around the restaurant and gave her some chocolate. So awesome.  Their rolls are creative. I strongly recommend the mountain roll and the superman burrito, soooo good. The screaming orgasm is also good, up there with I love Sushi's, slightly spicier which my wife and i loved!  Only cons were that the salmon sashimi tasted as though it was washed with water prior to serving, giving it a less fresh taste.  Overall, we've definitely found our spot for when we're craving AYCE sushi!

uxDiR7tJvJMb2cLbxzKVaw.text: Normally enjoy the meal here, but with no half orders, an almost explanation that any amount of sushi left on plate will result in additional item charge, and a severe flown from the sushi chef the entire time, our Sunday Sushi wasn't enjoyable. :(

GTlvwwOX1MElDb2NTKudUQ.text: Great appetizers ,sushi rolls are really good the quality of the fish is always fresh love this place that's my favorite all you can eat sushi place

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. House salad

bhfEaMDJTVUmFJkNzGskWQ.text: Some people eat just to eat as they routinely do to fulfill their three squared meals a day. I, on the other hand, eat because I have a love for food. My facebook photos can attest to that.  Knowing that, Sushi Wa is my answer when people ask me what the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas... with a grain of salt. Although Sushi Wa has its high points, it also has some low points, thus not earning its full five stars. Here's a list of likes and dislikes...  Like:  - Each person gets one order of sashimi as part of their AYCE experience.  - Fresh and thick cuts of fish  - Best tasting Unagi I've ever eaten. Generously cut and quickly seared to get a crispy edge to contrast the soft texture. (I usually never order Unagi since its rather unhealthy)  - A wide selection of side dishes  - Small details that make each dish a little extra... For example, in the Udon, there are shiitake mushrooms. You normally wouldnt see that in an order of Udon from the AYCE menu.  Dislikes:  - No half roll orders unless its your last roll.  - Limited selection of dessert... And I hate how they drizzle chocolate on every piece of dessert.  - Slow service. Some of the male wait staff seem lost.  For me, the list of likes out weigh the list of dislikes. I mostly order Nigiri so the thick slices of fresh fish are more important than desserts. Slow service? Well, that just means more time to talk with my dining date. I've eaten here well over five times and each person I bring has come back to bring other people. Sure, other AYCE eat places might have a thing or two that is done better, but Sushi Wa has the best Nigiri.  Photos included!

lDIFLZzo0e_nGWr6aLxFCQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and a fantastic music selection, Service is also fantastic. I will be returning 100%

S1Sxxu2J9oqy4cN4gOt6bw.text: The sushi was amazing!! We loved the environment as well. Osvaldo was the one who made our sushi and everything we had,  satisfied our sushi snob taste. The rose roll and the scallop crunch roll are a must order. We will definitely be back!!!!

6iDkTuH4TOTvDcVanRTuSA.text: Fresh wasabi never had it before got it here I love it I was digging into that little dish between all the sushi I thought about ordering more for desert  Sushi was better than most a lot of interesting rolls can't remember any names.  The one I liked the best reminded me of a baked green mussel.  A roll topped and baked like a green mussel.  The second best thing there other than the real wasabi was the interesting appetizers. Monkey brains a mushroom stuffed with spicy tuna then fried then a crab shrimp and cream cheese fritter thing killer green mussel a few others that slip my mind  ohh and fresh wasabi

1eSqicevT6VR1PqpYo3M_g.text: Great sushi spot.. I'd say this is comparable with I love sushi due to Sushi WA has all you can eat.. The sushi is just as good.. They also have very nice staff. My waitress is very kind and Funny.. Have to check this spot out.. I'd recommend the xxx roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Far right xxx Top is the Dragon roll Bottom is spicy tuna Middle is Alaska roll

17JD5opqyQNzVOouv-tDHw.text: "Wa-Wa" (sound of failure).  Sushi wa-da-fa!?!  I got held hostage by a sushi bar!!! and not in a good way!  I came here with good intentions - going to Terri K's first UYE, sitting in the "bamboo jail" table with 12 other awesome yelpers and yelper friends, eating raw fish galore.  However, it did not turn out that way.  We came early (6 PM reservation) but could not leave until after 9:30 PM.  The only reason this gets one star from the restaurant side of things is that our bus boy was awesome.  He was polite, refilled drinks super fast, and cleared empty plates like Flash.  The service was deplorable.  We really only had one waiter, and he only liked one half of the table.  That half happened to include a lot of people that speak his language, so he spent all of his time taking their large orders and giving them food.  These are all my yelp friends, and I am glad I got to be with them, but the server only waited on them essentially.  When it came to our table, he never gave us what we ordered - 30 minutes passed and we had never received items, whereas our companions on the other side got several orders in and food was coming out in group portions.    The waiter argued with me after I asked 3 times for my mackerel sushi, one of the 3 things I ordered...after waiting 30+ minutes - he finally said he already brought it to the table (but it was someone else's order) and said I never ordered it.  After I asked for it 3 more times, couldn't he just put in another order?!  When I asked him a question about an item, he answered and ran off before I could order food.  I never got to order more than once, and most people on my side of the table had to re-order food or wait forever to order.  If only we spoke Korean!  The payment was a disaster too.  We asked for separate checks (for parties of one or 2 - we all did AYCE so it was same price all around) and we asked before we ordered and again before we asked for the check.  We were refused.  Our waiter gave attitude to Bobby Y. when he brought our credit cards and cash that added up exactly to the bill with gratuity.  Another waiter came over and Jieun spoke Korean with him - he said if he rings all of the cards up, he cannot put in any orders for other guests and they are BUSY (well, we were already there 3 hours hello!) so it would take him awhile.  Instead of going to start ringing our cards up though, he stood there and kept repeating the issues with their system - so I told him to go do it already!    It was an igloo in there - when Eric R. asked for them to turn the a/c up, I think that caused our waiter to hate us.  I had to borrow Nelson Q.'s jacket to survive the hours of hell.  I finally went to our car and put the heat on for 10 minutes.  The only reason I ate enough was that Jane shared some of the food from her side of the table with me, very generously (amaebi, ikura, saba, oysters) - because I never got my full and only order from the 6:15PMish range.  The upside -hanging with great people and meeting new people (Jane, Maria).  The envy - Terri K. bolting after convincing jerk waiter to give her a separate bill.  The downside - Wa still has a sticker on its door saying "People love us on yelp."  I call BS on that!

wgJ-6IQxvjwnlbaW1ViCLw.text: Ok. Seriously this place is amazing.   The best sushi ever. I have never been so satisfied from AYCE.  Wow.  This is my new go too.  My favorite has always been Momo Sushi (which I will still love) but that's it.  This place is outstanding.   Service was friendly and prompt.   The bikini roll is a special and now my favorite.  Also the screaming (you know what) is the best ever.   Happy Eating.

WGMcCbuneftxQ59EGwpq7w.text: We loved Aaron, he was so helpful for our first time here! We will be back and the playlist IS FIRE. Fire playlist, fire food, FIRE SERVICE. thank you Aaron

3hQaILvDVV9tvM8E0Qqxng.text: Very good ambiance and friendly service. The food smells delightful and the selection is huge. I like that sashimi is a standard item in the all you can eat menu. This is overall a very good place and we definitely will come back.

s64ISMuwXSOjx6ThEpbTzw.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Henderson. Fish always fresh and service is great.  Always order the all you can eat.  Best deal in town highly recommend.

ItjWpJ4_Qy_T6NBChDlY2A.text: I came here last night and am happy I tried it but I probably won't be back.  We had a very nice server although she was kind of all over the place.  Several times she tried to deliver our items to the tables next to us and then did the same with the other table's order.  Kind of strange and not so good since it's food related.  Now onto the food!  They do not offer half rolls for the AYCE however they do offer your choice of 1 of the sashimi options which is nice because that is not something that is normally offered at AYCE.  The sashimi came with 4 nice size slices of fish.  Delish!  For the sushi options, they give a lot of rice and are pretty strict on the leftover policy.  They probably give about double what a normal AYCE sushi restaurant would do in terms of rice.  They have a nice selection of mochi flavors including coffee which was so good!  Overall the experience was just OK.  I liked the variety that they offer but the rice overload, no half rolls, and mix ups with orders were a bit too many flaws for me to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

8KU-eYfs3vXYxwDhM5-UAw.text: Finally ! A sushi place open until 4am !!! I don't know why but I'm always craving sushi or just hungry in general around 1am-3am so this is perfect  lol ! We sat @ the sushi bar area so it would be fast and easy, and the sushi chefs were so fun and entertaining ! The service was definitely amazing. I wish I got his name but he was soooo fast as he made everything right infront of us ! All the choices are so different when it came to the rolls but they were great ! The nigiris are AMAZING !!! We definitely took advantage of the "all you can eat" with this one !!! We got almost all the nigiris and tons of orders of them ! For late night sushi craving, this was AMAZING quality ! I can't wait to try more of the other rolls when I come back ! I got lucky to find this sushi place that's open until 4am but even luckier that their sushi is actually super yummy !!!  Definitely a MUST TRY !!

S6xbOB8Uh1ly-18wxjdlmA.text: First time here and It's the best place already for late night A.Y.C.E sushi and more. Would recommend the Pimp my Roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

2Bboh7_K4_T5V8t3tEJ4ZA.text: Super Bomb Sushi spot.  From Ambience, Taste & Service, everything was Great. Came in around 9 for date night & did not disappoint.  Music got a little loud here & there but it was just certain songs and I'm sure they need to to drown out the large parties they have. They play Korean Hip Hop & R&B, here or this particular Friday night anyways.   All the food came out timely, freshly made or sizzling. Our servers Celeste & Miko were wonderful.

Their sushi is excellent quality and their service is always attentive and great. Would definitely recommend if you're ever in the area!!

BSWbikQoKZG7CDQFZlvFOg.text: Sushi wa was phenomenal! Miko is always excellent... we always choose the option of ALL YOU CAN EAT because everything is bomb....

TOFHuI0PF824xWKZwlbIJQ.text: about 2months ago I came to this place and place a to go order. 2  6 piece sashimi orders ($12 each)and a chirashi bowl about $50+ tab. I arrived home to find that my sashimi orders were not 6 pieces but rather 4 pieces each I called to informed them of their  mistake and the waitress informed me that the next time I come by they will credit me for their mistake I asked her who would they know it was me, and she reassured me that they would. today I came in to place another to go order. I spoke to a gentleman at the front and told him my situation, he told me to hold on walked to the back and came back and said he knew nothing about this. I described the person for him in detailed, and he stated he was the manager and nobody has told him anything. I told him ok that's ok and I was about to order, but then i thought to myself why should I give someone business if they cant even honor what they said, plus their food was okay, nothing to rave about, and they are over priced!!  I'll take my business elsewhere!

Y2EUMH6u8sL87B2str8pEQ.text: Walking into the place, it looked nice. Sitting down, the bench was very comfortable. Service was ok. I ordered the Korean spicy ramen combo with a spider roll. The spider roll had eel sauce on it and a carrots inside which made it weird. The other people in my group had ordered sushi also and they didn't care for what they ordered. One person ordered a tempura roll which she thought would be a roll with tempura in it. Nope, it was a roll made tempura style. The ramen I ordered was a little disappointing. I'm sure I'm wrong but it just seemed like top ramen noodles with some added stuff to it. We wanted to come back and try the all you can eat but after experiencing some of the food they served we all agreed that we would t be coming back. Some people might like the sushi here but it was such a departure from the norm that I just didn't like it.

pdyG9kiXEKhSK_axxtHikg.text: Honestly I'm surprised at the high ratings and the few friends who recommended this place. I've been to many AYCE places in town - the fish was not that fresh and everything tasted the same because it all had a weird taste to it. The staff and service were great though!

S9qXwvru-jvG3LFExDX2wg.text: Best sushi we have found in the vegas area.  Only 1 of 2 we will bring people to.  Everything we have ordered here comes out better than expected.

KOyIi50togbe7xVlbKBPEA.text: Mixed feelings towards this place.. I had come here for dinner around 5pm on a Wednesday evening, and I had all you can eat sushi.  The pros of this place is the service and cleanliness! Especially from our specific bus person - a tall lanky fella - who I didn't get to catch the name of, but he definitely was on top of asking if we'd like any plates out of the way and our drinks were always refilled constantly.   Now for the cons which really had to be brought up.. The food quality.  Now I'd understand if it was really busy (which it wasn't whatsoever), but the sushi rolls seemed like it was meh. 6-7/10. Example: The rolls ordered that had unagi (fresh water eel) on top had tiny burnt pieces of eel on top. And the nigiri I had ordered always had a fat piece of rice under the fish.   Now for my lady's bento box she ordered.  She decided to go with the teriyaki beef bento, And it came with everything any other bento box would come with (vegetable tempura, 1/2 roll of California roll, house salad) and it wasn't anything special. Yet it came out to $16.. Definitely not worth it as much.  Sadly I wish I captured photos but I didn't get to..   Overall this restaurant ambience was nice. Dimly lit, and decorated nicely. Nothing bad to say about the servers or restaurant itself.  A good date night for anybody craving sushi in general. DISCLAIMER: *I'm just nit-picky about my sushi quality after going to so many ayce sushi spots* lol.   Thanks Sushi Wa.

jWipbkg5j1tujZ9thBWF1w.text: Celebrating a birthday with our granddaughter, Ordered 2 mild Korean ramen & 2 miso ramen! Korean ramen came out but waited 20 mins for miso ramen until the waitresses asked if we were waiting for something! We said yes 2 miso saimin. The waitresses went to check and said the person who took our order put in miso soup! Well we never got any miso soup so that was a lot of bull!   The guy who took our order came and said it will be 5 minutes, they thought it was miso soup and walked away. I grumbled and said well I never got any miso soup if that's the case!!   Finally, got our ramen!! Delicious but not as tasty if I got it when everyone got their food!

Em64lolE3iv0_THO9LtcFw.text: Very good ambiance and friendly service. The food smells delightful and the selection is huge. I like that sashimi is a standard item in the all you can eat menu. This is overall a very good place and we definitely will come back. One of the best sushi spots in Henderson.

5t7n4lm1PI5mJj0X-6C8jA.text: Great service and food! Always convenient and quick! The food is fresh and hot. I enjoy eating here because there is enough room to order Ayce without bumping into other customers!

7S1iTVk6EHBlZGFK00yezg.text: Came to sushi wa a while back and ended up sicker then ever the next day. Contacted management to let them know of the situation and they told me that they hadn't had any other cases reported and invited me back in to prove they have good quality product. Decided to take them up on the offer, went in and had a decent experience. Tried it again for the third time today. Fish tasted old, fried rolled were harder than a rock, service was slower than molasses, and to top it off, left hungry and decided to go to in and out.

3G-9XGqs9HPPkHWlfPaICg.text: This is my first time here and I must say it's wonderful! Food tastes fresh, and the customer service is great! Especially our by our server miko! Will definitely be returning:)

2MN0Ws7cc5MQEiu_NFU2YA.text: Sushi Wa has always been mine and my family's first choice to visit when we want to dine out for Sushi. Past visits have been good, sometimes great, but to say the least never bad. Food is good, ambience of the restaurant is also good with great music. Last night's visit however makes me think twice about visiting this restaurant.  We were seated in a booth (there were four of us) across from the sushi bar. One server came and took drink orders and provided us with the menus. He appeared to be out waiter but to find out he wasn't. After the drinks arrived and we made our selection we waited for a bit. The server than showed up with our plates, took our order (AYCE). After the first round of order was almost finished we wanted to put in another order and this is when the issue began.  We got our server's attention and asked if we can put in another order - her response was "please wait a little bit". She then proceeded to walk the restaurant, checking on other tables, booth, and bar area, giggling and talking with these guests. About five minutes passed and I again flagged her down and asked her if I can order. Her response "If you put in another order now, because the kitchen is backed up, it will come out slow." All of us with exception of my husband ( as we were all speaking in Korean) looked at her with shock. She was actually telling us that we can't order the food because sushi chefs were busy! It felt as though she was scolding us about our pace and how orders should be placed based on the convenience of the sushi chefs. After the shock settled we advised her that we will be understanding of the wait (as few large tables arrived) and she finally took the order. She continued to "ignore" our table and only visit when we flagged her down throughout the dinner.  At the end of our dinner my mother asked her if we can order dessert. Her response was even more shocking to use. She began looking around the table and noticed three lumps of rice that was left on the plate. She began to lecture my mother how that is not the policy of their AYCE and the restaurants need to charge us for the left overs. She also pointed to where her boss was seating and told us that He had pulled her aside and spoke to her about our table, how we can't continue to leave lumps of rice. She also added that she can be fired by all of this. Then she called out to one of the servers to come and take our dessert order.   I am not sure if this is the service that is given to all patrons at this restaurant or she feels that she is comfortable enough to talk or provide lack of service to us because we are Koreans. I have received better service at Dick's last resort in San Diego and their motto is to be rude (fun rude) to their customers. The way that our table was served and spoken to is definitely not something I expect to receive when spending over $100 at a restaurant. In addition, to be told when I can place my order and getting scolded at the end of the dinner is certainly not the way I wanted end my dinner with my family.  To say the least, Sushi Wa will never be our first, second, or last choice to dine. Our server's performance definitely left us wondering if the money spent was worth is and obviously it is not.

jUF6erjNJ3n_ckJYhAHIUw.text: All you can eat was unbelievable and the price for it is the best in town. Favorite roll was the 4 of a kind; and don't be afraid to try something new. They have a wide variety of things to choose from and this is honestly 1 of the best sushi spots in town

4hgEqnp8CGkp75IGYdUibw.text: My husband and I love sushi! If we could afford it we would be eating sushi like they do in Japan...breakfast lunch and dinner! We've been to sushi places everywhere and we know what we like and we know how much we can eat. Oh did I mention my husband started off as a sushi chef? Well, we went to Sushi Wa with high expectations from one of our best friends...and I must admit...the sushi was great as we were told. But here's the sad thing...the waitress we got every time we go there always limits our orders! I mean c'mon...we know what we wanna eat...and we're paying all you can eat and if we can't finish it you still charge us for unfinished food...so why limit us? That type of service is not needed...and on top of that they always take forever to bring the food and the bill. You would think if we placed a larger order in the beginning then you wouldn't have to worry about coming back to our table. I think it's rude to limit your customers when they're paying to eat All You Can Eat!   I'll score 2 stars on great food and deduct the 3 stars for service.   Sad thing is..my husband and I miss their sushi (especially the nigiri and sashimi sushi). We are not sushi rolls type of people :/  We'll see if we go back or not.

3DsPcVhwW3GaNQqnaaZEKg.text: Sushi Wa is probably the best sushi bar I have ever been to. The food was amazing and the service was great too. Sushi rolls ranged from $8-$14. All in all it was a great experience and I can't wait to go back!

j-dcPWudmho8rUe7btrLrA.text: I would eat Miso Soup, Sushi, and Mochi everyday if I could afford it.  When I can afford it I go to Sushi Wa for lunch or dinner.  The Sushi is delicous and fresh and the service is wonderful.  I have been to this spot six times in the past year and everytime I go it seems like the staff wait on me and my friends hand and foot.  My glass is never dry and they keep the green tea coming.  I love the salmon mango roll!  Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.  The all you can eat includes soup, salad, and dessert.  Yumm-O!  Check it out you won't be disappointed.

QIz861DGlcYbZnFa9YGhRA.text: We lived in Okinawa, Japan for 8 years and, after moving back to the US, missed the great sushi, tempura, etc. and friendly people.  After moving to Vegas in June, we found Sushi Wa and were excited to find the best Japanese restaurant since we moved back to the US!  All their food was PHENOMENAL ('Oishi' - if that's how you spell it in English) and the people were extremely welcoming.  While it's not close to where we live in Vegas, it's worth the trip for the great food, people and atmosphere.

ROqEFpGGAOQobPrn6IEP2A.text: If you do all you can eat, be prepared to wait. They will do "ala carte" first. We ordered 4 items and waited about 20 minutes for each while they fling food to others. Three severing that two tables while we were waiting for ours second order finally I couldn't stand anymore so I asked them "who's actually taking care of our table? The answer was "you are doing AYCE and they are ala carte customers so we served them first" it was unbelievable answer They need to understand that we are not here to eat free we spend closed to $95 (2 adults and one kid) and only had 5 orders... All the rolls look more like CA rolls with different toppings and I noticed that they made the rolls differently  for AYCE orders  and they were ignoring us as well ... Very very disappointing.... Never go back again.... Go elsewhere all sushi lovers ..... this is not the only place in town where you can have AYCE sushi ...

GRw6-FW41ykwZKyGXbY6tw.text: My favorite locals sushi place in the city!  Joon is the best!     Am a little of a sushi purist, so I don't go in much for the rolls, but whether you're into rolls, sashimi or nigiri, the fish is always super fresh!  And, if you are a little adventurous, check the specials board--  fresh orange clam, sea urchin and kobe beef sashimi make frequent appearances...  and don't forget to ask for fresh wasabi.  It is a must have.

FZ4gjkqzVhEcBEqo9kjcqQ.text: They have great nigiri sushi. Its better than going to a buffet where the sushi has been sitting out on the counter. Instead you keep ordering a little bit at a time and all your sushi is fresh. I love the pepper seared ahi nigiri and garlic ahi (garlic ponzu sauce drizzled over ahi sashimi) nigiri. Anything on the menu is game for you to order and as much as u want (they limit your uni and ama ebi to one per person). You can pay dinner price during lunch if you want sashimi. I recOmmend that if you are there for lunch to just pay the lunch price because whatever sashimi you may be craving you can order it as nigiri. Examples of things to order are specialty fusion sushi rolls, nigiri, salads, tempura, bulgogi, kalbi, teri salmon. Dont forget dessert...mochi ice cream, tempura ice cream.

XgUfw891apQc6ZZaEdhV8w.text: OK, this is--THE NEW SPOT!!!-- Really 4.75 stars!!!   They have lunch a specials-1/2 off menu for sushi... Mon-Sat. before 3pm.  The Mexican Roll is a new favorite of myself and the husband!!!! It comes on wantons, no rice... its spicy tuna, onion, mango, jalapenos and im sure a few other things! Its absolutely AMAZING!!! I didnt think i would like it, that was until i saw someone else order it asked what it was and then tried it... OMG, thats all i can say! The Superman Roll is just amazing also!!! (our favorite by far and we save it for last)   They have great Nigiri as well!!!! The Salmon literally melts in your mouth, the garlic tuna is wonderful, the super white tuna, great!!! They have very high quality fresh fish! I just cant say enough good about this place!!!  And and and... If you go there enough you get your very own set of special chopsticks with your name on them that you get to store there, pick up when you come in, use and they wash and keep them there for you for next time your in!! We got ours today!!!!!!! :) I cant wait to go back and use them! Next time i am going to try the Salmon-Bomb!! Which i noticed once i was too full this time! Husband said we could come on sat or mon next week to have lunch and try it!!!! So now Im really looking forward to going back next week for lunch!!!!!!!!!!   We ate a LOT, and i mean a LOT of stuff... like 6 orders of Nigiri and 2 orders of Mexican Roll, a Superman Roll (not on special, so it was $15) and like 3 other rolls as well........ $65 total/tax incl. Not bad at all!  SushiWa, I thank you for coming into my life just when i needed you..... I was just saying to the husband today when we were leaving that we would have to bring Brian (from the Ka) with us to SushiWa so we could see him and hang out and not have to go to the "awful Ka" ...... just a thought?!??

9pQAZ2jkBJjZy7CGlxyfzg.text: I may get a little insulting with this one, so all you five star raters, clench your butt cheeks.  This place made me hate everything that sushi has become. A posh dining room with third rate service and food. For the first time in my life I sent a sushi roll back. They actually dared to serve a mango salmon roll with still green mango that was so unripe, i lacked the drape over the sushi roll.  There is so much wrong with this place that it made me question my taste for raw fish. In Vegas where good food is always a stones throw away, I recommending directing those stones towards this restaurant.

yzmWd0SBmA_H0wa6lQks_Q.text: Great place to eat... A small restaurant with big service and great food. Try the spicy tuna... Try something new I am sure will not disappoint.

wsrm9-IWw8Lq6zNFn4g5dw.text: best sushi in the area. They actually have real wasabi here if you ask for it. The Henderson Roll rocks too, love the sauce on that one.

aEoBnKJ5TL2foEWUFmeEaQ.text: Excellent service. Fresh sushi, with impressive presentation.  The restraunt is very clean and well decorated.  We had the all you can eat and were very happy with everything

q9XappgxY1Ob48Y8bTtIqg.text: I have been to 100's of sushi restaurants in the US and over sea's. I loved this sushi restaurant because of the service, atmosphere and amazing quality of sushi. Recommended adventure dish, ask for the sweet shrimp sushi and ask for the heads with it.  They batter the heads in tempura and are made to eat whole. I promise its amazing, and the taste is out of this world.

aZjmwboC5V0jJJqkdbkk9Q.text: I went to this sushi place because it was across the parking lot from my work place. I only ordered one roll and saw that it was an AYCE place good thing i tried it first the place was terrible. I had the Tiger Roll from there, i tried alot of tiger rolls, but this had to be the worst it was so bland the only taste i got from the roll was the tuna on top that tasted like metal..... seriously if your going to charge $14 for a roll make sure it is good. Needless to say I will not be back

kKkP7ae7Lu5SR5nmKhWxLQ.text: Ok maybe its a bad night. The sauteed calamari smelled like fish out of lake mead, we've been here for over an hour and a half and there's only 2 of us here and the las Vegas roll is as big as an onion ring. Seriously?

C4C5-dgFyLnTrOQmdB7w3g.text: Good food! The service needs improvement. We needed to make eye contact or wave them down when we needed somethIng. It seemed like they forgot about us.  Other than the service I recommend eating there.

Y0R1guwTL91H4fg7VplrTg.text: Worst sushi bar ive ever been!! Service sucks the server was very rude and slow. And all sushi has too much rice. I dont even wanna give one star for this restaurant.

lB1ltZsLzhgkJoGpVsaRwg.text: Where to start... This is not an authentic Japanese restaurant!  We sat at the sushi bar, but can't order directly to the chefs in front of us. Why??because we had the all you can eat menu.  When you have an all you can eat menu and put tons of restrictions;  it is not all you can eat. I guess that's why we had to order from the wait staff. They were the ones to make sure we didn't order anything not on the "all you can eat" menu. The good part.. The fish was decent, but something is always lost in translation when non native people try to present themselves as authentic! I would have given this place a high rating, but they choose to play the bait and switch game with their customers. We got our bill and saw that they included gratuity in all our bills even though we had separate checks. They even charged more than the percentage stated(also mentioned by Andy S.)  So, I won't be back!

PADNoaZqMie-9kVanSckSA.text: Sushi Wa in a convenient location with awesome food! Highly recommend the seaweed salad!

KTMeikENbuC9HEJH92yUYA.text: Me and my best friend come to this place the most for our sushi craving for this very reason: Best quality of fish with the most affordable price.  I always start out with a seaweed salad- their portion size on this one is small but it's not a big deal because you get so much food later on that it's a great starter.  Then I pack on nigiri, everything from big belly tuna to seared pepper to yellowtail and salmon. Their fish quality versus some cheaper joints like Blue Fin & Daisho knock them out of the water and give the most bang for your buck if you're a fish lover like me. And for these, they don't scrap you on portion- I could barely fit the whole piece in my mouth. Still did and it freaking MELTED with flavour.  My friend ordered Shrimp Killer- good for people looking for a lighter choice. It didn't come with much eel sauce but when we ordered a second one with extra it was overkill so just compensate with soy or something.  I ordered a Salmon Crunch- much more on the heavier side which is why it only came with six pieces because one piece feels like an entire roll. But very cooked and comes with two sauces on the side to dip them in.  We picked off the rest of my friends scallop crunch roll when the manager Gio (who'd been serving us all night as well) came up to check our IDs for some complimentary drinks for being such frequent customers. This really made up for the off putting vibe we got from the female server who silently got our menus and took our plates with frozen ice on her face.   Nonetheless he really made us feel welcome by remembering us and appreciating our feedback on social media. I got to sample a light peach sparkling sake while my friend got a raspberry sake straight. I would've enjoyed more of it if I weren't driving but it was a great cap to a great meal next to the always amazing banana tempura that is a must for leaving room for!  Beyond satisfied for this trip, already looking forward to next time!

Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States. Sparkling peach sake
Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

LZbJt_98oazhmAlMoeLVoA.text: Great place for a date night. We did all you can eat and the sushi was extremely fresh. My boyfriend loves nigiri and the fish portions were way more generous than many other all you can eat sushi places. I highly recommend the wa salad. We will definitely come back!

bvQUW4BT6Ip53pxRcO8oJQ.text: We came on the 4th of July and it was not busy what so ever . I enjoyed that we were one of the few people in there. We got seated right away and the service was great in the beginning. Our server was very friendly and helpful. The only complaint about service I have is that we didn't see her again toward the last 45 min we were there. We had a different waitress and we weren't asked if we wanted anymore rolls( not that we did ) just if everything was ok once and then once when we asked for the check. we did get our waters refilled many times so that was good. The rolls were very good. I didn't get to try too many since they don't do half rolls (least favorite part about this place). So it made me feel like I didn't get my money's worth. But I would return. I just couldn't give it 4 stars due to the original waitress disappearing.

8It3E2mDR2p4bRefP2OPmg.text: Sushi Wa a couple months ago was just another sushi spot for my girlfriend & I to try, but now it has become the ONLY sushi restaurant we attend. Three things blow it away from every other sushi spot; 1. The food 2. The cleanliness 3. The friendly staff. The entrees that are available to eat with AYCE are delicious along with the fresh, mouth watering sushi! The tuna sashimi just melts in your mouth! Also, every time you walk in, and once seated you are in awe of how consistently clean the restaurant is. Dirty dishes never stay on your table for long at all! Lastly, but not least the staff here is always greeting you with a smile from beginning to end! Their priority is making your lunch/dinner a meal to remember, and eventually return to dine on the amazing delectable food! SUSHI WA IS THE PLACE TO BE PEOPLE!!!!

pDXUWWdN3R0smdPge2wOVg.text: Fish was very fresh and the staff was friendly and very attentive.   The atmosphere was very nice and really clean. We sat at the bar and the sushi chef was quick to take out order and got it out right away.  My favorite was the spicy salmon roll.  It was super fresh and the avocado was ripe and creamy.  It was very affordable for all you can eat and they are even open till 4am.  Great neighborhood sushi restaurant.

Dn4hSNLmas4oW361oXMCMw.text: Sushi is great and the staff is very quick and helpful. The Pepper Tuna sashimi is fantastic.

9WPBGKHOs2IrolfXOEpOkQ.text: Cute and cozy restaurant tucked away in the corner of this center. AYCE Sushi and full menu options.  We split a bunch of AYCE menu items - loved the Avocado lover which should have been called the CRAB LOVER! Stuffed with crab and pickled jalapenos.  I'll be back!

ln3jBgekuD_K0g-Nd7LfrQ.text: Was in the neighborhood & craving Japanese food. Saw Sushi Wa & decided to try it. So glad we did! First thing that impressed us was the menu sign at the door telling us they are open til 4am!! We were further impressed when we walked in & saw how nice the ambience & decor was. Some people were walking out as we walked in & I asked them how it was. One guy right away said " it's always good!". Because of what he said my expectations were pretty high - I was not disappointed! We decided to do AYCE so we could try as many things as possible to see what we liked. They had a lot of items to choose from. Our favorite was the kalbi (beef short rib on the menu). The only thing I didn't care for was the ponzu sauce they put on the nigiri I ordered. They did offer to remake it without the sauce but I decided to try it. I have just never seen it served that way. Our server was Celeste & she was great. She checked on us often & got everything we ordered right. We're definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Wa - Henderson, NV, United States

IseiW2J-hJTEwVK0xXTWIg.text: worst experienced ever. We have been to so many places, but never been to one like this. They said AYCE for $28, and they'll make sure you must lick your plate clean. before they'll start taking your next order. And they know how to keep you wait forever for your next order. The waitress was already having an attitude the minute we sat down. After a while, we couldn't finished some rice on a couple of rolls. They were really upset, and we offered to pay the extra charges on it. And they still coming at us at the table, about the regulation, on and on. For 4 different times with different people (servers). The situation escalated, when the Sushi Chef ( The OWNER ), came at my brother at table like a PUNK, so angrily,.. We already offered to pay all the extras, but still they wanted to make a scene out of nothing. They did threatened to call the cops, because we couldn't finished the sushi rice. They could've diffused the situation, but no, they wouldn't let go. Seriously, who would act like PUNK, as an owner of a restaurant. After we left, my brother forgot his phone at the restaurant, so he has to go back. The waiter followed him outside, waited and stood there staring, after they gave his phone back. Bad Bad Business... Sorry, felt disgusted.
